story:
We have heard stories of monks and yogi's who spontaneously remember their previous lives.  What if this happened to you?  What would it look like? 

This is exactly what happens to Kevin when he meets a Shaman named Jeseksha in the Andean Mountains of Peru.  He is dipped into windows of his previous lifetimes called V-Paths. He journeys deeply in the world of Spirit to discover a purpose in his present life that will change the face of the world. 
 

The V-Path

Welcome to the story of The V-Path (@2014)

The V-Path is speculative fiction. What does this mean to you? It means you are in for an interstellar, dimensional ride of possibility!  The V-Path crosses limitations of linear thinking and steps into circular conceptual storytelling.  It is a compilation of shorter stories that weave into a larger story.  It is deep, profound, abstract, humorous and it lives beyond perceived reality in multi-dimensions, altered consciousness, portals, with energy beings and so much more!    

The stories address real issues that we are struggling with, within our changing world and put an energetic/fantastical perspective to them.  It gives new insight to many areas where we have been stuck or limited.   It engages the mind deeply in the fluid story lines that span lifetimes, go into other worlds, and traverse the limitations of being in a body.  

The V-Path is a profound book with no question.  Its inception came from seeing so many people suffer with the changes in our current world and the hope is, although being fiction, it will be able to tell a new story of creation where the "victim" becomes empowered and learns what it means to live with the energies of this world.   

Below is a sampling from one of the story lines: 

The V-Path of Ellie

Jeseksha tapped Kevin's vital thread; in doing so, awoke the lifelike images playing out from one of Kevin’s embodiments. Kevin opened his eyes and looked around him as his current consciousness was now awake in a life that he had previously lived. He scanned the room for a mirror to see himself as he had done before to get some clue as to what he might look like and what his life was like in this experience. 

He spotted a mirror in the hallway that led out of the room. He began his walk down the hall and quickly he was seeing that something was wrong.

As he came closer there was no mistaking what was wrong, he was a girl!

Well, a woman would be more accurate.

“What the ...”  escaped his lips as he closed his eyes to connect with Jeseksha.

He heard her thunderous laugh before he could even say a word. 

He then thought firmly saying, “Jeseksha, this is not funny. I am in the body of a girl. How did this happen?”

Jeseksha laughed for another moment. Then her fiery eyes lit up.

“Kevin, do you think you are talking to a ‘woman’ right now when speaking to me? Do you think you are really a man?  Your inner consciousness does not have form. We do not have gender, let alone vocal chords.

“Kevin, you have gone in and out of the male and female form countless times. You have been human and beast, fish and fowl; all the forms that exist in this realm. Your consciousness has slipped in and out of form for the experience of doing so; each form a new experience, and when it was done you moved to another form.

To identify with one gender over another is to not see the wholeness in your own being. You are not split and needing anything to complete you. In your physical being, you are made up of billions of fractals that form your entire body. Each and every fractal is a whole dimensional reflection of the entirety of the Universe. Because of this it is impossible for you to need anything outside of you to complete you. 

Kevin is the name given to your current form. When you were born into the world of souls, you were named Jaevon. When you are finished with the form of Kevin, you will again return to the world of souls as Jaevon.  You have existed before and after and always. You are not bound by the concept of time or the apparent limitations of being in a body. Just as you exist in a form, simultaneously you exist and are woven into the fabric of all life in this world while embodied. This enables a true experience for knowing the self, with entrainment and focus on any element or life form you can know yourself through that form, because that form already exists in you.  You are everything, including male and female energy. 

Kevin feeling like everything he knew had been shattered, (because it had), tried to process in his thoughts that he was not Kevin, but Jaevon? He was not a body... Then what was he? He looked toward Jeseksha and was about to speak when she stopped him. 

With the distinct look of “enough”, Jeseksha pulled her energy back so that further inquiry was not welcome by Jaevon. Jaevon paused, then redirected his attention to the current embodiment.

He opened his eyes and found himself again looking in the mirror. He assessed his physical appearance and found himself to be an attractive female, her chestnut hair pulled back from her light olive skin and almond shaped green eyes. The complexity of this concept finding himself...uhh, herself, attractive was awkward and he saw her blush in the mirror.  He thought about what Jeseksha had said and thought, I am not a man? And, I am not a woman?  I am a Jaevon?  What a trip!   

The V-Path @2014

Continued Progress for The V-Path...

In today's cyber world a presence needs to be cultivated. In the interest of being resourceful and savvy, we have taken classes to build our website and media platform, but as we are finding, this is only the beginning of our adventure in social media.  Part of the funds raised will hire those who really know what they are doing in this area so we can do what we really know how to do, which is write...   

We are raising funds for the following:

* Creative Support (We are forging forward and the pace of this forging is directly impacted by the success of this campaign.)

* Cover Designer (Image and branding is of such importance in today's culture. Creating a cover that appeals and reflects the wondrous experience the book offers is the focus.) 

* Editor (A great experienced editor is invaluable to this book, sharpening even further the laser content we have written.)

* Interior Layout Designer (This makes the book suitable for digital content.  The layout of the book is different for the print format and digital format.)

* Physically Publishing the Book ( Physical books will be limited, but are a necessity for tactile readers.) 

* Advertising (This is a huge "key" to the book's success. Without an advertising & marketing campaign a book will fail to launch.  This is equivalent to having the keys to start the car, without the keys you just sit in the car getting nowhere.) 

* Marketing Strategy  ( New items in this world have to be announced. It is kind of like sending out a birth announcement.  We have excellent plans to make this happen.)  

The V-Path project is just the beginning.  The original book that we started writing is called, "The Guardians of the Void." (@2014) We quickly realized that we couldn't write the depth that the Guardians required without a previous book to build the character development.  This is The V-Path.  It is the first of two currently planned books.  All funds raised will go to The V-Path first to make sure it launches successfully, any remainder will go toward the continued writing of the sequel which is loosely planned for release one year following in September 2016.   We have two solid years of writing ahead of us.  This fundraiser will offset the expenses during this process.  Your contributions will make the difference in how this book comes into being.   Thank you, your support is invaluable to this process.   

Saying we are grateful does not impart the fullness in which it is felt.  We have invested our own time, money, resources, burning the midnight candle, heart, soul, desire, you name it, this project holds this level of passion for us.  Why?  Because we believe life can be so much more and we can make so much more of this world than we have done.  We want to write the stories that teach each other about inner strength, trust, determination and being open to change in perception and change in who we can become.   By supporting this project you support people who believe in humanity and the desire to be a part of making this world a better place.   So, thank you again.   


Wanna Be Part of the Shift into Other Realms? 

Please follow us on Facebook and Twitter so we can announce to you the launch day of the book!  

Also, please sign up on our email list at thevpath.net to receive preview segments of the book as they come available.   

Please share the campaign with the share tools on this page.   Use Facebook, Twitter or any other platform that rocks this realm!  Please, tell your friends, family, your guides and beings in other dimensions! Help us get the word out about THE V-PATH.  :) 

Exceeding our goal is the goal!  This fundraiser is the foundation to making this book a solid reality.  

We can't tell you enough how grateful we are for your support.   

We would love it if you left a comment below to help and encourage us during this campaign. :)

story:
Short Summary

I'm Thom Brown and I'm a student at the University of Sheffield.

The Above and Beyond Party is campaigning on one single issue only: the inclusion of a None of the Above option on ballot papers. That's it, no other political bias or ideologies.

This is important because in Sheffield Central, an above average 40% of registered voters did not vote in 2010. Of those that did vote, there was a diversity of votes, including many for the Liberal Democrats who represented a protest against the establishment at the time.

Clearly, there is disillusionment with the parties on offer. Sheffield Central has the highest proportion of students of any constituency in the country and I aim to use my status to represent the frustrations these young voters have.

Currently, non-voters are trapped outside the system and all I want to do is give a voice to those who care about how their society is governed, but are frustrated at the failure of elected politicians to represent their views.

With this £500, I will be eligible to stand and start actively campaigning. I can pick up the votes of people who don't believe any party is worth voting for, but I can also give a better option to those who normally just vote for the least bad option.

I have the chance to make a real impact in a constituency that is fed up with the Labour status quo and angry at the betrayal of the Lib Dems on the issue of tuition fees.

If you've read this far, but are unsure if you're willing to donate to such a brand new project and fund someone with no experience of running for Parliament, then don't feel you have to donate. The issue here is that people should be allowed to express that they feel no candidate is satisfactory and if you agree, then spread the message. Share this page and campaign as widely as possible and maybe there will be others who can spare some money.

Feel free to get in contact if you can help with campaigning or raising awareness.

story:
La Silla Vacía

La Silla Vacía es un medio digital independiente que cuenta cómo se ejerce el poder en Colombia desde hace seis años. En un país donde los medios tradicionales están muy cerca de los poderosos ya sea porque son de propiedad de conglomerados económicos o porque tienen una filiación partidista, La Silla Vacía ha demostrado que es capaz de contar todo lo que sabe y de saber todo lo que cuenta.

www.lasillavacia.com 

La campaña de Súper Amigos 

Desde hace cuatro años arrancamos esta campaña de Súper Amigos que hacemos solo una vez al año y que nos ha permitido, a partir de las donaciones de nuestros usuarios, expandir nuestro trabajo y fortalecer nuestra independencia. 

¡Vamos por los mil Súper Amigos!

No queremos un millón de amigos, nos bastarían mil Súper Amigos. Para conseguirlos, arrancamos hoy nuestra campaña de donaciones con los usuarios de La Silla Vacía, el evento que hacemos todos los años y que siempre nos pone un poco nerviosos porque lo consideramos nuestro mayor indicador de éxito.

Hacer periodismo de calidad e independiente es mucho más fácil si contamos con el apoyo económico de nuestros usuarios. Desde hace tres años las donaciones de nuestros Súper Amigos han financiado el desarrollo de los proyectos que más orgullo nos han generado: el Quién es Quién, La Silla Llena, El Polimuseo, el Proyecto Rosa, entre otros.

Con los 89 millones que recibimos la vez pasada de 740 Súper Amigos, nos comprometimos a crear una pata regional de La Silla y hacer un cubrimiento regional más especializado y presencial en las elecciones de 2015. También nos propusimos desarrollar una serie de contenidos en torno a los pequeños poderes.

La Silla cumplió. Creamos no una pata sino dos: La Silla Caribe y La Silla Santandereana, que han hecho que este medio haya dejado de ser cachaco. Gracias al apoyo de estos Súper Amigos, con cuatro periodistas viviendo en las regiones cubrimos estas elecciones desde el terreno y con otros ojos.

También desarrollamos nuestra serie “El poder por dentro” y nos aventuramos a explorar un periodismo alrededor de los derechos de los consumidores, en el que sentimos que nos quedamos cortos.

Esta vez, y dado el crecimiento que hemos tenido, vamos por los mil Súper Amigos.

Sabemos que es difícil, y que el riesgo de fracasar existe. Pero tenemos esperanza. Primero, porque cambiamos de plataforma para las transacciones y esta es fácil de usar y nos han garantizado que no se va a caer. Segundo, porque ahora tenemos muchos más usuarios. Y tercero, porque confiamos en que nuestros usuarios valoran nuestra independencia tanto como nosotros. Al punto, que están dispuestos a ser verdaderos socios de este proyecto.

Dependiendo de qué tan generosos sean nuestros usuarios, invertiremos los recursos en financiar el próximo rediseño de La Silla y en abrir otra pata regional.

story:
"When I Read..."

Books are awesome, and so are the kids that read them.

When you read, you open yourself up to a new world full of people to meet, places to go, and things to see. You meet valiant heroines and heroes, setting out on courageous adventures towards undiscovered lands, with risks just waiting to be taken. When you read a truly great story, your life is never quite the same.

When I Read… is an exploration of character education for young readers. Through the eyes of an unnamed everygirl and her pup sidekick, this story encourages kids to look at what it means to be their best selves - how your attitudes, values and choices ultimately make you who you are.

A delightful picture book with accessible text and beautiful illustrations, When I Read… offers an ideal mix of entertainment and education for young readers. In joining our heroine along her journey, kids will find the chance to look at themselves with a new perspective, and learn what it means to persevere, show respect, have integrity, and so much more.

This Indiegogo Campaign

With your support, When I Read... will become a reality. The funds from this campaign will go towards the costs of printing Kelly's first run of books - from design to publishing, we'll have the full production cycle covered. And of course, with each level of contribution, there's a copy of the story in it for you : ) 

Contact

If you have any questions about how the fundraising works, please click to reach out to Dan. Or if you want to know more about the story, you can connect with Kelly for more info.

story:
What is Blind Date with a Book Project?

We wrap gently used books with recycled materials and tag them with clues, so you can go on your very own “blind date” with a book. Aimed to preserve the printed word and revive the love for reading, the “blind date with a book” is the perfect way to explore new genres and give used books a new home. We are passionate about education and spreading literacy in local communities and are committed to the one-for-one model— for every book purchased we will donate one to a school of your choice. 

Why are you doing this?

I grew up with a passion for reading and have hundreds of printed books in my home. It was disheartening to see local bookstores closing down and my friends getting less and less excited about reading. While I interned at Los Angeles Magazine during my sophomore summer of college, I saw the amount of books that publishers sent for review left untouched in the office. I decided to take them home and create this project to help these books find new owners. Since then, I’ve done three mini sales at USC and have sold out every time! I loved doing this project and I decided to set the goal of expanding it into a small business that helps others. That’s why I need YOUR help!

 

What we need + What you'll get

I’m trying to raise a minimum of $5000 to fund the cost of making this small project into a small business. The costs would include: wrapping, shipping and handling, art, trademarking logo, marketing, which I will explain more in the Risks and Challenges header. My unique perks include a social media shoutout, stickers with our official logo, personalized books, and even a chance to be treated out for coffee. If I don't reach the goal, I won't be able to get ANY of the funds. 

Impact and Future Plans

Every contribution you make will make a HUGE difference. Inspired by the one-for-one model of TOMS shoes, we are donating a book for every book purchased. However, we have bigger plans for the future.

Eventually, Blind Date with a Book wants to 

- Become a subscription box that delivers a book every month to your door according to your preferences

- Donate proceeds as well as books to local communities in need

- Expand our impact all over the United States

Risks & Challenges

We value transparency and one of the greatest challenges in pursuing this business was figuring out how to outsource labor. Since our first few sales were small, my parents and I would often spend late nights wrapping books individually. Other times, I would ask friends for help in drawing and wrapping. However, I know this method is not sustainable. I intend to use my funds to pay for manual labor, fulfillment centers, and artists to make the process more efficient. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can always share my indiegogo page to your friends on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc. 
  • Follow us on Instagram and Like us on Facebook @blinddatewithabookproject!
story_txt:
What is Blind Date with a Book Project?
We wrap gently used books with recycled materials and tag them with clues, so you can go on your very own “blind date” with a book. Aimed to preserve the printed word and revive the love for reading, the “blind date with a book” is the perfect way to explore new genres and give used books a new home. We are passionate about education and spreading literacy in local communities and are committed to the one-for-one model— for every book purchased we will donate one to a school of your choice. 


Why are you doing this?
I grew up with a passion for reading and have hundreds of printed books in my home. It was disheartening to see local bookstores closing down and my friends getting less and less excited about reading. While I interned at Los Angeles Magazine during my sophomore summer of college, I saw the amount of books that publishers sent for review left untouched in the office. I decided to take them home and create this project to help these books find new owners. Since then, I’ve done three mini sales at USC and have sold out every time! I loved doing this project and I decided to set the goal of expanding it into a small business that helps others. That’s why I need YOUR help!

 

What we need + What you'll get
I’m trying to raise a minimum of $5000 to fund the cost of making this small project into a small business. The costs would include: wrapping, shipping and handling, art, trademarking logo, marketing, which I will explain more in the Risks and Challenges header. My unique perks include a social media shoutout, stickers with our official logo, personalized books, and even a chance to be treated out for coffee. If I don't reach the goal, I won't be able to get ANY of the funds. 

Impact and Future Plans
Every contribution you make will make a HUGE difference. Inspired by the one-for-one model of TOMS shoes, we are donating a book for every book purchased. However, we have bigger plans for the future.
Eventually, Blind Date with a Book wants to 
- Become a subscription box that delivers a book every month to your door according to your preferences
- Donate proceeds as well as books to local communities in need
- Expand our impact all over the United States

Risks & Challenges
We value transparency and one of the greatest challenges in pursuing this business was figuring out how to outsource labor. Since our first few sales were small, my parents and I would often spend late nights wrapping books individually. Other times, I would ask friends for help in drawing and wrapping. However, I know this method is not sustainable. I intend to use my funds to pay for manual labor, fulfillment centers, and artists to make the process more efficient. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can always share my indiegogo page to your friends on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc. 
Follow us on Instagram and Like us on Facebook @blinddatewithabookproject!

story:
La Novela

Un enigmático y oscuro vendedor llega a Villa Esperanza, un lugar perdido en medio de la gigantesca Buenos Aires, ofreciendo  máquinas que pueden convertir a la gente en millonaria de la noche a la mañana. El trato es sellado por un político que busca poder, y al ver la oportunidad de su vida, se convierte en el intermediario para que los milagrosos artefactos pasen del vendedor a cada familia del pueblo. Pocos intuyen que a la sombra de las máquinas de hacer billetes se oculta una enmarañada red de despiadadas intenciones que irá transformando a Villa Esperanza en un pueblo condenado al peor de los destinos.
          Solo un puñado de vecinos tozudos e incorruptibles se atreverá a interponerse en los planes del vendedor y su tribu, que se va volviendo más poderosa a medida que la mayoría de inocentes pueblerinos imprime un billete detrás del otro, billetes que desde temprano empiezan a mancharse con sangre, ambición, traiciones y pecados imperdonables.

El Autor

Javier Debarnot, nacido en 1976 en Buenos Aires y residente en Barcelona desde 2006, ha finalizado las carreras de Periodismo y Publicidad, trabajando durante los últimos años como copy creativo en diversas agencias de Argentina y España. Ha ejercido su rol como escritor novel desde la adolescencia, incursionando en distintos géneros como cuentos breves, novelas, guiones teatrales y cinematográficos. Algunos de sus textos literarios han sido finalistas en concursos literarios y publicados en antologías de relatos junto a otros autores.

Una Muestra

«“Las máquinas, las queremos ahora”. Los pensamientos más atroces y los sentimientos más oscuros se habían apoderado de esa multitud saqueadora con procedencia de Diamante. “Torturamos sin piedad, pegamos duro a hombres y también a mujeres y niños si se interponen. No somos hombres ahora, somos un ejército de hijos de puta sin corazón. Ya pasó su hora de usarlas, ahora las máquinas son nuestras. Nadie nos quitará la ambición de la cabeza, esa obsesión enfermiza que tenemos de poder hacer un billete detrás de otro. ¿Acaso se creían que ustedes podían merecer este tesoro más que nosotros? Las queremos ya. Sufran y lloren. Agonicen. Sepan que su ambición de ayer se convierte en sus tumbas de hoy. ¿Van a dejarse matar sólo por la plata? A nosotros nadie nos toma por pelotudos. Desde este momento, Villa Esperanza es historia. No vamos a dejar nada en pie, sólo cadáveres. A nadie le va a interesar este lugar, lleno de sangre que mañana será silencio. Las máquinas, todas las máquinas. Suéltenlas ya. No hay dónde esconderlas. Sufran. Mueran. Agonicen en este gran cementerio, pero no se olviden de que vivir en Villa Esperanza no tiene precio, pero morir, sí. La muerte se paga con máquinas de hacer dinero, o es más bien al revés: las máquinas de hacer dinero se pagan con muerte”.
          Cuando anocheció, los saqueadores se reunieron en la plaza principal. Las nubes se habían abierto y el cielo por fin se mostraba azul, un azul oscuro, casi negro, plomizo e inquietante. Sombrío como el aire, que despedía un hedor insoportable, un aroma a malicia, a pecado mortal y a destrucción. Los diamantinos encendieron antorchas y contaron su botín: trescientas treinta y tres máquinas de hacer billetes. Era una buena recompensa. Nadie se iba a poner a contar cuerpos tirados en las calles, plazas y casas del pueblo, pero por cada artefacto habían sido asesinados tres esperantinos. Casi mil en total, sobre los dos mil que vivían en Villa Esperanza apenas un mes atrás».

El Objetivo

En esta campaña preventa nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el equivalente a 55 reservas, es decir, 930€, recibiendo quienes participen el libro en su casa sin gastos de envío (en España) antes de que entre en circulación... existiendo incluso la opción de reservar el libro con tu nombre en los agradecimientos por un poco más del precio de venta, como detalle exclusivo.

También, usando la opción BACK IT, podéis realizar donaciones a la edición; opción a través de la cual no se os pedirá dirección de envío porque no conlleva contraprestación de ningún tipo.

Media

Por otro lado, independientemente de que colaboréis realizando vuestra reserva o no, en ocasiones no se puede, sería una inestimable ayuda que os hicieseis eco de esta campaña a través del boca-oreja o por redes sociales... la Cultura, Distrito 93 y Javier Debarnot os lo agradeceremos.

story:
Story of My Book

The Game Plan is a fantasy novel that explores the lives of the children of angels and demons as they grow up and deal with their powers on Earth. The main character possesses the only power that no other person in the universe has — controlling the mind. This leaves her struggling to fight everyone who wants her unique power and dealing with the internal conflict of not knowing how to use them at the same time.

My name is Alisha Sehgal and I am the author of The Game Plan. I wrote this book because I have had this idea running through my head for over a decade. Although my main focus in school has always been in STEM, I have never failed to love the arts, especially writing. The plot of this story has grown up with me. It is inspired by the life lessons I have learned and I finally got the courage to write it all out to share with the world.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover themes of gaining confidence in oneself while also being entertained. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to escape from your own struggles but also learn alongside Sam Bleu about the importance of using one’s struggles to become stronger.

THE NOVEL:
The book follows the Bleu family as they navigate their lives as orphans with powers on Earth. Sam Bleu, the youngest of five, possesses a gift of mind control on top of her being fire. This gift comes from their late mother, who was a powerful angel. Her siblings are earth, air, water, and time. Since their father, the devil, left them on Earth, the eldest brother, Keith, has turned evil and is after Sam’s gift. I want to depict, through the thick veil of fantasy, that oftentimes power is what hinders people from doing what they truly want (even though most people seek power their whole lives). The main character spends most of her childhood trying to figure out how to use these powers that nobody knows about while also trying to hide them from the rest of the world.

Every other power in the universe, including time control, is split among multiple people to represent that there is a balance between good and evil (several other elements of my book allude to this concept of balance as well) and that this balance is necessary for existence, despite the havoc evil may create — or is it?

You will love this book if you love unique interpretations of mythology, books about magical powers clashing with the mortal world, and loved the Percy Jackson book series. The Game Plan speaks to young adults and fantasy enthusiasts who want to grapple with confidence and growing up in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The Game Plan inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How does one gain confidence in themselves, and do you need to know how to do something to be confident enough to do it?
  • How do you find the people who truly have your back, and can those who have their own back ever truly be lonely?
  • How has society clouded our vision of what’s right with the constant push for gaining power?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing our reasons for self-doubt and what may stop us from reaching our full potential will change us all for the better.

The Book - The Game Plan

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the author’s note + chapters 1-12. This part of the book is written in Sam Bleu’s perspective. It deals with her initial struggle to understand her own powers and what she needs in life. She lets the people around her dictate much of her life and lacks the confidence needed to explore what is unknown. We get hints of her rebellious side appearing, but ultimately the end of Part 1 acts as the catalyst for her taking control of her own life.

Part 2 contains chapters 13-15. This part of the book is written through Logan Green’s perspective. This part of the book deals with understanding how life is more interconnected than people, like Sam, think. We begin to realize that Logan serves as a key role in the fight against our main antagonist and get a sneak peak into the life of another kid struggling with his powers in the mortal world.

Part 3 contains chapters 16-17. This part of the book goes back to Sam Bleu’s perspective. We see how she has grown through self-reflection and distancing herself from the multiple voices that previously reigned over her voice.
 

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in Spring 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this April 2021.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Alisha Sehgal is a third year Data Science major at UC San Diego. She has been passionate about writing from a young age and despite never pursuing it academically, she has always escaped through this hobby. Through grade school, she won several Reflections awards for her poetry. Now she is pursuing the career of an author through publishing the first book of what she hopes to be another well-known fantasy series like Percy Jackson.

She wants to share the life lessons she has learned through a carefully crafted plot with mythology and social ideals from around the world. She hopes that in reading her novel, people are able to enjoy and escape from their life but also be able to learn from the struggles of the main characters. She especially hopes that the theme of confidence in her novel helps generations to come realize their own self-worth and importance.

Alisha has a bubbly personality and loves to go on adventures around the world. She is often coined as that friend who never says no to a new experience. If you want to try something new, she’s your go-to.

For more information, you can connect with Alisha Sehgal at alishaseh@gmail.com and at ashes__13 on instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #thegameplan and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!


Thanks again,
Alisha

story:
A Summary

Tilted House is a young print and publishing house created by New Orleans poet Cameron Lovejoy.

This campaign is a catalyst to improve Tilted House's capacity to serve the creative community in New Orleans through the small batch production of broadsides, prints, and handbound books for poets, writers, and other artists.

Tilted House is a small business who keeps the human-, hand-, and home-made quality in bookmaking. Whether digital or hand-printed, these books and broadsides (poetry posters) are made with care.

We’re campaigning to raise money for tools (a new computer, printer, letterpress) and materials (paper, ink, thread, linoleum).

 

A Bit of History

Now to scrap the royal “we”...

Hi, I’m Cameron!

Two years ago, I was introduced to the idea of the “comprehensive poet.” The poet who not only reads and writes but who studies, translates, and performs poetry; the poet with the skills for cover design, typesetting, and letterpressing; the poet who can bind their own books.

Now, since binding my very first chapbook and eventually offering my services to the greater community, I’ve published 3 chapbooks of my own, collaborated with nearly 20 other writers, and have joined the print game.

Tilted House started as a “bedroom book press” (literally situated in a corner of my bedroom) -- but as of January of this year, Tilted House has its own studio space.

And as it turns out, this campaign is not only a celebration of growth but also our one-year anniversary!

 

What You Get

By pledging, you’ll help a poet-owned business thrive in a corporate mire -- while also receiving some pretty rad perks...

Things like:

  • A sticker
  • A handbound notebook with customized pencil
  • An art/poetry print in collaboration with Us and We Art (an inspiration and friend to me, www.usandweart.com/)
  • A digital broadside of original poetry
  • A letterpressed broadside of original poetry
  • A t-shirt
  • A personalized poem
  • Handbound chapbooks of your own work

NOTE: every perk with a "+" includes the previous perks, too. The letterpressed broadside, however, is included ONLY in the $75 perk (meaning the perks above $75 will include the digitally-printed broadside instead of the letterpressed). 

By pledging, you’re keeping handmade art alive!

 

Where Your Money Goes

Since poetry relies largely on paper and less on the tongue nowadays, there are materials I need.

A new computer. I've had my current trusty hunk of buttons for ten years now, but for the past two, it has thrown itself into a narcoleptic fit -- shutting off randomly with no warning. All too often it costs me unsaved content. Not ideal when formatting a book.

A color printer and ink.

A tabletop letterpress machine and type.

For the books themselves:

  • Lightweight paper for the text block
  • Various heavier paper for covers
  • Colored paper for end sheets
  • Glue
  • Thread
  • Needles
  • Scissors
  • Book Stapler

For linocuts and broadsides:

  • Rolls of linoleum
  • Cutters
  • Brayers
  • Paints
  • Ink

 

 

Risks & Limitations

There are very few risks to this campaign, although there’s a slight chance your perk could get lost in the mail.

Patience for the production of each perk is greatly appreciated!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re an artist scraping by or simply can’t support financially at this time, there are several ways you can help:

Please spread the word! Make some noise about this campaign on all your social media platforms.

And you can always donate to the cause later on!

Thanks for supporting local businesses, poetry, and art at large!
story_txt:
A SummaryTilted House is a young print and publishing house created by New Orleans poet Cameron Lovejoy.This campaign is a catalyst to improve Tilted House's capacity to serve the creative community in New Orleans through the small batch production of broadsides, prints, and handbound books for poets, writers, and other artists.Tilted House is a small business who keeps the human-, hand-, and home-made quality in bookmaking. Whether digital or hand-printed, these books and broadsides (poetry posters) are made with care.We’re campaigning to raise money for tools (a new computer, printer, letterpress) and materials (paper, ink, thread, linoleum). A Bit of HistoryNow to scrap the royal “we”...Hi, I’m Cameron!Two years ago, I was introduced to the idea of the “comprehensive poet.” The poet who not only reads and writes but who studies, translates, and performs poetry; the poet with the skills for cover design, typesetting, and letterpressing; the poet who can bind their own books.Now, since binding my very first chapbook and eventually offering my services to the greater community, I’ve published 3 chapbooks of my own, collaborated with nearly 20 other writers, and have joined the print game.Tilted House started as a “bedroom book press” (literally situated in a corner of my bedroom) -- but as of January of this year, Tilted House has its own studio space.And as it turns out, this campaign is not only a celebration of growth but also our one-year anniversary! What You GetBy pledging, you’ll help a poet-owned business thrive in a corporate mire -- while also receiving some pretty rad perks...Things like:
A sticker
A handbound notebook with customized pencil
An art/poetry print in collaboration with Us and We Art (an inspiration and friend to me, www.usandweart.com/)

story:
Story of My Book

Strengths in the Mirror walks you through five sets of thriving tools and how to use them to prepare for life’s challenges. Be inspired to grow no matter what!

My name is Liana Lianov and I am the author of Strengths in the Mirror. I wrote this book because I could see many people struggling during difficult times. People are looking for ways to build their ability and confidence to do well no matter what bumps in the road of life they encounter.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the tools that you have at your disposal, the strengths you carry to face anything. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the science of flourishing and positive psychology to support health, happiness and becoming your best self even in the worst situations. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as the key inspiration and guidance to maintain your own toolbox of thriving tools.

In this book, you'll learn about the intersection between health and positive psychology. You will learn to grow, not only in spite of challenges, but because of them. You'll hear stories such as the story of Dr. Mark Rowe who was able to bounce back and start a new medical practice after he lost everything he had worked for when his clinic burned to the ground. You'll also learn from the Dr. Dean Ornish, the world renowned leader in using healthy lifestyles to treat disease, who early in his career struggled with suicidal depression, and turned his life around. You'll hear from other experts in health, medicine and positive psychology and how they keep themselves invigorated, positive, healthy and happy in everyday circumstances, as well as major traumas.

You will love this book if you are looking for inspiration to do what it takes to build yourself up no matter what happens. You’ll also enjoy this book, if you are someone who likes stories about how others find ways to navigate life’s ups and downs. You’ll want to reach for this book if you’re drawn to hear from experts in health and happiness about their thriving secrets.

Strengths in the Mirror is a nonfiction book that speaks to individuals who have faced challenges and want to be better prepared next time. The book also speaks to those who are eager to avoid struggles and fully harness their personal strengths and happy, healthy habits.
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #bookstrengthsinthemirror and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Liana Lianov

 

About the Author: Liana Lianov

Liana Lianov is a physician leader in lifestyle medicine. Through her presentations and new nonprofit organization, she is uniquely supporting the health care community to harness positive psychology in clinical practice. Dynamic and persuasive, she is working to convince busy health practitioners that they should prescribe positive activities to all of their patients.

Dr. Lianov’s enthusiasm and passion for propelling others to become their happiest, healthiest and best selves shine through in her recent book. This book is a product of her strengths of envisioning an easier future for all of us by harnessing our internal strengths and building essential habits. Many individuals are dealing with stress, anxiety, sadness, substance misuse and low life satisfaction. Yet, solutions to avoid the struggles are available at their fingertips.

Although Dr. Lianov is actively engaged in and focusing on promoting positive psychology applications with her health care colleagues, she is also curious about ways to connect with and nudge anyone seeking to flourish and promote their well-being. This book offers that nudge.

While Dr. Lianov is working in several health and medicine roles, she also enjoys raising her young daughter and creating pastel and oil paintings.

For more information, you can connect with Liana Lianov at friends@myhappyavatar.com and at linkedin.com/in/lianalianov.

story:
Synopsis

After reading an unknown name on the gravestone at his grandmothers funeral, Alec finds out about a long kept secret of his family’s dark history. At just eighteen years old, a close relative lost their life at the same time as his uncles passing, but this other mysterious member was kept secret from him. A journey of self-realization and a desperate search for closure sets Alec on a course to the last known location of this mysterious family members whereabouts. He seemingly bites off more than he can chew, when his truck breaks down and a deal to get him back home ends up costing him more time and effort than he knew he would need. Caught between helping those in need that he just met, and making sense of the dark forces plaguing his path Alec struggles to find meaning in his predicament. After he thinks he has found exactly what he needed, who he meets, where he is and what really happens isn’t at all as it had seemed.

My name is Adam Basma and I am the author of There’s a Tale In-between. I wrote this book because I wanted to use my background in creative writing and social justice slam poetry to create a story that is both thought provoking and entertaining to any kind of reader. I wish for readers to come away from this book with a refreshed and enlightened energy toward helping those around them and being more involved with their peers. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a deeper understanding of the people around you and just how much a persons life is dependent on their surrounding. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to think twice about the decisions you make each day, escape from the fear of losing time and the end of life, and learn alongside the other characters just how helpful it is to believe in others and help them seek a second chance.

About Setting

The world of There’s a Tale In-between is just that, a tale. Between life and death lies a tale that everyone has. Now, whether you go through life knowing what your individual story is, or it takes time until your after-life to realize, they are present for all of us. This book spans the journey of a few characters, and challenges the reader to see that in a realistic and normal world, there are lessons and opportunities for growth all around us. Even the most boring town in the middle of nowhere can hold answers to some of the worlds deepest secrets, and hold adventures with some of the most uncanny characters. That is exactly what I hoped to address in this book and exactly what the reader might take away from it. Look around you and realize that every single person walking through the world can bring meaning and change, whether good or bad, to your life that you wouldn’t have experienced had it not been for them. The world of this book is simple, but the characters add a richness and fascination to the importance of just one human connection that I hope will resonate with readers long after the final page.

Who Will Love This Book

You will love this book if you appreciate the beauty of life itself and the boundless knowledge and change that can be had from one single human connection. If you are interested in spirituality, where we go after-life and thought provoking ways to think about the world around us this book will help to engage you with those ideas entirely.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Fall.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).

You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

The Impact

After holding countless sheets of lined paper, cramped hands making their way slowly down the page, I learned very young that I wanted to be a writer. There is something about the art form that allows people to understand and re-read a chapter, line or single word to fully digest what it is that the author wants them to feel. In backing this campaign you will not only help me to reach my ultimate goal of being a published author, but also help me to share my ideas and thought provoking content to those who can benefit from the lessons and relatable stories that are told inside the pages of this novel. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

About the Author

Adam Basma is a rising senior at UMass Lowell currently working three part time jobs. In the morning he is a funeral assistant, and at night a cook at a restaurant. In-between these jobs he is also a marketing intern for an entrepreneurial incubator at his university, where he learns about and encourages students to engage in social entrepreneurship. When Adam isn’t working he is writing either spoken word poetry focusing on social justice issues, or brainstorming new stories. A lot of his passion for writing this book came from a history growing up of dreaming for this moment, while also tackling complex themes and turning them into more digestible art forms. He believes in the power that just one person can bring to his life, and takes the time to understand and help others wherever they may need, whether at work or in his personal life.

For more information, you can reach out to Adam Basma with any questions at adambasma25@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #AdaminBetween and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:
Instragram - @adambasma25 / @newdegreepress
Facebook - @Adam Basma / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Adam Basma

story:
Story of My Book

From Fraud to Freedom is a book about how we all play a part in contributing to or calming impostor syndrome. It’s a solution-oriented book that discusses methods for individuals, mentors, managers, and friends to manage their own impostor syndrome and helps others in the process too. Even though an estimated 70% of people experience impostor syndrome, the guidance in this book is not one-size-fits-all but filled with a range of intrapersonal and interpersonal methods to achieve your best self.

Inspiration

I was inspired to write this book because we are all experiencing self-doubt and yet, we are not having enough conversations around the various things that actually help to move through it. I also wanted to reframe how we think about learning while simultaneously being expected to perform successfully. Additionally, I want to debunk the assumptions we have about what impostor syndrome looks like and what works with managing it.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what techniques actually work for you to be your best self and to quiet the voice of doubt within. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you rethink how you define your success and to reframe what importance you place on other people’s impressions of you. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for learning, gratitude, and pursuing a growth mindset instead of buckling under the pressure to be perfect.

Content 

In From Fraud to Freedom, you'll learn about developing confidence, practicing self-compassion, building supportive empowering relationships and more. You'll hear stories such as:

  • a director of product management learning to manage microaggressions at work where people would assume she’s the coffee girl instead of the director
  • a CEO of a billion-dollar company learning that more success doesn’t make impostor syndrome go away but learned to turn impostor syndrome as a “force for good”
  • the impostor syndrome that I’ve experienced while leading workshops on impostor syndrome and while writing this book

You will love this book if you prefer books that not only make you feel good but also give you actionable next steps, you’ve experienced impostor syndrome but weren’t sure what to actually do about it, or you work with or mentor amazing people who doubt themselves and you want the resources to help them.

From Fraud to Freedom is a nonfiction book that speaks to you if your work involves learning something new while simultaneously being expected to perform well. This is for you if you want to look at defining success and developing confidence in a new way that doesn’t lead to anxiety and burnout.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in Winter 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter 2021.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition

About the Author

Phyllis Njoroge is a product manager, writer, artist, speaker, podcaster, and content creator. She believes that life should be fair, easy, and lived freely by everyone regardless of the circumstances they were born into. She’s active in increasing diversity and inclusion in STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math) and career coaching aspiring and pivoting product professionals. 

Phyllis wrote From Fraud to Freedom because she noticed that incredibly inspiring people in her network were often talking about experiencing self-doubt and impostor syndrome but there wasn’t enough conversation around what actually helps with it. She saw herself in the women, first-generation students, and professionals of color who were struggling to be confident in their work despite their track record of achievement. Phyllis learned of the term impostor syndrome in college and worked hard to learn how to put herself out there for opportunities despite her own doubts. She has built upon what she learned working through her own impostor syndrome with dozens of interviews and psychological research that have gone into this solution-oriented book to help you grow through your own self-doubt.

When Phyllis isn’t writing, you can find her reading with her non-traditional book club, fumbling over piano keys, skating, and laughing uncontrollably at memes.

For more information, you can connect with Phyllis Njoroge on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/phyllis-njoroge/ 


 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  1. Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  2. Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  3. Use this form https://forms.gle/HmqHkWD5ZtHeyQiH8 to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days).

Here's how:

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #FromFraudtoFreedom and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag: 
Instagram -@fromfraudtofreedom / @newdegreepress
LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/phyllis-njoroge 
Twitter - @impostorphyllis / @NewDegreePress


Thank you so much for all of your love and support!


Thanks again,
Phyllis Njoroge

story:
The Story:

In 1968, C.W. “Bill” Truesdale founded New Rivers Press as an independent publishing house to provide a voice for new authors. Today, New Rivers Press honors Truesdale’s tradition with a dual mission: to connect the best new and emerging writers and storytellers from across Minnesota and the world with eager audiences and to provide hands-on learning opportunities for students interested in entering the publishing world after graduation. Our recent titles have won awards for Best Short Story Anthology, Best Short Story Collection, and have been runners up in several contests.

In fall of 2016, New Rivers Press will be publishing eight new titles, including prose and poetry from writers from all walks of life, living across the country and around the world. Our titles are selected as the result of three international competitions (The American Fiction short story contest and the Many Voices Project competitions in Poetry and Prose) and through open submissions. We want to continue providing a platform for the greatest writers of prose and poetry to share their voices, and we want to expand the support we can provide to our authors. That’s where you come in.

What We Need:

An 88 page book of poetry, after designing the cover and the page layout, printing and shipping galley review copies, several rounds of edits, advertising, and printing and shipping the final books, costs around $1,500 dollars. A 300 page book of prose costs approximately $2,500. All told, the eight books we are publishing will cost about $16,000. In-house ebook production is $750 ($150 for each of five prose titles). Advertising in a publishing year, for contests, events, conferences, and festivals, costs about $5,000. Shipping our books to our distributors and to individual buyers from our office costs about $1,100 a year. We currently pay $1,000 honorariums to the winners of each of our three contests (and $500 and $250 for second and third place respectively in our short story contest, alongside paying our judges for their hard work and dedication). Altogether, Honorariums account for $6,000. Including Indiegogo fees (projected around $1,650) and the percentage donated to our fiscal agent (about $2,500 to Minnesota State University Moorhead's Alumni Foundation), our total project goal is $33,000.

What You Get:

New Rivers Press wants to continue providing a place for new and emerging authors’ voices to be heard. We want to expand our support of those authors, and to do so, we need the support of our audience. We are looking for a few big-budget donors, but we understand not everyone has those means, and welcome and appreciate donations of all sizes. Though MSU Moorhead's Alumni Foundation, New Rivers Press has 501(c)3 non-profit standing, so in addition to the incentives denoted below, all donations to this project are tax deductible!

$1 Good Samaritan

New Rivers Press loves all of its friends! Thank you so much for your support! A pledge of at least a dollar will receive project updates, our eternal gratitude, and a high five if we ever meet you in person.

$5 Friend of the Press

In addition to the above perks, a donation of $5 will get your name on the Thank You page on the New Rivers Press website!

$10 Press Pen Pal

A donation of $10 will receive all the above incentives and a postcard in the mail featuring the covers of one of our 2016 titles!

$25 Little Devil

A donation of $25 will receive a button featuring New River's Press's Printer Devil logo and the $1 and $5 incentives.

$50 Printer Devil's Advocate

Immortalize your name in a New Rivers Press book! A donation of $50 gets your name on the Printer Devil's Advocates Thank You page in the back of all our fall 2016 titles! You will also receive the $1 incentive and your choice of the $5 or $10 incentive.

$100 Benefactor

A donation of $100 gets your name in the Benefactor section of the Printer Devil's Advocates Thank You page in the back of all our fall 2016 titles! Also receive the $1 incentive and your choice of $5 or $10 incentives.

$150 Ebook Sponsor

Converting our prose titles to ebook format costs $150 per book. With this incentive, you can sponsor the production of one of our fall 2016 ebooks! You will get your name on the special ebook sponsor page in your selected title. You will also receive the $100 level incentive. Only five of this perk are available!

$500 Sponsor

This incentive level is the same as the $100 Benefactor level, except your name will appear in the Sponsor section of each of our fall 2016 titles.

$1,000 Tributary

This incentive is the same as the $500 Sponsor level, except your name will appear in the Tributary level of the thank you page.

$1,500 Poetry Patron

Fund the printing of one of our 2016 poetry titles! Becoming a poetry patron will get your name featured on the patron page in the back of your selected title. You will also receive a personalized thank you note from the author of your title. Only three of this perk available!

$1,500+ Patron Saint

A donation of $1,500 or more gets you the same perks as the $1,000 Tributary level, but your name will appear in the Patron Saint section of the Thank You page in the back of all our fall 2016 titles.

$2,000 Prose Patron

Fund the printing of one of our shorter 2016 prose titles! Becoming a prose patron will get your name featured on the patron page in the back of your selected title. You will also receive a personalized thank you note from the author of your title. Only two of this perk available!

$2,500 Novel Patron

Fund the printing of one of our longer 2016 prose titles! Becoming a novel patron will get your name featured on the patron page in the back of your selected title. You will also receive a personalized thank you note from the author of your title. Only three of this perk available!

If we don’t reach our full goal of $33,000, the funding will still go to the projects as outlined above, beginning with funding the printing of our fall 2016 titles.

Impact:

New Rivers Press has a long history of providing a voice to writers from all backgrounds, including LGBT+ writers, women writers, and writers of color. 2016’s titles include two writers from the LGBT+ community, an author who survived a serious car crash that killed his wife and son, and a mother coping with her two-year-old’s cancer diagnosis. You can help us ensure that these important stories, and those of other outstanding writers, find an audience.

Risks & Challenges:

New Rivers Press has been putting out at least six titles a year almost every year since 1968. While eight titles is more than we traditionally put out, we have the increased number of interns and students needed to successfully bring all of our titles to publication. We have student editors and designers who will be working tirelessly with our authors over the coming months to produce the best books possible.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Share our campaign with all your friends! New Rivers Press welcomes the support of anyone who loves books and storytelling!

Thank you!

New Rivers Press Editors and Staff

story:
"There is no home for people like us. It's not what we do."

It's time for a change. There's a pull in the pit of your stomach that you can't ignore any more, and so you start to walk. You never imagined where you would end up.


Cracking is a new storytelling piece, written by Emma Geraghty and presented with Lancaster University Theatre Group. It is a journey. It is the people and the places and the stories that everyone holds within them. It is about tigers and tattoos, cigarettes and circuses, about leaving everything behind and embracing a fear of the unknown.

Firstly, thanks for even visiting this page. If it was intentional, that's great. If it was by accident - you were supposed to be filling in something to do with taxes, weren't you? - keep reading anyway. You may find something you like the sound of.

Cracking is a piece of new writing. It started out as a book, and will be now finding life on the stage of the Nuffield Theatre, Lancaster on the 15th January 2016.
And with your contribution, big or small, we will be able to make Cracking into exactly the show we want it to be.

This is a first for me. I have been writing since I learned how to, but this is the first one I feel can go further, can makes things happen, so I want it to be as good as possible. And although I believe that money shouldn't be a deciding factor in art, it certainly impacts on the show and the book. Which is why we're turning to you for help.

What your money will go towards.
  • Materials for the show - props, set etc. We're going to build a miniature circus out of paper. Very cool, trust me.
  • Printing the book. We're hoping to use the show as a launch for the book.
  • Professional development of the script and the book, with a view to take things beyond the world of Lancaster.
  • Venue costs.
  • Travel costs for the cast and crew.


Why crowd-funding?

  • We have a quick turnaround for the show itself, so this is the most effective way of getting funding.
  • It's not the only funding we're going for! We're also applying for the Nat Merriman Fund, offered to the development of arts in Lancaster.
  • A main focus of Cracking is people working together, and as cheesy as it sounds, I want that to apply to all areas of the project. We want you to invest in the show - it's not just giving money, it's so that people can say they helped to make it. A little bit of Cracking will be yours.


So there it is. That's the story so far. Help it go further.


Thankyou.

Materials for the show - props, set etc. We're going to build a miniature circus out of paper. Very cool, trust me. 

Printing the book. We're hoping to use the show as a launch for the book.
Professional development of the script and the book, with a view to take things beyond the world of Lancaster.

Venue costs.

Travel costs for the cast and crew.


Why crowd-funding?

We have a quick turnaround for the show itself, so this is the most effective way of getting funding. 

It's not the only funding we're going for! We're also applying for the Nat Merriman Fund, offered to the development of arts in Lancaster.
A main focus of Cracking is people working together, and as cheesy as it sounds, I want that to apply to all areas of the project. We want you to invest in the show - it's not just giving money, it's so that people can say they helped to make it. A little bit of Cracking will be yours. 



So there it is. That's the story so far. Help it go further. 

Thankyou.

story:
QbyQ Press presents...


CRIMES
by Sarah Rupp (Richmond, VA)

Poetry / Art book

5.5” x 4.25”

Edition of 111


Crimes is breaking-away and becoming all in one.  If you want to read this book, you’ll have to break into it on your own. You’ll have to be ok with trespassing into the poet’s domain, ripping the plastic, cutting out the poems to re-distribute their meanings, adorning yourself with stolen property.

Crimes has a history, and lives in a wider world of Sarah’s creation. In Sarah’s words -

“the work was made over the summer while working on the manuscript for my speculative fiction novel, which is yet untitled. but the plot is as follows:

 It will tell the story of a teen sex worker in Richmond. it’s future Richmond, which has been walled off from the river floodwalls to the freeway because the wealthy and those with formal jobs have become concentrated downtown/church hill/shockhoe/museum district, while the rest live outside with precarious labor and unemployment. the money is concentrated downtown because most people there work for the medical campus, MCV, which has figured out a way to cryogenically freeze the rich and is in the slow process of uploading their consciousnesses onto a computer. four years before the events of the story take place, there was a mass insurrection, but now everyone is living in the stasis of it and things have returned to a hellish normal. then after a series of police shootings, the insurrections swing up again. there are occupations. there is planning and the seizure of public resources. at the height of it, the insurrectionaries cut the power to downtown and sabotage the generators to the hospital. those that are cryogenically frozen thaw and come back as zombies, which then decimate remainder of the wealthy population in the city, while bands of formerly unemployed teens protect themselves in squats. they blow up the train tracks and the airfield so the army or FEMA can’t come in and then they start to rebuild their own towns on the periphery of the walled-off now-zombie city while austerity riots riff across the western world. the epilogue would leave off with a scene in their new post-capitalist communities where they plan on going into the city again to kill zombies and get access to the medical campus so they can make and redistribute AIDs drugs and insulin.


+DONATE TO CRIMES+

Help us make this unique book real!

Your donation and/or pre-order of Sarah’s book will help us offset the printing costs, as well as pay contributors for their time and labor. 

If we reach our goal of $835.13 we will be able to print 150 copies of Crimes, which will then be distributed to various bookstores in Virginia & New York. The edition size will be 111.


+Budget breakdown+

$ 585.00 - temporary tattoo paper for inkjet printers 8.5"x11" (qty. 300)

$ 51.98 - HP 564XL black ink cartridge (qty. 2)

$ 19.95 - 10 yards- 4 ply waxed irish linen thread (qty. 5)

$ 17.80 - ream of cougar smooth 80# cover (qty. 2)

$ 10.40 - 60# pressure sensitive strata white paper (qty. 100)

$ 25.00 - budget for conceptual packaging design

$ 50.00 - budget for postage and miscellaneous shipping

$ 75.00 - budget for increased, unexpected, and travel expenses


SUPPORT CREATIVE WORK/ERS

Small presses are suffering in a world dominated by mass-market media. Please help us continue to operate. Your money will support not only Sarah’s work, but also QbyQ Press’ ongoing work as bookmakers and independent artists.

QbyQ Press is a not-for-profit small press. We work collectively and collaboratively, and actively pursue compensation for authors and artists we work with. We also provide workshops in bookmaking, and organize events such as Norfolk’s first Art Book Fair (July 2015).

We hand make high quality books that are art objects in themselves. Our books engage with the meaning of the text inside, rather than just binding the pages.


ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Sarah Rupp is 23 years old and lives in Richmond, Virginia. Born in Virginia, she left home and moved to California in 2011 after being recruited to play lacrosse at UC Davis. She dropped out her freshman year and moved to Oakland after visiting the city for an anti-police protest. She lived there until 2014, when she moved back to Richmond to attend Virginia Commonwealth University. Her work has been featured in Mask Magazine, Datableed Zine, and Big Lucks. Poems from this book are also appearing in the next issue of Poetry is Dead. She curates an experimental reading series, CURDS + WHEY, that focuses on platforming artists who incorporate new media and anti-capitalist politics into poetry. She also helps facilitate Richmond's first and only Marxist feminist reading group. Besides going to school and working on her novel, she is trying to start a Taylor Swift powerviolece cover band, Dad Blood, and also is trying to train her dog, Molly Molotov, to come when called. She is super excited to be working with QbyQ press because she thinks their press is innovative and inspiring, and she values their attention to the art and process of book production.

ABOUT QBYQ PRESS

QbyQ is a small independent press based in Norfolk, VA (Christine Rucker) and London, UK (Suzahn Ebrahimian)

QbyQ Press seeks to foster creative connections and growth through collaborative bookmaking. We publish small runs of poetry, art books, and photography, as well as other fragments, journals, sketchbooks, and ephemera. All of our products are hand made.

Our mission is to break down the boundaries between visual/textual disciplines through our bookmaking projects – and we feel that Crimes is a really powerful example of that goal.

We also provide bookmaking services, as well as host workshops and events in our wider communities. 

Video by QbyQ Press. Music by Palm.

Find out about our other projects and printing services here.


QbyQ Press is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a nonprofit arts service organization. Donations for the charitable purposes of QbyQ Press must be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.
