story:
Hi We're Slam ULIT! We NEED your help!

We are 7 artists who have a heart for the art of live performance poetry. We have practiced, trained, competed, and now we are at the point where we need help to fufill our combined efforts.

For slam poets it is a DREAM to be able to compete on a team at the National Poetry Slam, and for us that dream could be realized.  The opportunity is on the table, but we do not currently have the funds to make that happen.

$2,184 6 night/7 days hotel/lodging accomedations 

$3,290 for the team's round trip Tickets to Oakland and back 

$126 for fees though fundraising sites etc.

It will take us approximatley $5600.00 to make it there and be able to survive for a week as a team.  However, for this particular campaign we are attempting to raise half - 2800.00.   

As a team we are actively working towards the full goal by organizing and performing fundraising shows, open mics, and other ventures.  However we really need YOUR help.

ABOUT SLAM ULIT

Slam ULIT was founded December 2014 to address the need for slam culture and artistic community in Kansas City. Slam ULIT is a subsidiary of ULIT (Urban Literation est. 2003) and shares the the same mission statement which is: "Mind elevation through spoken-word, liberation through literacy."

In the 162 year long history of Kansas City Missouri, Slam ULIT is the second Poetry Slam inc. (PSi) Certified slam platform. That's major! Slam ULIT is providing a team of very talented and deserving slam poets the opportunity to show their love for the literary art of poetry and spoken word through dynamic and competitive performances. NPS takes place this year in Oakland, California, from Aug 10-15th, but we can't make it without your help.

WHAT IS SLAM POETRY?

Slam Poetry Is...

A composite genre that combines elements of poetry, theater, performance, and storytelling.

WHAT IS A POETRY SLAM?

A POETRY SLAM IS...A competitive poetry performance in which selected audience members score performers, and winners are determined by total points.

WHAT IS SLAM ULIT?

SLAM ULIT is...The only PSi certified slam in Kansas City dedicated to slam and slam poets, and providing them an opportunity to represent and one of our poetry community's most prolific and historic brands: ULIT, and Kansas City as a whole at the world's largest poetry competition; the National Poetry Slam.


About the TEAM.

Darrell "RV the Poet" Dixon- Born and raised in KCMO. He was the top scoring poet of the night at The Slam ULIT Grand Slam Finals and has featured with Bold Poets of Kansas City performing at the State Capitol during the poetry celebration of Malcolm X day.  He is also a producer, song writer, and pianist.

Sheri "Purpose" Hall- Is the only lady competing on the historic, first slam ULIT team. She is a 2012 Arts KCawards recipient, a RAW artists, host of the Gospel of Poets Radio Show on KPRT 1590,and is a champion for unity in the KC arts community, as evident by her continued allegiance to multiple arts groups and youth mentorship.

Trey Newman- A Kansas City Native and Paseo Alum, Trey has been a 3 time participant in BNV (brave new voices - a national poetry competition for teens) and a "slam monster" around Kansas City with numerous slam victories to his name.

Brandon "Amayzn" Nelson- "Amayzn" has been involved with Kansas City's poetry scene since 2005. He has featured a Jazz Poetry Jams, Poetic Notes, and was the first spoken word artist to grace the stage of the Kauffman.  As a mentor, he has done his part in establishing a stronger foundation for the next generation of artists. 

John "Hypocrace" Lewis- A native of Kansas City and a Paseo academy graduate, He attended UMKC as a theatre major. He has been a part of the poetry community for 4 years and has featured at Soul Sessions, the I Am An Artist Event, and has an upcoming feature at Poetic Notes in the Blue Room.

The Slam Master

M'Vyonne Payne- M'Vyonne aka the HPIC (head poet in charge) is a national touring poet and slam artist. She is a 5-time Jazz Poetry Jam slam winner. She has been an Inspired Word Slam Master Jam Finalist, All Def Poetry Artist of the Day  and is the first black woman to compete on a wild card slam team in the history of the National Poetry Slam.

story:
The Prohibited Rose is a short novel. It is an erotic romance with a historical setting. It has been already self-published in Italy and it has been a moderate success. I would like to translate it so that English speaking readers could appreciate it as well. Will you help me?

What is The Prohibited Rose about?


The story is set at the time of the Industrial Revolution. Rachelle Ramsay is a young healer who has been accused of witchcraft, whereas Evan Beauchamp is an initiate in a secret order who wants to kill her. Everything happens at night. Evan believes that he is about to die and he wants to see Rachelle one last time. Something unexpected takes place and everything they had believed in until then is called into question. In the end, they have to face an important and courageous choice.

This is the amazon link of THE PROHIBITED ROSE's italian version, for those who want to take a look.

http://www.amazon.it/rosa-proibita-Morgan-Caven...




Loyalty is one of the main themes of the story. The question is: loyalty to whom and in what way? Should Rachelle be eternally grateful to a faraway husband, just because he has helped her in a desperate moment giving her dignity back to her? Or should Evan give his loyalty to a reformatory order that still uses unlawful rituals and that provided him with the tools and the strength to quench his hatred and his thirst for revenge, though in a devious way?

In just about sixty pages, I have tried to summarise the lives of two complex characters and, at the same time, I have attempted to give as many details as possible. I have talked about revenge, jealousy, anger and desire mingling them with suspicion, blame and forgiveness to get, in the end, to the promise of a pure love and a true life. However, you cannot achieve happiness without giving something back… and what price will Evan and Rachelle have to pay for it?



London, 1815.  The Industrial Revolution is in full swing. The war between Great Britain and America had just finished and the Treaty of Gand was becoming law. These slightly sketched details are the background of Evan and Rachelle’s love story and they are the frame of a very characteristic historical period when witch hunting was no longer performed, but not completely abandoned.

Rachelle runs a small herbalist’s shop. The shop is renowned for its quality, the kindness of its owner and the services rendered. Evan keeps committing horrible crimes and when he escapes into the woods around London, he is attacked and injured. The climax of the story focusses on the night Evan is about to die and takes place in Rachelle’s living room. The man , who can hardly walk, arrives at her house and when she opens the door, he faints. He is about to die, but he is not scared; she is there and he has seen her one last time, he has managed to hear the sound of her voice once again. She is finally his own, she is imprinted in his soul and no one can take her away from him.


Evan Beauchamp is impulsive, determined, intense and capable of extreme actions. He becomes an orphan when he is a young child and grows up full of hatred and resentment. As an adult, he is consumed by the desire of revenge so much so that he sheds new blood to avenge the blood shed in the past. He has the black mark of the Order of the Willow impressed on his arm. The Order of the Willow is a reformatory order, but its members still perform witch hunting. Evan has been ordered to find Rachelle Ramsey and ascertain her magical skills. The meeting is actually a fatal one. Now he must forget the woman who made him the shadow of the man he used to be. He fell for her, but she belongs to another man. She is the woman he has kidnapped, tortured and kept as a prisoner.


Rachelle Ramsey is an extraordinary woman and Evan cannot forget her. Her independent and proud spirit allowed her to stand up after she had been violated and humiliated. She has to fight an even worse battle now, she has to fight against superstition and ignorance. She knows that that mysterious and fascinating man saved her life, but she does not know if she can trust him completely. Terrible memories of her kidnapping come back to her mind and she is afraid Evan wants to finish his cruel mission.




Usually I am defined as an elegant and precise writer, but maybe I am a bit too refined in the use of a specific terminology. I do not know if this is a virtue or a weakness, especially because I do not really know how much my style can be appreciated by the reader.

Nevertheless, in The Prohibited Rose, I chose a register which is very careful to the historical period in which the story is set. I decided that the characters should always talk very formally to each other, even at the most intimate moments. On the contrary, the narration is simpler, without redundancy and excesses. The historical background is only hinted at through little details that help give a frame to the sequence of events. All in all, I think I have done a good job.



He immediately recognised Rachelle in the small female shape at his feet. When he looked at his arm and chest, he discovered he had been washed. Next to his improvised bed, he could see a pewter with the remains of a mush of aloe, calendula and agrimonia. This too confirmed his idea. Thinking he was about to die, he had visited her the previous night. He had wanted to see her for one last time so that he could close his eyes to the eternal sleep, having her image in his mind and his soul. Rachelle, against all odds, had saved and looked after him. While he was thinking so, an invisible knot tied around his heart and the desire to touch her overwhelmed him. He stretched his hand towards the woman’s head and stroked her soft blond curls gently. She moved, breathed deeply and woke up. Evan withdrew his hand, as if he had burnt himself . The woman got afraid and stood up.

– I did not mean to hurt you, Madame – he promptly said – You were sleeping, I must have touched you by mistake. I had not seen you down there… - he lied, looking away.

– Forgive me, Mr Beauchamp, I fell asleep while I should have kept awake and take care of you – she apologised and left him speechless.

– Rachelle, you looked after me and this means a lot – he said briefly. He moved and spoke again – I have already disturbed you enough… – he added and he tried to stand up as well.

– You are injured, Sir... you cannot leave – Rachelle replied and she leaned her hand on his to stop him. 



“ This writer has developed a very original idea, I was intrigued by the plot. The cover is fantastic and the content as well, so that I can appoint 5 very well deserved stars to this work. The story is really well written. Morgan Cavendish has got a careful and detailed style, but it is never boring, it is pressing and involves the reader from the first lines. This is very useful to get into the story which is told really very well. I would have really liked to read an entire novel about these two characters, because they enchanted me and I did not want to stop reading about them. Evan and his strength, his deep love, but even the pain he keeps inside himself…. I think he has a very captivating personality, the most captivating one in the story. I could feel him inside me and I have lived his feelings and his pain together with him. He is a man who has had a tragic past, but he has a new hope in life. Then there is Rachelle, her courage to face such an absurd accusation. If I had been in her shoes, I do not how I would have reacted. Can you love your own executioner? I think so, I think that you absurdly can. Love goes beyond anything, it is crazy, it is mad, so why should you restrict it? Luckily, there is a happy ending and I loved it.” [Malia Delrai]

“Suspicion and accusation, forgiveness and the promise of a true life, the promise of love. What is the price of happiness? All this is skilfully concentrated in Morgan Cavendish’s short novel: The Prohibited Rose. You can lose yourself in the smoky alleys and dark tiny streets of London with the First Industrial Revolution as a background and most of all, you can savour the intense and refined taste of a story that promises a lot and that, we hope, can be developed in a longer novel. There are all the right premises and they are promising and inviting. The author basis the whole narrative on a fatal meeting and she does so through measured grace, attention to the linguistic register and to the setting. She uses short hints and little details which are always appropriate. The characters have a depth and such an interesting past that they manage to catch you immediately, fascinating the readers and involving them in the plot from the very beginning.”  [Saffron, Harem’s Book]

“What strikes immediately about this story is that though short, it is very complete and allows the reader to get involved immediately, without feeling the sensation that there is something missing. It is absorbing, there is action and a pinch of eroticism, which is full of feeling and never vulgar. All this makes the story very captivating and engaging. Rachelle, the main character, is a beautiful woman, but unfortunately she is a victim of her time. She is an expert in herbal properties and this the reason why she is accused of witchcraft and consequently persecuted by a fanatic group of people who hunt women out of fear and ignorance. On the other hand, Evan has long tried to hide the demons of his past looking for redemption and revenge and following bad companies. In reality, the truth is that all his hatred hides a big pain and the ability to feel strong and all-absorbing emotions. In my opinion, the strong point of this story is the choice of the author to focus on a precise moment, beginning the narration in the middle of things and letting the characters and the events describe the past. That is why the birth of their controversial love and their future together appear credible and possible. The way of writing is elegant, flowing and neat. The linguistic register allows the reader to get the atmosphere of the period in which the story is set. This story is recommended to all those who like romance with a bit of eroticism, but who want feelings as well. ” [Deb, Leggendo Romance]



As I have already said before, I would like to translate this short novel into English so that Americans, British, Australians and all who know this beautiful language can read and appreciate it. I need about 2500 euros to pay a good translation agency to work on my project. Will you help me  reach the budget I need? Thank you in advance... 


           

In addition to writing, I'm a professional graphic designer and all the images (cover, wallpaper, banners, bookmarks and so on) made for my novels are made by me. Below, you can see the wallpaper and the bookmark that you can get to helping me.

Rose about?

Revolution. Rachelle Ramsay is a young healer who has been accused of
witchcraft, whereas Evan Beauchamp is an initiate in a secret order who wants to
kill her. Everything happens at night. Evan believes that he is about to die
and he wants to see Rachelle one last time. Something unexpected takes place
and everything they had believed in until then is called into question. In the
end, they have to face an important and courageous choice.This is the amazon link of THE PROHIBITED ROSE's italian version, for those who want to take a look.http://www.amazon.it/rosa-proibita-Morgan-Caven...

Loyalty is one of the main themes of the
story. The question is: loyalty to whom and in what way? Should Rachelle be
eternally grateful to a faraway husband, just because he has helped her in a
desperate moment giving her dignity back to her? Or should Evan give his loyalty to a
reformatory order that still uses unlawful rituals and that provided him with
the tools and the strength to quench his hatred and his thirst for revenge,
though in a devious way?
In just about sixty pages, I have tried to summarise the lives of two
complex characters and, at the same time, I have attempted to give as many
details as possible. I have talked about revenge, jealousy, anger and desire
mingling them with suspicion, blame and forgiveness to get, in the end, to the
promise of a pure love and a true life. However, you cannot achieve happiness
without giving something back… and what price will Evan and Rachelle have to pay
for it?

London, 1815.  The Industrial Revolution is in full swing. The war between Great Britain and America had just finished and the Treaty of Gand was becoming law. These slightly sketched details are the background of Evan and Rachelle’s love story and they are the frame of a very characteristic historical period when witch hunting was no
longer performed, but not completely abandoned.
Rachelle runs a small herbalist’s shop. The shop is renowned for its
quality, the kindness of its owner and the services rendered. Evan keeps
committing horrible crimes and when he escapes into the woods around London, he
is attacked and injured. The climax of the story focusses on the night Evan is
about to die and takes place in Rachelle’s living room. The man , who can
hardly walk, arrives at her house and when she opens the door, he faints. He is
about to die, but he is not scared; she is there and he has seen her one last time,
he has managed to hear the sound of her voice once again. She is finally his
own, she is imprinted in his soul and no one can take her away from him.

Evan Beauchamp is impulsive, determined, intense and capable of extreme
actions. He becomes an orphan when he is a young child and grows up full of
hatred and resentment. As an adult, he is consumed by the desire of revenge so
much so that he sheds new blood to avenge the blood shed in the past. He has
the black mark of the Order of the Willow impressed on his arm. The Order of
the Willow is a reformatory order, but its members still perform witch hunting.
Evan has been ordered to find Rachelle Ramsey and ascertain her magical skills.
The meeting is actually a fatal one. Now he must forget the woman who made him
the shadow of the man he used to be. He fell for her, but she belongs to
another man. She is the woman he has kidnapped, tortured and kept as a
prisoner.
Rachelle Ramsey is an extraordinary woman and Evan cannot forget her. Her
independent and proud spirit allowed her to stand up after she had been
violated and humiliated. She has to fight an even worse battle now, she has to
fight against superstition and ignorance. She knows that that mysterious and
fascinating man saved her life, but she does not know if she can trust him
completely. Terrible memories of her kidnapping come back to her mind and she
is afraid Evan wants to finish his cruel mission.


Usually I am defined as an elegant and precise writer, but maybe I am a
bit too refined in the use of a specific terminology. I do not know if this is
a virtue or a weakness, especially because I do not really know how much my style
can be appreciated by the reader.
Nevertheless, in The Prohibited
Rose, I chose a register which is very careful to the historical period in
which the story is set. I decided that the characters should always talk very
formally to each other, even at the most intimate moments. On the contrary, the
narration is simpler, without redundancy and excesses. The historical
background is only hinted at through little details that help give a frame to
the sequence of events. All in all, I think I have done a good job.

He immediately recognised Rachelle in the small female shape at his
feet. When he looked at his arm and chest, he discovered he had been washed.
Next to his improvised bed, he could see a pewter with the remains of a mush of
aloe, calendula and agrimonia. This too confirmed his idea. Thinking he was
about to die, he had visited her the previous night. He had wanted to see her
for one last time so that he could close his eyes to the eternal sleep, having
her image in his mind and his soul. Rachelle, against all odds, had saved and
looked after him. While he was thinking so, an invisible knot tied around his
heart and the desire to touch her overwhelmed him. He stretched his hand
towards the woman’s head and stroked her soft blond curls gently. She moved,
breathed deeply and woke up. Evan withdrew his hand, as if he had burnt himself
. The woman got afraid and stood up.
– I did not mean to hurt you, Madame – he promptly
said – You were sleeping, I must have touched you by mistake. I had not seen you
down there… - he lied, looking away.
– Forgive me, Mr Beauchamp, I fell asleep while I
should have kept awake and take care of you – she apologised and left him
speechless.
– Rachelle, you looked after me and this
means a lot – he said briefly. He moved and spoke again – I have already
disturbed you enough… – he added and he tried to stand up as well.
– You are injured, Sir... you cannot leave
– Rachelle replied and she leaned her hand on his to stop him. 


“ This writer has developed a very
original idea, I was intrigued by the plot. The cover is fantastic and the
content as well, so that I can appoint 5 very well deserved stars to this work.
The story is really well written. Morgan Cavendish has got a careful and detailed
style, but it is never boring, it is pressing and involves the reader from the
first lines. This is very useful to get into the story which is told really
very well. I would have really liked to read an entire novel about these two
characters, because they enchanted me and I did not want to stop reading about
them. Evan and his strength, his deep love, but even the pain he keeps inside
himself…. I think he has a very captivating personality, the most captivating
one in the story. I could feel him inside me and I have lived his feelings and
his pain together with him. He is a man who has had a tragic past, but he has a
new hope in life. Then there is Rachelle, her courage to face such an absurd
accusation. If I had been in her shoes, I do not how I would have reacted. Can
you love your own executioner? I think so, I think that you absurdly can. Love
goes beyond anything, it is crazy, it is mad, so why should you restrict it? Luckily,
there is a happy ending and I loved it.” [Malia Delrai]

“Suspicion and accusation, forgiveness and the promise of a true life,
the promise of love. What is the price of happiness? All this is skilfully
concentrated in Morgan Cavendish’s short novel: The Prohibited Rose. You can lose yourself in the smoky alleys and
dark tiny streets of London with the First Industrial Revolution as a
background and most of all, you can savour the intense and refined taste of a
story that promises a lot and that, we hope, can be developed in a longer
novel. There are all the right premises and they are promising and inviting.
The author basis the whole narrative on a fatal meeting and she does so through
measured grace, attention to the linguistic register and to the setting. She
uses short hints and little details which are always appropriate. The
characters have a depth and such an interesting past that they manage to catch
you immediately, fascinating the readers and involving them in the plot from
the very beginning.”  [Saffron,
Harem’s Book]

“What strikes immediately about this story is that though short, it is
very complete and allows the reader to get involved immediately, without
feeling the sensation that there is something missing. It is absorbing, there
is action and a pinch of eroticism, which is full of feeling and never vulgar.
All this makes the story very captivating and engaging. Rachelle, the main
character, is a beautiful woman, but unfortunately she is a victim of her time.
She is an expert in herbal properties and this the reason why she is accused of
witchcraft and consequently persecuted by a fanatic group of people who hunt
women out of fear and ignorance. On the other hand, Evan has long tried to hide
the demons of his past looking for redemption and revenge and following bad
companies. In reality, the truth is that all his hatred hides a big pain and
the ability to feel strong and all-absorbing emotions. In my opinion, the
strong point of this story is the choice of the author to focus on a precise
moment, beginning the narration in the middle of things and letting the
characters and the events describe the past. That is why the birth of their
controversial love and their future together appear credible and possible. The
way of writing is elegant, flowing and neat. The linguistic register allows the
reader to get the atmosphere of the period in which the story is set. This
story is recommended to all those who like romance with a bit of eroticism, but
who want feelings as well. ” [Deb, Leggendo Romance]

As I have already said before, I would
like to translate this short novel into English so that Americans, British, Australians
and all who know this beautiful language can read and appreciate it. I need
about 2500 euros to pay a good translation agency to work on my project. Will
you help me  reach the budget I need?
Thank you in advance... 






           






In addition to writing, I'm a professional graphic designer and all the images (cover, wallpaper, banners, bookmarks and so on) made for my novels are made by me. Below, you can see the wallpaper and the bookmark that you can get to helping me.

story:
Short Summary

If you are a small business owner, it is likely that you have dabbled with digital marketing in an attempt to capitalize on customers online. Perhaps you have a website, or have tried advertising on social media platforms. You will be glad to know that digital marketing and social media are so much more than these basic strategies.

This book is your go-to-guide for discerning digital marketing and social media and understanding how to perfect these as an art, rather than functional steps to build your business. An artist can turn a blank canvas into a stunning masterpiece. You can do the same for your small business if you are equipped with the right tool.

This book will explain how you can triple sales growth, understand digital marketing components and improve your competitive edge. Rocket into Digital and change your business by reading on!

The Book

  • Paperback: Est. 150 pages (Softcover)
  • Language: English
  • Dimensions: 6x9 inches (15x23 cm)
  • Paper: Economy B and W, White uncoated, 50# (75 GSM)


What Others Say about This Book

"The web and the social media platforms have made the playing field for marketing communication much more even. It's no longer only the budget that is the deciding factor of how much reach you can achieve for your business. This book gives the reader an excellent overview of the principles behind effective communication on the internet and an easy-to-read walk-through of all the various channels available."
- John Lemp, CEO and Founder in the Ad Tech Industry


"This is a highly useful book for "old-school" marketing managers looking to update their skills and knowledge of the digital era. As a small business owner, I am finding this book to be an invaluable resource."
- Larry Lim, Managing Partner at InnovaxTech


Table of Content

Preface

Introduction

Chapter 1: How Digital Marketing is the Midas Touch for Small Business 

Chapter 2: Experiential Marketing vs. Interactive Marketing

Chapter 3: More than Facebook: Understanding SEO and Digital Trends

Chapter 4: Making the Most from Google

Chapter 5: Build the Brand by Maximizing Social Media Presence

Chapter 6: Why Going Digital can Triple Sales Growth

Chapter 7: Rounding up Digital Marketing Components

Chapter 8: Gaining the Vivid Competitive Edge

Chapter 9: Bridging the Distance Gap and Maintaining Customer Closeness

Conclusion

About the Author


Sneak Preview


The 2016 State of Small Business Marketing



What I Need & What Your Support Means

When I started writing 'Rocket Into Digital', I had no clue of the costs involved in producing and self-publishing a book or an e-book! I certainly learned a lot, from my own researches that describe in detail the actual costs of self-publishing and how to go about doing so. These include development and copy-editing, proofreading, cover and illustrations, formatting and digital conversion, online marketing, printed marketing materials, PR and media publicity (if any), and other fees.

Here is the rough breakdown of costs:
  • Editing and proofreading: $1,000
  • Cover design and illustrations: $500
  • Formatting and digital conversion: $500
  • ISBN: Free
  • Online marketing: $500
  • Other fees: $500
  • My Starbucks coffee: $100
After I have reached my goal for the campaign, I will use the additional funds to print more books. By supporting the campaign, you will cover a fraction of the publishing cost, so that this book can be enjoyed by you and the rest of the world. 
* You will also provide me with the confidence for my next book!
** My next book might be related to Tech Start-Ups!

Risks & Challenges

The book is pretty much completed. I am getting the project proofread professionally, and I am rather determined to finish the project. Potential risks for delay are minimal, but here they are:

  • The project might not hit the target. Although I wished that we can collectively reach our goal, in any case the project is unsuccessful, I would like to sincerely thank all backers.
  • The printer might take longer than anticipated. However, it is one of the best-reputed printer in the States, and it reliably and routinely handles projects far larger than this one.
  • Shipping might take a little while. Going from one side of the world to the other is always a little unpredictable. But the book WILL get to you.

 

What Happens After This?

The book will be made available both online and offline, retailing at about US$12 (Digital) and US$22 (Paperback).


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are not able to contribute financially, I would love it if you would spread the word about this campaign, share it with anyone you know!

You can also read more of my articles on http://www.vincentwee.com/ before you decide to support my campaign.

Do you have further ideas? Please let me know. Also if you have friends, family or other contacts that want to learn more about business and digital marketing in particular, do recommend them this book.


About the Author

Vincent is a dynamic and versatile marketing strategist primarily focused in the digital marketing industry. With experience spanning several positions from Co-Founder of a successful tech-startup to Digital Marketing Director at a prestigious media-accredited creative agency. He has habitually proven his diligence and ability to creatively solve problems both in a team setting and individually. In his 9+ years of professional experience he has also successfully published several informative articles widely read by marketers worldwide as well as mastering the art of design and development. 

Using a creative yet systematic approach to develop powerful marketing strategies he has helped hundreds of businesses to boost sales, build brand awareness, and successfully increase market presence. His ability to concoct these effective strategies comes from his versatile background, having worked in engineering, interior design, marketing and creative industries. These efforts usually result in a lucrative, long lasting relationship and raving recommendations from the clients specifically due to his excellent project management and inter-personal skills. 

Some of the brands he has worked with include 3M, Taiwan Beer, JCB Bank, Port of Singapore Authority (PSA) and even government agencies like Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF) and Infocomm Development Authority of Singapore (IDA).

Daily Focus: “Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference." 

Blogs at http://www.VincentWee.com/
Blogs for: GAMEVIL Inc. & Asiasoft


Thanks with love,

story:
This book is important because it takes Lincoln out of the box and gives us a better understanding of the emotions that drove him and his vision for America.

Follow this link to read a sample chapter. 

Lincoln Raw, a novel by bestselling author DL Fowler, gets inside Abraham Lincoln's heart and head for a close up view of how his passions grew and erupted to the surface to change the course of a nation.

Narrating in Lincoln's first person storyteller voice, Fowler aims to paint a complete picture of the real Lincoln and make him more approachable for readers -- especially for a generation who weren't even born when most Lincoln biograpies were written. 

As we draw closer to the 150th anniversary of Lincoln's assassination, people from both ends of the political spectrum insist America is at a crossroads. Our country was at a similar place in Lincoln's day, and he stood in the middle of that intersection.

His vision of 'a new declaration of liberty for all' profoundly changed the course of history. Yet that declaration invaded the national consciousness only because he was driven by intense emotions which he dressed in reason and articulated with skill. We cannot fully understand the America he hoped for without touching the emotions that propelled him. Lincoln Raw helps us make that connection.

The idea of Lincoln the vampire hunter has amused many people - but Grahame-Smith's novel more accurately illustrates the emotional foundation of Lincoln's life choices than most non-fiction books reveal. Lincoln's obsession with ending slavery actually was connected to his mother's death and his resentment toward the person he held responsible. It's just that vampires weren't involved.

Now you don't have to take my word for how good this project is. Check it out for yourself. If you don't think it's pretty special stuff, don't contribute.

Click here to read a sample chapter. 

Click here for more information about DL Fowler, bestselling author of Lincoln's Diary and creator of Lincoln Raw

Here's what Lincoln Raw will entail

  • Sifting through the full historical record, including stories told by the people he grew up with
  • Retracing his steps and getting a flavor of the surroundings that influenced him
  • Finding patterns and themes in his philosophies, writings, behavior and relationships to see how his guiding principles evolved
  • Tracing the origins of his emotions and plumbing their depths to understand how they influenced his principles
  • Telling Lincoln's story in first person with him as narrator

Since Lincoln isn't around to tell the story, we'll have to find the right words to put in his mouth. Words that are honest and true to his character and personality.

Here's the Deal

We need your help to raise $3,500 for research, professional editing, formatting and production of eBook and paperback editions, as well as designing the cover. Oh yes, and we have to pay for your perks, too.

[Speaking of perks, take note of the special deal for Book Clubs.]

You may ask why a publisher isn't covering these expenses. It's because the publishing is world has been turned upside down by the new realities of digital publishing, and traditional publishers don't know how to adapt - except to tighten their budgets. On top of that, they're stuck in an endless loop of 'giving them what they bought last week' until they stop buying it. In such a pulp mill, authors with fresh concepts, unique stories or genre bending manuscripts are often shunned.

But their mistake is your opportunity.

The Impact

By supporting crowd-funded writing projects we seize the power to add a broader selection of deserving books to the marketplace. We also send a message to the publishing giants that we deserve better than what they're giving us.

If you back Lincoln Raw, you'll be using that power to add a unique contribution to the body of historical literature. For the first time, readers will get to experience Lincoln's personal story from his point of view, drawn from the full historical record.  The most entertaining part will be hearing Lincoln retell stories from his point of view that were originally told by people who watched him grow up. Getting inside Lincoln's heart and head will make him more approachable and will take us beyond dry facts to a deeper understanding of the America he strove to build. 

You can mutlitpy your impact by taking another step. When you invite others to join in through Indiegogo share tools and your favorite social media platforms, you'll be sharing your power with people who also deserve more.

Expectations

The target date for release is July 2013 - but you go to the head of the line and get your perks before the rest of the world gets to buy their copies. Just check out the perks on the right side of the page.

If the entire goal isn't raised, we'll forge ahead with what we have. The project will get done, but it'll probably take more time. And fewer people will have the satisfaction of being part of a landmark project.

Houskeeping Items

Checkout: When you make your contribution you'll have the choice of processing your payment using PayPal or Direct Payment. You can use your Credit/Debit card for either option. You won't need a PayPal account to use PayPal, since they'll process your Credit/Debit card just the same as any online shopping cart. Using PayPal doesn't cost you anything and we get the money immediately instead of at the end of the campaign.

Using PayPal doesn't cost you anything and we get the money immediately instead of at the end of the campaign.

story:
Accéder à la version française (vidéo et description) >>>

Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.
(Carl Edward Sagan)

(Section of the 1880 Poster used by Carl Hagenbeck's Thierpark to advertise the Inuit. Collection Hans-Josef Rollmann.)

Who is Abraham Ulrikab?

In August 1880, two « Eskimo » families from Labrador voluntarily departed for Europe where they were to become the newest exotic attraction in zoos. Abraham Ulrikab was part of the group. Aged from 13 months to 50 years old, the eight individuals were recruited by Johan Adrian Jacobsen on behalf of Carl Hagenbeck, pioneer of ethnographic shows (known today as « human zoos »). Since 1874, crowds had been flocking to Hagenbeck’s shows where they could observe « savages » originating from different parts of the world. Hagenbeck was hoping to repeat the 1877 success of a group of Greenland « eskimos ».

Unfortunately, a mandatory measure, by German law, was not taken: vaccinate them against smallpox. A deadly mistake. Less than four months after their arrival on European soil, the group no longer existed, having been all killed by smallpox. Three died in Germany. The remaining five, including Abraham, died in Paris.

What is Abraham's story?

The following AV show was prepared to introduce the eight Inuit and to provide a summary of their story. Take a moment to meet Abraham, his family and companions, and to admire the majesty of their homeland, Nunatsiavut.

CLICK ON THE IMAGE TO VIEW THE AV SHOW

If you are curious to find out a bit more about the making-of this AV show.

What is this research looking for?

Literate, Abraham documented his moods and emotions in his personal diary and in letters. Abraham’s writings give us insight on what happened when the group was exhibited in Germany and in Prague. Unfortunately, they are silent about their stay in Paris and until now, nobody has attempted to elucidate the events that occured in Paris prior and following the Inuit's death.

(Excerpt from Abraham's diary as shown in the exhibit « Human Zoos, The Invention of the Savage » at the Musée du Quai Branly in Paris from November 29, 2011 to June 3, 2012. See the galery for the English translation of the excerpt.)

These Inuit could not simply have vanished! They must have left traces. What was the sequence of events from the time they arrived in Paris to the time they died? Where are their traces? Where were the Inuit buried?

Those are the questions the project « In the footsteps of Abraham Ulrikab » is trying to answer.

I have been researching this story since 2010. The more I dig, the more riveting the story becomes. My two week stay in Paris in the fall of 2011 proved beyond a doubt that my efforts are not being spent in vain. A fascinating chapter is to be appended to the story.

By supporting this project, you will join the « Friends of Abraham » team and you will witness this search. You will be sitting in the front row and will feel the thrill and excitement of watching the unveiling of a new chapter of this tragic story.

Hebron, the community (now abandonned) where Abraham and his family originate from. July 2009. (Photo: France Rivet / Polar Horizons)

How did this projet come about?

If you are curious to find out how this project came about, I invite you to read the following post I recently published on Polar Horizons' blog: Bon Voyage Lyubov Orlova! The « In the footsteps of Abraham Ulrikab » research project thanks you!

What has been published to date about the Abraham Ulrikab story

Abraham Ulrikab’s story may ring a bell for some of you as it has already been the subject of a few publications. The main ones being:

  • The article published in Canadian Geographic in 1981 by Canadian ethnologist James Garth Taylor, who uncovered a copy of a German translation of Abraham’s diary and revealed the tragic story to the 20th century public.
  • Articles published (in German & English) by German ethnologist Hilke Thode-Arora who conducted further research in archives.
  • In 2005, Abraham’s diary was translated into English by German Professor Hartmut Lutz and his students from the University of Greifswald, in Germany, and published in the book The Diary of Abraham Ulrikab: Text and Context. It was followed by a German version in 2007.

Here is a statement received from Professor Lutz:

When my students and I worked on translating, supplementing and editing Abraham’s Diary, we did so mainly with two things in mind. On the one hand, we felt that this sad and shameful story of racism and inhuman callousness needed to be told, and we were very much aware of our German recent history and the legacy of the Holocaust--a legacy we all felt that needs to be remembered and addressed continuously, so that we can learn from the past and not become guilty again.

On the other hand, we had strong hopes that our translation and the supplementary materials we found would be read widely in  Canada, and particularly in the Arctic, so that perhaps some of Abraham’s, Ulrike’s, Terrianiniak’s and Paingo’s relatives in Labrador would learn more about the tragic events over a hundred years ago. We were delighted to learn that indeed an Inuk whose family originates from Hebron and wears the same name as Noggasak, the first Inuk to die in Europe in 1880, has read the book and has returned the text to Hebron. We are now deeply grateful to hear that France Rivet is working on a French translation with additional findings about what befell the Inuit families in France, and we fully support all her efforts. – Maybe, one day there will also be a translation into Inuktitut, and then Abraham’s Diary will truly have returned home.

Hartmut Lutz, 21 February 2013

Nachvak Fjord, Torngat Moutains, where Terrianiak and his family were recruited. July 2009. (Photo: France Rivet / Polar Horizons)

Why this research matters

I have been donating my time and money to this research for more than two years and I’ll keep working at it for as long as it takes. The reason? Because I am convinced that my research will allow today’s Labrador Inuit (and Inuit throughout the circumpolar world) to regain part of the dignity that was taken from their predecessors.

I invite you to join the « Friends of Abraham » if, like me, you believe that:

  • We owe it to Abraham, Ulrike, Terrianiak, Paingo, Tobias, Noggasak, Sara and Maria to ensure that their deaths did not occur in vain. All they wanted was to improve their basic living conditions upon their return. On European soil, the eight Inuit entertained the crowds, enabled entrepreneurs to pocket profits and agreed to be studied by anthropologists who were most happy to have at their disposal “savages” originating from such faraway lands. They paid the ultimate price.
  • Uncovering and telling the whole story is the least we can do for them.
  • A wait period of 132 year is long enough. It is therefore high time to solve the mysteries that still hover and to make this new chapter known.

The purpose of this research is not to judge people’s actions of the past or to put blame on what, today, we consider as being wrong doing. I simply want to document the events in an accurate and respectful manner so that this tragic story can finally come to a close.

What are the project deliverables?

Publication of the ebook « I am Abraham, Ulrike’s husband » (target date: May 2013)

Abraham Ulrikab’s story having never been published in French, I must ensure that Parisians and France’s population have access to the story, as it is currently known, before the details of the events that took place on their territory are released.

Therefore, before heading to Paris, I will publish a book (in PDF format) which will include Abraham’s own words (his diary and letters) as well as give a general overview of the story.

The purpose of this digital book is therefore to set the stage for the rest of the project. So that as many « Friends of Abraham » as possible have access to this deliverable, it will be available in French and English. Thanks to the generosity of Professor Hartmut Lutz, the English translations of Abraham’s diary and letters produced by him and his students will be reproduced in the English version of this book.

Research in Paris (Target date : June 2013)

During this research trip to Paris, as a « Friend of Abraham » you will receive at least one update report per week.  In Paris, I will be accompanied by a videographer. Photographs and videoclips will be used to inform you of our progress, the sites we’ve visited, the people we’ve met, the facts we have uncovered, etc. You will feel the excitement of being the first ones to know about what happened to Abraham and his family.

All update reports will be available in French and English and will be exclusive to the «Friends of Abraham».

Publication of the ebook « In the footsteps of Abraham Ulrikab – Paris » (Target date : November 2013)

Once I have returned from Paris, I will write a second ebook « In the footsteps of Abraham Ulrikab - Paris »  telling the story of this research project and revealing the discoveries from Paris.  

While the ebook is being written, « Friends of Abraham » will continue to receive exclusive update reports (available in French and English).

Northern Arm, Saglek Fjord, Torngat Mountains. July 2009 (Photo: France Rivet / Polar Horizons)

How will the funds be used?

The funds are needed to cover the following costs:

  • the translations of Abraham’s diary & letters (German to French), of documents uncovered in Paris and of the two ebooks (from French to English);
  • the production of the two ebooks (including cover design, layout, editing, …),
  • the acquisition of historical photographs;
  • the collaboration of specialists (scientists, anthropologists, ethnologists, …) to help with the writing and/or the validation of some sections of the second ebook;
  • the airfare (Ottawa-Paris) for the researcher and a videographer,
  • living expenses, transportation and other expenses incurred during the 3 week research trip to Paris for the researcher and the videographer;
  • Provide an honorarium payment for those who have helped this crowdfunding project happen: the photographers + the composer of the original soundtrack used in the AV show;
  • The production and mailing of rewards.

What if there is over-financing?

If so many people feel compelled to become a « Friend of Abraham » and the initial financial goal is exceeded, here are a few activities that are currently on the project's « to-do » list and/or ways that the extra money could be used. Once the campaign is over and the total amount raised is known, we will analyze the different options:

  • Look into the production of a printed version of the book « In the footsteps of Abraham Ulrikab – Paris ».
  • Extend the stay in Paris, if need be.
  • Head to Hamburg in order to conduct research in archives we believe may very well hold the key to some of the mysteries surrounding the Paris events.
  • Financially reward the videographer and project assistant who will both be working very hard in the coming months.
  • Produce a documentary out of the collection of videos we will have brought back from Paris to tell the story of this research project.
  • Plan a trip to Nunatsiavut and work with the Torngâsok Cultural Center to meet with the Inuit community in order to hear and document their feelings, thoughts, and concerns about the facts uncovered in Paris. Take the opportunity to meet with Inuit elders who still remember their parents or grand-parents telling them the story of Abraham.
  • Conduct research to try to identify if there are any living descendants of the two families who died in Europe. We’re still looking for Abraham’s original diary in Inuktitut! Could it be hidden in the attic of a family member’s descendant?

Description of some of the rewards

« Friends of Abraham World Map »

So that we all have a visual representation of where the « Friends of Abraham » are located, I will be maintaining a « Friends of Abraham World Map » where the name of each and every person will be pinned on the map.

Each « Friend of Abraham » will be receiving a high-level photograph of this map. Depending on your pledge level, you could also be receiving a photo of your name pinned on the map. Wouldn’t it  be cool if Abraham had friends on all continents?

Special edition of the Nunatsiavut Notebook

Polar Horizons has designed a collection of five notebooks on various polar themes. One of them aims to show the beauty of Abraham’s homeland, Nunatsiavut.

A special edition, exclusive to the « Friends of Abraham », will be produced. It will include some of the photos appearing in the AV show accompanying this project description. These photos were taken by master photographer Hans Blohm or Bill Pratt. The notebook (15 X 23 cm / 6" X 9") has a total of 80 pages and over twenty photos.  

See a preview of the existing Nunatsiavut notebook currently available on Blurb’s website to give you a feel.

 

Polar Horizons’ Art cards

Polar Horizons has developed a catalog of art cards comprised of more than 225 images that explore a variety of polar and nature themes (flora, wildlife and landscapes ...). Our art cards catalog features the work of a talented group of photographers and a painter. The cards are handcrafted in Canada, are mounted on 5"X7" (12,5 cm X 17,75 cm ) cardstock, are blank inside and individually packaged with an envelope in a crystal clear bag.

A new collection of cards, exclusive to the « Friends of Abraham », featuring scenes from Paris will be created.  

Depending on your pledge level, you could be receiving a selection of these cards as your rewards so, please take a look at the catalog and start noting your list of choices.

Who am I?

An IT consultant for more than 23 years, in 2007 I did a major career change and founded Polar Horizons. For the past six years, I have been dedicating my time and skills as a photographer, freelance writer, educator and researcher to showing the beauties of the Arctic to children and the general public. Several of my texts and photos have been published in Quebec newspapers and magazines. Recently, my writing and/or photographs have appeared in Above and Beyond (First Air’s inflight magazine), Makivik magazine and a Reader’s Digest hardcover book.

Hearing about the Abraham Ulrikab story woke up another passion of mine: archival research (I conducted genealogical research for more than 30 years). Since 2010, I have taken it upon myself to go out and uncover what happened in Paris in 1881. I have established relationships with most of the previous actors who researched Abraham’s story, with institutions in Paris as well as with the Culture, Recreation and Tourism department of the government of Nunatsiavut. I am working in close relationship with all of them. I am fully dedicated to this research and to ensuring that this tragic story can finally come to a close. The Labrador Inuit deserve to know what happened.

If you are interested to know more about who I am, what I have accomplished or see samples of articles I have written, please feel free to check my profile on Polar Horizons’ website.

How can you help?

There are different ways in which you can contribute to this project:

  • By joining the «Friends of Abraham» team. To do so, you simply have to choose your level of contribution on the right-hand side of this page. Of course, I’d be thrilled if you did.  You won’t regret doing so once you see all the excitement this project will generate .
  • By spreading the word and inviting anyone you know who has an interest in the Inuit culture, in Labrador and Nunatsiavut, in history, in anthropology/ethnology, etc. to take part in the adventure.
  • If you know of anyone who believe they are related to the families of Abraham, Ulrike, Tobias, Terrianiak or Paingo, whether they are direct or collateral descendants (i.e. descendants of a brother, sister of the above mentionned people), please tell them to get in touch with me. We are still looking for Abraham's original diary. Could it be in a descendant's attic?
  • If you remember seeing photographs or any documents relating to these eight Inuit in your family's photo albums or archives, please get in touch with me.  We know that Abraham has signed many autographs for the crowd who came to see them. Wouldn't it be wonderful to retrace a document holding his original signature?

Whatever way you decide to contribute, your interest, help and support will be most appreaciated. Thank you so much for taking the time to read and consider my proposal.

I'm looking forward to share this fascinating story with you!

Thank you! Nakkumek!
France Rivet
