story:
About The Project

So, what exactly is SoMysterious.com? It's only the latest and greatest Transformation Anthology Project from the mind of Mickey Bamboo!

The premise, as the about page shown above explains, deals with the idea of what if that cliched little shop that sells those oh so mysterious cursed items was absolutely for real? What if your average, mediocre belt  made you gain weight every time you loosened it? Or after buying that specialty barbell for your friend, it turned him into a beefy hairy caveman?

The book will begin with two stories, one being a weight gain tale of over 10,000 words, while the other has yet to be decided. With your help we can add more stories to the book.

Thank you for any and all donations, but for those who donate at the higher tiers, you’ll be able to get a specially crafted story included in the anthology. Ever imagine being a huge hairy beefcake? A massive flabby whale, possibly literally? Well here’s your chance!

Check out the terms of service below for rules and conditions.

 

Goals and Stretch Goals

While we hope to make at least $300 to fund the project, here are our future goals!

  • 300 dollars funds the project with a two stories.
  • 500 dollars funds three stories, each of which dealing with a different transformation type.
  • 600 dollars funds a meta plot, a tale weaving between the other stories, starring the SoMysterious.com owners dealing with an overachieving lawyer. Would include corruption, weight gain, muscle growth, and bearification.

Further stretch goals will be added should we fulfill the current list. If for some reason we cannot reach our target funding, all money will go towards financing the anthology's main title as well as any custom stories.

About The Author

Mickey is the Co-Author of The New Neighbor with T.F. Wright,  and the author of the two illustrated stories, Corpulent Canine Collectables and Furry Fractured Fairytales which are all available on Amazon. He has also wrote numerous commissions stories which you can find here.

He is also the co-host of The Wright Stuff, a Transformation themed Podcast with T.F. Wight as well as the head host of Panda Pause, a furry interview Podcast.

About The Author
Mickey is the Co-Author of The New Neighbor with T.F. Wright,  and the author of the two illustrated stories, Corpulent Canine Collectables and Furry Fractured Fairytales which are all available on Amazon. He has also wrote numerous commissions stories which you can find here.
He is also the co-host of The Wright Stuff, a Transformation themed Podcast with T.F. Wight as well as the head host of Panda Pause, a furry interview Podcast.

story:
Hi everyone,

First and foremost I want to thank you for checking out my campaign. This is a path I feel I am being put on by God. I have been through quite the journey, with the highest of highs and the lowest of lows. My goal with this book is to not only give readers a glimpse into some of the things I have gone through, but also to showcase other people's stories. As cliche as it sounds, if this book helps just one person, it will be a success. I would love for you to be a part of that success. 

I decided to do a flexible campaign so that any money raised will be used to further my goal of making this book a reality. Please do not take that as a lack of faith on my part by not doing a fixed campaign which would get the exact dollar amount I need. Every $1 raised will go to getting this book out to the masses and by making it a flexible campaign, that means whether I make my desired goal or not, I will get the money that you have contributed by putting your support behind me. In addition to the book, I would like to make a companion website, where I can continue to interview people whose life has gone through significant challenges, but they have persevered. Much like my current website, www.theactorsaudience.com, this will be a place for people to get their stories out there.

Perks of funding a campaign are part of the process and I hope the perks I am offering will bring in the money I need. 

I am launching the campaign on this week of Thanksgiving, but it will run through Christmas and the beginning of 2020. The holiday season sees each person's finances stretched, but it is also the time of year people are the most giving. The impact of this project can be far and wide and each $1 I raise will give someone the opportunity to see that no matter how bad things get, there is always something or someone to hold on to.

Indiegogo asks to be transparent and list some challenges. Every dream you try to make a reality comes with risks. Will people even care about my story or the stories of others? Simply put, I say yes. Nothing is more important than communication, especially in this day and age. Will this journey be an easy one? It may not, BUT I have the drive, passion and desire to make this book happen. It's all about helping others, plain and simple.

For those who absolutely cannot afford to donate even at the lowest level of $1, your support means the world to me. If you believe in me and my purpose, please share the campaign so that others you know may be able to contribute. 

Again, thank you for just even taking the time to read this all the way through and considering a donation. Join me on this journey!

story:
Story of My Book

Beautiful People tells the origin story of 8 woman-of-color-founded companies in the beauty industry. The beauty industry is worth $530 BILLION. While the industry was primarily driven by giant conglomerates who own all the brands we are exposed to on a daily basis, at the drugstore and retailers like Sephora, many women did not find that these cookie cutter, repeat products fit their needs, so they decided to create their own. The women who created these companies became extremely successful and began a movement that eventually chipped away at the conglomerate-driven industry and paved the way for independent, diverse bands to emerge.

My name is Sadichchha (Sa-dee-cha), and I am the author of Beautiful People. I wrote this book as a reflection of my own experiences shopping for products that never really fit me, and I know other women have had this experience too. Over the past few years, I’ve seen a lot of brands step away from this and develop a diverse range of products, I've seen women of color start to get visibility in this industry, and I've seen indie brands gaining popularity. This didn’t just happen overnight though. So how did it happen?

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the origin stories of companies that have found financial and commercial success in the beauty industry and have paved the way for others to follow suit. It is through these stories that I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for understanding the business case of beauty. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you navigate the future of this industry.

In this book, you’ll get to know:
  • Rea Ann Silva’s Beautyblender and her successes as a make up artist, mother to Erica Dickerson, and then as a category creator;
  • Toni Ko’s NYX Cosmetics and Bespoke Beauty Brands and her entrepreneurship genes catapulting her career in beauty;
  • Huda Kattan’s Huda Beauty and her path from DIY lashes to a billion-dollar empire;
  • Vicky Tsai’s Tatcha and her love story with Japanese beauty rituals;
  • Nancy Twine’s Briogeo and her journey with natural hair care products;
  • Heela Yang and Camila Pierotti’s Sol de Janeiro and their ode to Brazilian skincare and sunshine;
  • Deepica Mutyala’s Live Tinted and her focus on community-building and inclusion for women in beauty; 
  • Amanda Johnson and KJ Miller’s Mented Cosmetics and the start of nude lipsticks over a bottle of wine; and finally
  • based on these 8 companies, a case study of Rooshy Roy's AVRAANI, and her natural skincare venture to create cultural connections through beauty.

The Book 

The book is written in 3 parts.
  • Part 1 contains the history of product development in the beauty industry. What is setting the stage for these 8 companies to form? What do we know about product offerings in the 90s?
  • Part 2 contains the profiles of women who founded these companies. What did the landscape of entrepreneurship look like in beauty? How did the women we are highlighting change the way products are developed in this industry?
  • Part 3 contains an analysis of where this industry is going. What are the lasting trends we are seeing in beauty? How can you, as a consumer, an investor, an innovator, or a content creator, get involved?
 

How You Can Support

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021
  • The cover design of my book (the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats)
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this in August, 2021.

 

  • When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.
  • When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.
  • When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Sadichchha Adhikari is a customer strategy consultant with a passion for beauty and cosmetics, as well as sharing stories of inclusion in this industry. In a world where there aren’t a lot of business cases for beauty, she wants to create content that showcases the success of women as entrepreneurs in a highly competitive industry.

A beauty enthusiast herself, Sadichchha hopes to shed light on the experience of many women of color buying products and to showcase how offerings have changed in the past 20-30 years. While things still aren’t perfect, product offerings in cosmetics and skincare has become a lot more inclusive.

In her free time, Sadichchha enjoys running and watching hours and hours of home renovation shows.

For more information, you can connect with Sadichchha at @imachchhef on Instagram or look her up on LinkedIn!
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BeautifulPeopleBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support! 
Sadichchha

story:
Story of My Book

Emotion Commotion: What are they and what the heck do we do with them? guides the reader through how emotions work inside our brains on a neurological level, how they affect us, and ways in which we can turn our negative emotions and experiences into positive ones. 

My name is Ruth Cowan and I am the author of Emotion Commotion: What are they and what the heck do we do with them?. I wrote this book because I think being able to understand our emotions better can help us be more successful in our lives. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover more about yourself, how your emotions have affected your life experiences, and how those experiences have affected your emotions.  In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for understanding people on an emotional level in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you succeed in your goals by being able to understand and manage your emotions better. 

In this book, you'll learn about understanding emotions through the science behind them and the personal experiences of others:

* The Science of Emotions- how our emotions affect us neurologically and biophysically. 
* How to take emotional intelligence to the next level
* Understanding the science behind depression
* Success stories: Carlos J. Malave who teaches young people to embrace their emotions through his motivational speaking and book.

You will love this book if you want to learn more about others, understand yourself better, and want tips to help you become more successful in your goals.

Emotion Commotion: What are they and what the heck do we do with them? is a non-fiction book that speaks to men and women who are looking to understand their emotions better and looking for ways to overcome negative emotions and experiences. This book will not only help you but will give you tools to help those around you. 

The Book - Emotion Commotion: What are they and what the heck do we do with them?

The book is written in 3 Parts.

Part 1 contains the Introduction and chapters about understanding the science of emotions from a neurological and biochemical aspect.

Part 2 contains chapters which delve into different life experiences such as depression, domestic violence, and addiction. It details what causes these things to happen in our brains and ways to help overcome them.

Part 3 contains the remaining chapters that talk about success, finding purpose and how religion and spirituality can affect us through neurotheology.


What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

* The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
* The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
* The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
* The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
* The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this just in time for the holidays. 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

* You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

* A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

* Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
* Early access to the Introduction of my Book and sample chapters with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
* The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
* I will do a book topic/workshop online seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
* And more...

About the Author

Ruth Cowan is a Summa Cum Laude graduate of Southern New Hampshire University with a degree in nonfiction writing. As a mother and grandmother, she uses her own life experiences and wisdom to inspire others through her writing. 

Being passionate about the wellbeing of others, Ruth wrote this book in hopes of inspiring others to take a look at themselves on an emotional level with the hopes of helping them to achieve their dreams. 
 
Family is everything to me. My favorite kind of day would be a play-date with my preschool-aged granddaughters, hanging out with my seven-year-old grandson, or cuddling my four-week-old granddaughter. Aside from that, I love people. I love learning about others through their personal stories, and have no problem talking for hours! My true passion in life is writing and my hope is to be able to use my writing to help others. 

For more information, you can connect with Ruth at r.cowan40@gmail.com and https://www.facebook.com/ruthcowan.inspirtion911/

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

* Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #emotioncommotion and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
* You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
* Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ruth

story: Turning the Pages has spent the last 2 years finding every way possible to bring support and awareness to Indie Authors. Some of the greatest books we have read are from self published or small published authors and yet they don't get noticed because its so hard to get your name out there in the world of literature. The opportunity has come before us to open a physical bookstore in our current location where we can start spreading even more awareness to the community about these wonderful and super talented authors. The space available is large enough to not only have a large selection of books for the community but also to host author signings and writing workshops to help bring creativity and inspiration to our community. We also are looking to work with the library to have more book readings and book related interactions. With your help we can expand our reach and help even more authors.

story:
Hello.

I know it is ironic that the title of the Campaign is called," The Writing is on the Wall".  But how are we, the congregation, able to gain the most of the message; when the message is given by an out dated projector?  We are Millenlials, and being such, we need a more vibrant way of receiving the Word of God.  Don't you see?  We are asking for funds for a high speed projector and laptop.  We need colors and power points to deliver the message in a way that appeals to young people; because the Word is there, but the technology is not. 

We are two young church attendees trying to improve our church's projector system.  We are doing this because we believe that we should give something back to the Church that has served us so much.  This is a need of the Church and we are trying to take the initiative to provide for an organization that has given so much to so many.   Thank you and God Bless!

story:
Changelings: Into the Mist is a love story. Not in the traditional sense of boy-meets-girl, but in every other way possible. It is my love letter to Ireland, to pirates and revolutionaries. It is a testament to my abiding love for the men, women and myths that shaped the nation and its history. 

My name is Katie Sullivan, and for as long as I could remember, I've wanted to go on a grand adventure. And here I am, publishing a book. It's been written and edited. The print and e-book files are almost ready to be uploaded to their respective homes, but I need you for the next step. All books need marketing, and Changelings is no different. For this adventure to reach its ultimate conclusion, I need to put physical copies into the hands of those who need it: reviewers, libraries, reading groups, local book stores - you name it, I want them to see it. 

Wait, you want to see it, too? Well, then you've come to the right place, because this is where you can pre-order Changelings, whether you want an e-book, a signed print copy or a special inscribed copy. This is also the place to reserve your very own "Rebel," "Pirate," or "King/Queen" t-shirt, bookmark, wristband and mug!

But, before I go on, let me introduce to the world ofChangelings: Into the Mist:

* * *

Changelings.

They were the descendants of Man and Fae. They walked between worlds – as healers, mystics, even kings – but no more. He thought he was the last, alone and lost, until the day he saw them.

Irish teens Maureen O’Malley and Sean McAndrew are lost in time. To find a way home, they must curry favor with pirates, dodge a revolution, and defy a king out of Ireland’s deepest legends.

They are Changelings, and they have magic in their blood – magic, which will rekindle a centuries-old war that threatens to tear the very fabric of time.

What I Need & What You Get

The marketing campaign will unfold in three steps – and all of it depends on you. The basic goal is $750, which will purchase ISBNs in order to distribute the print book through IngramSpark. These ISBNs will cover all of the print and digital editions of Changelings: Into the Mist, as well as its sequel, The Coming Storm. Of that $750, I will also be able to do an expanded print run through IngramSpark, which will allow me to put review copies into the hands of groups such as, the Midwest Book Review, offer distribution discounts to local bookstores and place ads in online marketplaces, such as the Independent Author Network.

Should the campaign go over its goal, and I’m hoping it does, I will be able to expand its marketing reach. At $1,200 I will be able to apply for a Kirkus Review. At $1,700 I will be able to put it into Publisher’s Weekly Booklife and BookBub, and so on.

But enough about what I get to do – here is what your dollar is going to get YOU:

Ebooks and physical copies, profuse thanks, t-shirts, a tablet cover, bookmarks, a poster and a fabulous mug – all of which is divided out into the perks outlined at the right.

If the gods are unkind, and I do not meet my campaign goal, I will use whatever funds are raised to purchase the ISBNs needed to distribute the book through IngramSpark. Fewer copies of the book will be printed through CreateSpace to minimize costs, and whatever is left over will be used to purchase ad space.

Why Changelings?

When I was growing up, I always wanted to read an adventure story – with some romance, true, but a story that was fun, a story that told me about different places, times and cultures. Changelings, which takes its characters on a grand adventure on Grace O’Malley’s pirate galley in 1584 and the streets of Dublin during the 1916 Rising, is that story – it is an adventure for young women. 

Risks & Challenges

The risks with this project are few. The book has been written and edited. The cover has been designed and uploaded. Not only that, but all parties involved to-date have been paid for their services. Everything is ready to go and this campaign will provide the additional means necessary to expand the book’s reach with physical copies and distribution through IngramSpark.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone can contribute, but if you believe in Changelings as much as I do, you can do something – share this campaign. Get the word out – and not just about the campaign, but about the book itself. You can use the tools below to shout about it from the rooftops – and I’ll be most grateful if you do.

story:
Connective Tissue, a book of poems

I am a poet and essayist whose work explores illness, disability, the body, the natural world, and the complex web of relationships of which we are all a part. I have Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS), a genetic connective tissue disorder that affects the body's collagen, which means that I have less glue holding my joints, muscles, and other tissues together than others do. I am currently working on my first book of poems and lyric essays, Connective Tissue; in it, I hope to recreate in language what my body lacks in material by weaving together personal narrative with scientific research, observations of the natural world, and elements of place. 

This campaign will allow me to spend six weeks working intensively on Connective Tissue in July and August of this year. After two years of research and writing, two writer’s residencies, one successful crowdfunding campaign, and ongoing support from my community, I have honed my vision for the project and drafted a quarter of the book’s poems. With your help, I can focus intensively on Connective Tissue before switching gears to begin my graduate degree this September. 

In honor of my relationship with EDS, I will donate 10% of all funds raised to the Ehlers-Danlos National Foundation (ENDF) for continued care and research for individuals affected by EDS. 

How I'll use the funds

With your help, I hope to raise $3,000 in 30 days. Below is a breakdown of how I'll use the funds. 


[The image above is a color-coded sketch of the bones in the human hand to show the use of campaign funds. Most of the bones are light blue, representing $2,400 for 6 weeks of income replacement; the thumb bones and metacarpal are pink, representing a $300 donation (or 10% of total) to EDNF; two carpals are orange, representing $200 in fundraising fees; one carpal is green, representing $100 in submission fees for contests, residencies, and grants.]

Income replacement for 6 weeks in July-Aug 2014: $2,400

Income replacement means that I can spend July and August writing without worrying about how to cover basic expenses. The estimate is based on what I would have made in 6 weeks at my most recent full-time job at a magazine.

Fees for submissions & future residencies: $100

By submitting my work to contests, publications, and future residencies (many of which have application fees), I can ensure that I will have the resources I need to work on the book in the summer of 2015. 

10% to EDNF Center for Clinical Care and Research: $300 

The Ehlers-Danlos National Foundation (EDNF) is in the process of creating the first Center for Clinical Care and Research, which will open this year in Baltimore. I will donate 10% of the funds I raise to EDNF, earmarked for the Center. 

Crowdfunding fees: $200

Indiegogo takes a percentage of the funds raised on their site, with additional payment processing fees. Please help me keep these costs down by spreading the word and sharing this page. Every dollar counts! 

What you get in return

[The image above is a montage of three perks, all captioned below.]

First of all, I'm grateful that you're here! Thanks for reading about my campaign, sharing this page, and contributing if you can. For those who can make a contribution of any size, I would love to show my gratitude by offering you a selection of perks (see the rewards levels to the right). Here are a few examples of what you'll get by supporting my campaign:

  • An acknowledgement on my website, with a link to your website or social media site, if you wish
  • A handwritten thank-you postcard with artwork designed by me, based on notes and sketches from Connective Tissue
  • An audio file of me reading a selection of poems from Connective Tissue
  • A limited-edition broadside print of an unpublished poem from Connective Tissue
  • Your choice of one matted photograph by Greyspace Photography (please scroll to the bottom of the page to see these photos)

...And more! Please see the sidebar for a full list of perks. 

The Impact

How a successful campaign will support my book

During a two-week residency at the Andrews Forest in Blue River, OR, this past March, I had a breakthrough regarding the structure of my book. I set aside the 20-30 pages of material I had already written to work on new poems based on my vision; for the first time, I began to feel comfortable telling people I am working on a book, not just a project or collection of separate pieces.

Since returning from that beautiful little writing apartment in the Pacific Northwest, I have continued to work on Connective Tissue in its new form. I now have nearly 20 pages of (new) poems for the book, which is something like a quarter of the finished manuscript. These poems feel meaty and powerful, and markedly different from earlier poems associated with this project. They feel riskier, more honest, more innovative, more intimate. I believe in them.

This fall, I will be become a Creative Writing MFA candidate at the University of Minnesota. Before my degree begins, I intend to maintain the momentum my project has gathered in the past year. This campaign will act like a crowdfunded residency, allowing me to work on my book from home for a set period of time. At this stage in the middle of the book’s development, I do not need to pay for travel or research: a successful campaign means that I will be able to focus my time and energy on writing. 

As so many artists know, works made in different periods of our lives can contrast each other dramatically. I have the opportunity, now, to offer my unwavering attention to Connective Tissue before I re-enter the world of academia and begin taking classes, teaching, reading new works, trying new things, and falling in love with new project ideas. 

This campaign will also allow me to apply for future funding opportunities for the summer of 2015. Many grants, residencies, fellowships, and contests require application fees, and have deadlines six months or more in advance of the opportunities they provide. If I can secure funding for next summer, I expect to complete a full manuscript of Connective Tissue by the end of 2015. If I exceed my goal for this campaign, I will use the additional funds to support a summer of writing in 2015. If I do not reach my goal, I will adjust the amount of time I spend writing this July and August (i.e. four weeks instead of six), and seek additional income. 

How a successful campaign will impact others

This book of poems found its roots in a very personal experience: my relationship to my body in the presence of a chronic illness. When this project was just a tiny seed and a few scribbles in a notebook, I gained courage and support from finding the voices of others who spoke out authentically about their lives, whether in writing, speech, artwork, or performance. It is my hope that Connective Tissue will be not only a book of poems, but a document that encourages others to write openly about disability, illness, sexuality, and the body. EDS is a rare condition, and since I have not found many writers or artists whose work publicly addresses it, I would like my writing to be available to others who want to see themselves reflected in art and literature. I also believe that many of the themes in Connective Tissue are universal and will speak to those who have a wide range of backgrounds.

Simply, I hope that this campaign and the eventual publication of my book will raise awareness about EDS and other chronic conditions. I will donate 10% of the funds raised during this campaign to the Ehlers-Danlos National Foundation (EDNF) Center for Clinical Care and Research, which will be the first Center of its kind and is set to open in August 2014 in Baltimore. You can read more about the Center here.

Past Support for Connective Tissue

As a potential backer, you’ll want to know that Connective Tissue has other supporters, and that I have consistently sought and received funding from a variety of sources. And I have! Here’s the rundown:

  • $350 grant from the Pabst Cultural Endowment Scholarship Fund, which covered partial tuition fees for Residency #151 at the Atlantic Center for the Arts (Summer 2013)
  • $1,005 in crowdfunding donations from 16 donors via GoFundMe, which covered partial tuition fees, travel and other costs associated with Residency #151 at the Atlantic Center for the Arts (Fall 2013)
  • $250 honorarium from Oregon State University, which offset travel, food, and other costs associated with a 2-week residency at the H.J. Andrews Experimental Forest (Spring 2014)
  • My poems have been published in Make/shift magazine, Our Lives Magazine, and the Helen Burns Poetry Anthology of New Voices from the Academy of American Poets College Prizes 

Additionally, I have committed to spending the next three years as an MFA candidate at the the University of Minnesota–Twin Cities, which reflects my dedication to the written word. Interested in reading some of my work and getting to know me? Please visit my website, where you will find essays, poems, and a bio.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support this campaign but can't contribute to the fundraiser, I'd still love your help in any of the following ways: 

  • Share this page on your social media sites using the Indiegogo share tools above
  • Help me spread the word via email or word of mouth 
  • Send me an email if you or anyone you know may be interested in promoting my campaign by doing an interview, blog post, etc. in the month of June

Thank you for visiting my Indiegogo site! Have questions, ideas, or comments? Please feel free to send me a message via the contact form on my website. 

****

Perks Gallery

Postcard made of notes and drawings from my research process, designed by me and mailed to you with a personal thank you. [The image above shows a rectangular postcard with drawings and notes in black and white, and highlights in light blue, green, yellow, orange and pink. Drawings show the bones of the hand and their names; notes in my handwriting say "connective tissue," "how do we write the body's resistance?" "collagen is a tough, fibrous protein like a rope with three strands," and other scribblings.]

"Insides Gone," (c) Greyspace Photography 2014. If you choose this photo as a perk, it will come as a beautiful 11" x 14" print in a white 16" x 20" mat. The watermark will not appear on your print. [This photograph depicts a blurred green background of trees and underbrush. In the foreground is a sunlit leaf that has been delicately eaten by moths so that it appears lacy, with bits of golden highlights. A hand in the upper right corner of the image holds the stem of the leaf between thumb and forefinger.]

"Luna Moth," (c) Greyspace Photography 2014. If you choose this photo as a perk, it will come as a beautiful 11" x 14" print in a white 16" x 20" mat. The watermark will not appear on your print. [This photograph depicts a background of red dirt pebbled with small pieces of gravel. On top of the dirt, in the center of the image, is the body of a light green luna moth with folded wings.]

story:
So there's a strip club brewpub

What, you need to know more? Fine. It's in Dayton, and it's called Pinups and Pints, and it exists because of a clever loophole in liquor permits, but regardless, it EXISTS. They have a small 15-gallon brewing system, but they are brewing, and there are boobs. I want to go review both.

I'm the editor of DrinkUpColumbus.com, and I would like to go to there.

What I need money for

Gas, a hotel, lap dances and beer. Drink Up Columbus doesn't exactly have a "travel budget." (Apparently the least you can ask for on Indiegogo is $500 (who knew?) so I will utilize these funds for only the finest of lap dances. I might even "make it rain.")

What You Get

I'm going to write an article about it on Drink Up Columbus. You get to read it. I promise to right gud.
story_txt:
So there's a strip club brewpub What, you need to know more? Fine. It's in Dayton, and it's called Pinups and Pints, and it exists because of a clever loophole in liquor permits, but regardless, it EXISTS. They have a small 15-gallon brewing system, but they are brewing, and there are boobs. I want to go review both.
I'm the editor of DrinkUpColumbus.com, and I would like to go to there.

story:
Pretty Poems to Ponder - MOJO’s First Book - Over 50+ Poems

"If the eyes are the pathway to the soul then my poems are the skyrockets toward enlightenment."  Melissa MOJO Hunter

Does Your Soul Have MOJO?

Have you ever wanted to connect with your soul on a higher level but didn't think you could do so in a potentially fun, easy and fearless way?

I would love, absolutely adore, hearing you describe in detail, your soul awakening aha moments you experience after reading my very first book, a collection of over fifty original poems called Pretty Poems to Ponder, which virtually guarantee to help you reconnect with your higher self as well as awaken and enlighten your mind, body and soul.

I help individuals just like you potentially learn how to tap into infinite intelligence easily using my inspirational poems, meditations, apps and tools.

KNOW MOJO
My name is Melissa Jo Hunter a.k.a. MOJO.  A few of you may remember me from my appearances on the mega hit reality TV dating shows, such as FOX's Joe Millionaire, BRAVO's Millionaire Matchmaker, and the upcoming CMT's Win, Lose or Pawn (August 2013) and many others. 

What some of you may not know is that I have an extreme passion for writing, channeling and uplifting others.  I have been channeling Arch Angel Raphael for the past eight years now.  He has helped me write many meditations, poems, quotes and even a full length comedy feature film.

My life purpose is to share what I know with the world.  I have compiled over eight years of channeling and condensed it down into easy to absorb inspirational poetry for your eyes to indulge.  Basically, rejuvenating your soul and rekindling your gratitude for life and love.  

WHY I NEED YOUR HELP
God asked me, "How does one know what you know?"

I am seeking funds to share these divinely guided messages with the world. 
Your contribution is helping me launch my products and speaking platform.
-My first book, Pretty Poems to Ponder
-My first audio book, Pretty Poems to Ponder
-My first DVD, a tutorial on how to Master Your Mind or Be Left Behind
-My first iphone & android app of meditations and poems to awaken the soul
-Master Your MOJO Tarot Card Deck - Basically, fun, easy ways to Master your mind, body & soul
-Autographed Posters, Postcards, Online Webinars, speaking events & more!

My end goal is to become a New York Times Bestselling Author published and sponsored by Hayhouse, Nightingale Conant, the Napoleon Hill Foundation and Edgar Cayce's Association for Research & Enlightenment.  I want to travel the globe speaking at seminars, retreats and workshops around the world on topics of channeling, tapping into infinite intelligence, mastering your mind, increasing your intuition and more.

By making a donation right now you are helping me manifest these dreams into reality.  I am thrilled to become the teacher and speaker my soul has always yearned to be.  With your donation right now, you are enabling the galaxy to allow me to share these soul connecting messages with you and many future generations to come.

When I exceed my goal, any extra funds will of course go towards the further success of building my speaking platform and creating, publishing and marketing new products. 

This campaign is extremely important to me because I no longer want any excuses of money, resources or the lack of anything to hold me back from achieving my dreams.  I know this project, my very first book and creating my business and speaking platform is a huge task.  It took many years of organizing, learning, cleansing, channeling, writing, prioritizing and overcoming multiple obstacles to get to this position where I can ask you for your assistance today.  I know with your help I can reach, maybe even exceed my goal.  The only limits are the ones we give ourselves right? 

Kindly find it in your heart to donate your dollars towards manifesting my dreams of creating soul awakening tools that potentially teach lost souls to reconnect to the light and find love waiting within.  I truly believe that I have a special gift of writing poetry and teaching others how to tap into infinite intelligence.  I am finally ready to share what I know with the world on a larger scale!

Your soul has finally found its MOJO!
Please prove it by making your donation now!
Your acts of kindness will always be remembered and treasured.

P.S. If you personally know me or have read some of my inspirational poems kindly leave a comment here on how this has impacted you or uplifted your soul so that others can get a glimpse of who I really am.  Thanks again! PLEASE DONATE NOW!  ----->

story:
ABOUT

Axel a creative soul with a mind full of ideas and Ash the curious adventurer always on the go.

We both love stories and love to write so we decided to fill the gap in the market with a new book concept that we like to call 'Fill-me-in-journals", an easy way for people to capture their stories, memories and experiences that would otherwise get lost into nowhereness...

OUR BOOK 

Every traveller has a story to share. One about freedom, adventure and lust for life. Swept away by Wanderlut is a unique travel journal full of fun writing prompts, quirky questions and wild 'To Do's' to capture all the thoughts, feelings and sensations that you experience on your travels. 

The book is full of inspirational quotes & aphorisms, photography and that personal touch that will make you want to capture your days. To explore the world is a gift, when you are old and grey looking back on your life and how you made your mark on this world, there is nothing more fascinating than telling your own tale.   

(We have some snapshots from the book in the gallery.)

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP 
 
On Friday 10th May we have our book launch at Berkelouw Bookstore, Paddington - Australia. It's one of the most well known bookstores in Sydney. It was an absolute dream come true when they accepted our book into their store, and will open up great opportunities for us. However, we didn't foree the costs associated with the launch of the book.
 
We have already saved as much as we can and after the fees to have the book printed and shipped to Australia, website, graphic designer, all registration fees we have a small amount of capital left and need your help. This was an unexpected expense and has come at a time when we don’t have much left. 
 
YOUR BELIEF 
 
Any donation would be greatly appreciated. We want to take Swept away by Wanderlust around the world. We know we have the passion, tools and faith to do it, and now all we need is your belief and help also. Please give the book the wings it needs to boost its awareness and fly around the world, so everyone gets the opportunity to be Swept away by Wanderlust.

THE FUTURE

Swept away by Wanderlust is destined to travel. You will be apart of that !

OTHER WAYS OF HELPING

You can also help us by liking our facebook page www.facebook.com/Axelandash and getting to know us a bit more by following our blog  www.axelandash.com/blog. Either will put a big smile on our faces.

story:
Coming To: the History

I wrote my first poem at 9 years old: a piece describing how the sun broke through the clouds. The rays cascading to the field below were the most beautiful sight I'd seen.

As an adult, I use writing to break through my own overcast days. I spend my time writing, performing, and teaching. I have cultivated a deep spiritual practice, grounded in the land, and earned a Life Coaching certification. Like coaching, writing is a tool to dig deeply into oneself- to grow roots in the holes one leaves open. I do this work because I believe self knowledge and expression are human rights. They are healing. They are unifying. They are survival.

Coming To is a story of how I survived. It is a series of poems around community, family history, sexuality, and relationships. I wrote these poems when I was just coming to see how I related with the world- in both beautiful and ugly ways. These poems show how I sorted those parts of myself I wanted to keep from those I wished to transform. 

By contributing to this campaign, you will birth Coming To. I have already recorded and mastered the album. I need your help to bring it to the world with the beauty and celebration it deserves, includng: cover art, cds, online sales, and a release party. Excess funds will serve as seeder money for my forthcoming book Place Making (the sequel to Coming To).  

I am Fundraising for $1,100

This will pay for:

  • 300 physical cds 
  • Beautiful cover art by artist Naomi Vinbury
  • Registration for online sales
  • An album release party with guest performances
  • Seed money for the release/promotion of my forthcoming book, Place Making

By contributing to this campaign, you can have all of the products above!

Here's How it Works:

$15+ 2 track downloads from Coming To

$25+ Coming To mailed to you as a cd

$50+

  • Coming To mailed as cd
  • Free Admission to the Album Release Party
  • Printed copies of all poems on Coming To

$100+

  • Coming To mailed as a cd
  • Free Admission to the Album Release Party
  • Printed copies of all poems on Coming To
  • Free copy of Place Making (when released)

$500+

  • Coming To 
  • Free Admission to the Album Release Party
  • Printed copies of all poems on Coming To
  • Free copy of Place Making (when released)
  • I will book a performance at your house or in your area (your choice) within the next year!

If we don't reach our goal, the album will still be released. I will prioritize printing physical cds with cover art and registering for online sales. The success of this campaign will determine the number of cds I print, the amount I am able to pay for cover art, and the size of the cd release party.

Why This Matters

Coming To is my first spoken word album. By contributing to this campaign, you are helping launch my career as a working artist and ensuring that I have revenue to support my ventures in teaching, performing, and sharing self expression.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this Campaign on Facebook, & Twitter using Indiegogo's Share Tools!
  • Email this campaign to your community using this link: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/coming-to-a-s... 

THANK YOU in advance for your support, love, and light.

Keep doing what you do.

story:
Hello there

Many people have seen the Grand Canyon from the bottom, but have you ever watched a one-armed man climb it with no ropes?
Our book, Conuqering the Great Unknown, will bring you to the time when that happened.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We will need $4,900 to make this project come to life. That money will cover the expenses already accrued by the author and illustrator on their first trip to see the sights near the beginning of Powell's expedition. The illustrator will return to see the sights that are only visible by water. The illustrator also needs to finish the last part of Powell's trip, which will include hikes and travel to the locations.
  • Donations will also cover self-publishing costs for both e-publishing and printed publishing.
  • We would like to pay the cast and at least get Dusty that smoothie he wants. So if we get extra funds, we will cut a check to our actors. If we get enough extra, we will use the rest in our marketing budget.
  • We thank all our donors, no matter how big or small. We couldn't do it without you. Large contributors ($300 or more) will get their names in the acknowledgements section.

The Impact

  • When the author and illustrator were exploring on their first trip, they saw a trend. While there are books out there about Powell and his journeys down the Green and Colorado Rivers, none of the other books have portrayed the action-packed scenes in fiction. The author has chosen to alternate between fiction and non-fiction to bring the readers on the journey personally. In addition, the illustrator has chosen to use actors to portray some of the crew and make the scenes come to life.
  • Six of the ten crew members were veterans, three of which were wounded in the war. Their example proves that the impossible can still be achieved no matter what the obstacle.
  • As a conservationist, geologist, environmentalist, explorer and professor, John Wesley Powell understood settling the West was going to be very different from the eastern half of the United States, and through his affiliations with such organizations as the Bureau of Ethnicity and the United States Geological Survey, he rallied the government to be mindful of the shortage of resources west of the Rockies. Although his efforts accomplished very little, he is an example for environmentalists to continue his mission.

Buzz About our Book

Here's the buzz about our book from people who have read the draft so far:

This dynamic duo are retracing the footsteps of explorer John Wesley Powell, whose historic journey down the Colorado River in 1869 made him an American hero. With stunning photographs and lively, well-researched text, this book promises to be a must-have title for those readers interested in the exploration of the American West.

--- Shirley Raye Redmond, author of Stone of the Sun

With my middle school education background, I was interested in reading a book that combined an historic adventure on the wild rivers of the western United States with the coming-of-age story of a young boy looking to find himself. This exciting book tells the tale of the travels of the great explorer John Wesley Powell down the wild Green River and Colorado River through modern eyes. The story weaves the present and past expertly to create a fresh view of an American hero.

 L. Susan Tonelli, Los Alamos Public Schools, NM

Transcription

Hi I'm Angela Reuben, and when I was reading about the Battle of Shiloh during the Civil War, I came across a Major who had to have his arm amputated because he had gotten shot in the arm.

Back then, of course, they didn't have artificial limbs like they do today, so I was wondering... what did he do after the war? He couldn't pull his own boots on anymore and he couldn't button up his own shirt, so what did he do?

I started researching him and I found out he did some really interesting things: he scaled cliffs 2000 feet high with no ropes. He led an expedition down some really wicked rapids without being able to row.

His story was so fascinating that not only did I research it more, but I decided I needed to write about him.

In my book, Conquering the Great Unknown, you're going to meet John Wesley Powell, who was an intelligent, high-spirited man, a geologist, university professor, and you're going to meet his crew.

Dusty Williams is an actor and model who will be portraying John Wesley Powell in the illustrations for my book.

Angela: Dusty, what drew you to play the part of John Wesley Powell?

Dusty: I think in my own life, and I think a lot of people within my age category find themselves sort of intimidated by life and the enormity of having to make something of yourself -- the enormity of the mountain in front of you. And then hearing about this guy who was a professor, and scaled 2000 foot mountains, and sailed down rivers that he couldn't even row by himself, with one arm, and did all of this in the course of many years... I just find that really inspirational. I'm hoping that in playing him, some of that will rub off on me.

Angela: So what attracted you to the project besides the (sarcasm) great money that you will be making?

Dusty: (Laughing) Well surprisingly it wasn't actually the money. If donations happen to come in and I can afford to get myself a smoothie during shooting, that would be wonderful, but really it was the passion of the people involved. These are professional people, and they are so moved by this project that they are donating their time and their skills that they could otherwise be using to get themselves some smoothies. I really believed in supporting them. On a personal note, this is my first time as a sort of a chance to stretch my boundaries.

Angela: So Major Powell, why did you decide to take such a dangerous trip when you knew that nobody else who had tried it, had survived?

Powell: I just couldn't stand seeing those great big expanses labelled "unknown" on the map. I had to know what was out there. And I knew that having just one arm, I couldn't do it all by myself, so I got a fine crew to come with me. Who were the young men who risked their lives to explore with me? You'll have to read the book to find out. And how many of those fine young men paid the ultimate price on that trip? That's in there too.

Angela: So my dream is to tell the story of this famous journey in a little bit different way. A lot of people just use non-fiction, but I want to also bring in some of the more dynamic scenes as "faction,"  which is facts told in a fictional way. I think that people will find that to be really enjoyable and it will stick in their minds. So that's why I teamed up with Dusty and the other actors and J Rae Chip Productions. Her photos are going to captivate your heart and soul. 

We're also going to include a map of the journey we took to take the photos so that you can go and follow our trip.

I'm hoping that my book will inspire wounded Veterans, geologists, explorers, historians, anybody over the age of 8 who likes to read, that they can follow their dreams. And no matter what rapids come into their life, that those things can be navigated and conquered. I appreciate any donations, and I look forward to seeing your comments when we get the book out.
story_txt:
Hello there
Many people have seen the Grand Canyon from the bottom, but have you ever watched a one-armed man climb it with no ropes?

Our book, Conuqering the Great Unknown, will bring you to the time when that happened.



What We Need & What You Get

We will need $4,900 to make this project come to life. That money will cover the expenses already accrued by the author and illustrator on their first trip to see the sights near the beginning of Powell's expedition. The illustrator will return to see the sights that are only visible by water. The illustrator also needs to finish the last part of Powell's trip, which will include hikes and travel to the locations.
Donations will also cover self-publishing costs for both e-publishing and printed publishing.
We would like to pay the cast and at least get Dusty that smoothie he wants. So if we get extra funds, we will cut a check to our actors. If we get enough extra, we will use the rest in our marketing budget.
We thank all our donors, no matter how big or small. We couldn't do it without you. Large contributors ($300 or more) will get their names in the acknowledgements section.



The Impact

When the author and illustrator were exploring on their first trip, they saw a trend. While there are books out there about Powell and his journeys down the Green and Colorado Rivers, none of the other books have portrayed the action-packed scenes in fiction. The author has chosen to alternate between fiction and non-fiction to bring the readers on the journey personally. In addition, the illustrator has chosen to use actors to portray some of the crew and make the scenes come to life.
Six of the ten crew members were veterans, three of which were wounded in the war. Their example proves that the impossible can still be achieved no matter what the obstacle.
As a conservationist, geologist, environmentalist, explorer and professor, John Wesley Powell understood settling the West was going to be very different from the eastern half of the United States, and through his affiliations with such organizations as the Bureau of Ethnicity and the United States Geological Survey, he rallied the government to be mindful of the shortage of resources west of the Rockies. Although his efforts accomplished very little, he is an example for environmentalists to continue his mission.



Buzz About our Book
Here's the buzz about our book from people who have read the draft so far:

This dynamic duo are retracing the footsteps of explorer John Wesley Powell, whose historic journey down the Colorado River in 1869 made him an American hero. With stunning photographs and lively, well-researched text, this book promises to be a must-have title for those readers interested in the exploration of the American West.
--- Shirley Raye Redmond, author of Stone of the Sun
With my middle school education background, I was interested in reading a book that combined an historic adventure on the wild rivers of the western United States with the coming-of-age story of a young boy looking to find himself. This exciting book tells the tale of the travels of the great explorer John Wesley Powell down the wild Green River and Colorado River through modern eyes. The story weaves the present and past expertly to create a fresh view of an American hero.
  L. Susan Tonelli, Los Alamos Public Schools, NM

Transcription

Hi I'm Angela Reuben, and when I was reading about the Battle of Shiloh during the Civil War, I came across a Major who had to have his arm amputated because he had gotten shot in the arm.
Back then, of course, they didn't have artificial limbs like they do today, so I was wondering... what did he do after the war? He couldn't pull his own boots on anymore and he couldn't button up his own shirt, so what did he do?
I started researching him and I found out he did some really interesting things: he scaled cliffs 2000 feet high with no ropes. He led an expedition down some really wicked rapids without being able to row.
His story was so fascinating that not only did I research it more, but I decided I needed to write about him.
In my book, Conquering the Great Unknown, you're going to meet John Wesley Powell, who was an intelligent, high-spirited man, a geologist, university professor, and you're going to meet his crew.
Dusty Williams is an actor and model who will be portraying John Wesley Powell in the illustrations for my book.
Angela: Dusty, what drew you to play the part of John Wesley Powell?
Dusty: I think in my own life, and I think a lot of people within my age category find themselves sort of intimidated by life and the enormity of having to make something of yourself -- the enormity of the mountain in front of you. And then hearing about this guy who was a professor, and scaled 2000 foot mountains, and sailed down rivers that he couldn't even row by himself, with one arm, and did all of this in the course of many years... I just find that really inspirational. I'm hoping that in playing him, some of that will rub off on me.
Angela: So what attracted you to the project besides the (sarcasm) great money that you will be making?
Dusty: (Laughing) Well surprisingly it wasn't actually the money. If donations happen to come in and I can afford to get myself a smoothie during shooting, that would be wonderful, but really it was the passion of the people involved. These are professional people, and they are so moved by this project that they are donating their time and their skills that they could otherwise be using to get themselves some smoothies. I really believed in supporting them. On a personal note, this is my first time as a sort of a chance to stretch my boundaries.
Angela: So Major Powell, why did you decide to take such a dangerous trip when you knew that nobody else who had tried it, had survived?
Powell: I just couldn't stand seeing those great big expanses labelled "unknown" on the map. I had to know what was out there. And I knew that having just one arm, I couldn't do it all by myself, so I got a fine crew to come with me. Who were the young men who risked their lives to explore with me? You'll have to read the book to find out. And how many of those fine young men paid the ultimate price on that trip? That's in there too.
Angela: So my dream is to tell the story of this famous journey in a little bit different way. A lot of people just use non-fiction, but I want to also bring in some of the more dynamic scenes as "faction,"  which is facts told in a fictional way. I think that people will find that to be really enjoyable and it will stick in their minds. So that's why I teamed up with Dusty and the other actors and J Rae Chip Productions. Her photos are going to captivate your heart and soul. 
We're also going to include a map of the journey we took to take the photos so that you can go and follow our trip.
I'm hoping that my book will inspire wounded Veterans, geologists, explorers, historians, anybody over the age of 8 who likes to read, that they can follow their dreams. And no matter what rapids come into their life, that those things can be navigated and conquered. I appreciate any donations, and I look forward to seeing your comments when we get the book out.

story:
There are two really important parts to this project - the book, and the publishing company behind it. Here's what you need to know: 

Sweet Candy Press is the natural evolution of Sweet Candy Distro - a DIY company run by Sage Adderley for the past nine years. Sweet Candy has always been about amplifying voices that would otherwise be ignored by the mainstream. Stories of women, queer/trans folks, people of color - the stories that matter most are often the ones that are the least heard. 

Everybody Else's Girl is two books, really. "What Happened" is the story of a girlhood polluted by physical and sexual abuse against the landscape of poverty and addiction prevalent in the trailer parks she grew up in. "What Helps" is divided by subject into things like community, punk rock, and zines (among others) to talk about the unlikely things that helped her endure the unique challenges of growing up poor white trash.

 

UPDATE 6-14-13

Sage uploaded a new video! Click the Gallery tab to view it.

 

UPDATE 6-17-13

Sarah uploaded a new video! Click the Gallery tab to view it.

story:
What is the book about?

Short stories and chronicles based on the real life experiences of a taxi driver in Miami.

The story of the book

A couple of months ago, a Miami taxi driver came to my door. He brought a dream with him: to publish his book.

This taxi driver had driven around Miami for 12 years during night shifts.  He drove and wrote. Wrote and drove. Until one day someone told him he would never make his dream a reality if he continued working as a taxi driver.

He followed the advice, the bad advice, of selling his taxi and using the funds to seek out a path that would allow him to fulfill his dream.

This Writer-Taxi Driver had written all of his stories on loose sheets, in notebooks, in whatever piece of paper he had at hand. But he did not know anything about computers.

He needed someone to help him transcribe all of these stories, and to edit and organize them.

Ad posted for the Writer-Taxi Driver in newspaper Diario Las Americas.  “I need a grammar teacher to type out manuscript to a computer hard drive”.

Someone (with good or bad intentions) charged him a lot of money for a transcription.

He came to me when he had nearly run out of the money he got from the sale of his cab, and with a draft that was still not ready for publication.

Eriginal Books fully funded the correction, editing, cover design and layout of his book.

What is still missing? Some additional funds for the printing costs of the book.

Kobe Bryant encouraged the Writer Taxi Driver to finish his book and gave him his autograph. 

Who is the author?

The author does not want to reveal his name yet.  He will sign with a pseudonym: The Writer-Taxi Driver.

Why? Many people don´t believe in him. I think he wants the work to speak for itself.

What is Eriginal Books?

ERIGINAL BOOKS is a publishing house specialized in Hispanic literature.

ERIGINAL BOOKS IS not a classic publisher; it is a cultural agent of the 21st century that is constantly evolving and experiment with industry expectations.

Its mission is to promote Hispanic authors and cultures in the new digital world.

Why is Eriginal Books a different kind of publisher?

  • We publish and promote the work of new and independent authors.
  • We think that any writer should have the opportunity to be published, just as much as the reader has the right to read their well-edited work.
  • We believe that publishers have to change the way they envisioned their traditional role in the publishing industry
  • We want the authors to keep full control and rights over their work.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will not rely solely on your contributions. We are in this together.

Eriginal Books has already fully funded the correction, editing, cover design and layout of the book.  What we need now are some additional funds to cover the printing costs of the book.

How will the funds be used?

  • About 70% will cover the print costs; and
  • The other 30% will cover Indiegogo fees and the shipping of books to our supporters.

Other ways you can help

Support isn’t just about money! Some people may not have the means to contribute any money, but they can still help out:

  • Ask your friends to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools and any other sharing platform you can think of!

Thank you all so much!

Who are we?

Marlene Moleon is a documentary filmmaker, editor, writer and the founder of Eriginal Books, Miami. Her film “En busca de la felicidad”  (The Pursuit of Happiness) won the Catholic Cathedral prize of the Latin American Association for Radio and Television. She was the editor in chief of the electronic journal Futuros (2001-2009). Author of “Bestseller 2.0, Historias de éxitos en Amazon”.

Ernesto Valdes is a graphic designer, animation specialist and videographer, specializing in booktrailers and cover design. He is the president of the company ENZOFT (Santo Domingo), which often collaborates with Eriginal Books. Ernesto made the video trailer for this campaign.

Elena Blanco is a graphic designer and visual artist, specializing in logos and book cover design. Author and illustrator of the children’s book “The Talented Demetri”. She designed the cover of Hey Taxi! and the icon for the Writer-Taxi Driver.

Lorenzo Lunar is a Cuban author of several novels and collections of short stories. Winner of several awards in Cuba, Spain and Puerto Rico. He was one of the two coeditors for Hey Taxi!.

Rebeca Murga is a Cuban narrator and literary critic. She is a professor of literature and creative writing workshops, as well as author of several books.  Winner of several awards in Cuba and Spain. She was the second coeditor for Hey Taxi!.

And of Course: The Writer-Taxi Driver. 

One of the passengers told the WriterTaxi driver that her name Hǎo Yùn meant good luck and wished him luck on his project. Don’t you?

EN ESPAÑOL

Esta campaña no se trata de la publicación de otro libro. En realidad es más que eso. Se trata de ayudar a un taxista en Miami a cumplir su sueño de ser un autor publicado.

¿De qué es el libro?

Cuentos y crónicas basadas en la vida real de experiencias de un conductor de taxi en Miami.

La historia del libro

Hace un par de meses, un taxista de Miami tocó a mi puerta.  Traía un sueño: publicar un libro.

Este taxista había conducido alrededor de Miami durante doce años durante los turnos de noche. Manejaba y  escribía. Escribía y manejaba . Hasta que un día alguien le dijo que nunca podría hacer su sueño una realidad si continuaba trabajando como taxista .

Él siguió el consejo, o el mal consejo, de vender su taxi y usó esos fondos para buscar un camino que le permitiera cumplir su sueño.

Este Escritor Taxista había escrito todas sus historias en hojas sueltas, en cuadernos, en cualquier trozo de papel que tenía en la mano. Pero no sabía nada de ordenadores.

Necesitaba a alguien que le ayudara a transcribir todas estas historias, editarlas y organizarlas.

Alguien (con buenas o malas intenciones)  le cobró un montón de dinero por las transcripciones.

Vino a mí  casi sin dinero y con un proyecto que aún no estaba listo para su publicación.

Eriginal Books financió totalmente la corrección, edición, diseño de la portada y el diseño del libro .

¿Qué falta ahora? Algunos fondos adicionales para los gastos de impresión del libro.

¿Quién es el autor ?

El autor no quiso revelar su nombre. Firmará con seudónimo: El Escritor Taxista .

¿Por qué? Muchas personas no creen en él. Creo que quiere que la obra hable por sí misma.

¿Qué es Eriginal Books ?

ERIGINAL BOOKS es una editorial especializada en literatura hispana .

ERIGINAL BOOKS no es una editorial clásica. Es un agente cultural del siglo 21 que está en constante evolución y experimentación con las expectativas de la industria.

Su misión es promover autores y culturas hispanas en el nuevo mundo digital.

¿Por qué es Eriginal Books diferente a otra casa editorial?

• Publicamos y promovemos la obra de autores nuevos e independientes.

• Creemos que todo escritor debe tener la oportunidad de ser publicado, al mismo tiempo que el lector tiene derecho a leer su trabajo bien editado.

• Creemos que las casas editoriales tienen que cambiar la forma en que concibieron su papel en la industria del libro.

• Queremos que los autores mantengan el control total y los derechos sobre su obra.

¿Qué necesitamos y que obtienes?

Este libro no se basará únicamente en sus contribuciones. Estamos en esto juntos.

Eriginal Books ha financiado la corrección, edición, diseño de la portada y el diseño del libro. Lo que necesitamos ahora son algunos fondos adicionales para cubrir los costos de impresión del libro.

¿Cómo se utilizarán los fondos?

• Alrededor del 70 % cubrirá los costos de impresión y

• El 30% restante cubrirá los honorarios IndieGoGo y el envío de libros .

Otras formas de ayudar

¡La ayuda no es sólo cuestión de dinero! Algunas personas pueden no tener los medios para contribuir financieramente, pero aún así pueden ayudar:

•  Pidale a sus amigos que ayuden a  correr la voz y hagan un poco de ruido de esta campaña .

• Recuérdeles utilizar las herramientas de participación IndieGoGo y cualquier otra plataforma de intercambio que pueda imaginar !

Muchas gracias a todos

¿Quiénes somos?

Marlene Moleon es una documentalista, editora, escritora y fundadora de Eriginal Books (Miami). Su documental "En busca de la felicidad" ganó el Premio Catedral de la Asociación Latinoamericana de Radio y Televisión Católica.  Fue la editora de la revista electrónica "Futuros" (2001-2009). Autora de  “Bestseller 2.0 , Historias de Éxitos en Amazon”.

Ernesto Valdés es un diseñador gráfico, especialista en animación y  videografo, especializado en booktrailers y diseño de portadas. Es el presidente de la compañía ENZOFT (Santo Domingo), que colabora a menudo con Eriginal Books. Ernesto hizo el trailer de esta campaña .

Elena Blanco es una diseñadora gráfica y artista visual, especializada en logotipos y diseño de portadas. Autora e ilustradora del libro infantil "The Talented Demetri ". Elena diseñó la portada de "Hey Taxi!" y el icono del Escritor Taxista .

Lorenzo Lunar es un escritor cubano. Autor de varias novelas y colecciones de cuentos. Ganador de varios premios en Cuba, España y Puerto Rico. Fue uno de los dos coeditores de “Hey Taxi!”.

Rebeca Murga es una narradora cubana y crítica literaria. Ella es profesora de literatura y talleres de escritura creativa, además de autora de varios libros. Ganadora de varios premios en Cuba y España. Ella fue la segunda coeditora de “Hey Taxi!”

Y por supuesto: El escritor Taxista.

Ernesto Valdés es un diseñador gráfico,
especialista en animación y  videografo, especializado en booktrailers y
diseño de portadas. Es el presidente de la compañía ENZOFT (Santo Domingo), que
colabora a menudo con Eriginal Books. Ernesto hizo el trailer de esta campaña .
Elena Blanco es una diseñadora gráfica y
artista visual, especializada en logotipos y diseño de portadas. Autora e
ilustradora del libro infantil "The Talented Demetri ". Elena diseñó
la portada de "Hey Taxi!" y el icono del Escritor Taxista .
Lorenzo Lunar es un escritor cubano. Autor
de varias novelas y colecciones de cuentos. Ganador de varios premios en Cuba,
España y Puerto Rico. Fue uno de los dos coeditores de “Hey Taxi!”.
Rebeca Murga es una narradora cubana y
crítica literaria. Ella es profesora de literatura y talleres de escritura
creativa, además de autora de varios libros. Ganadora de varios premios en Cuba
y España. Ella fue la segunda coeditora de “Hey Taxi!”
Y por supuesto: El
escritor Taxista.

story:
About the Project

My name is Ryland Davidson. I am a 5th grader at Desert Sun Academy in Cave Creek, Arizona. I recently learned about The Ryan House, which helps terminally ill kids and their families through very hard times.

My Goal

The Ryan House spends an average of $1000.00 per family each day, including medical care. My goal is to raise this amount along with $200 for scrapbook materials. Families at The Ryan House often create scrapbooks to remember their loved ones and their time together.

The Impact

By meeting our goal, we can all help these families out. The Ryan House does not charge families for their services. They depend on donations from the community.

Please Spread The Word

If you can't donate, all I ask is that you tell 5 people you know about this cause. Together we can make a difference!
