story:
Who I Am

Salutations, internet people. I am Asher Cantrell, a writer of ill repute and the owner of Weird Shit Blog. You may have read some of my work on sites like Cracked.com, mental_floss, Film School Rejects, and more. I've also just published my first full-length nonfiction book, The Book of Word Records, available in fine bookstores (and probably some that are coarse, as well) worldwide.

What I'm Doing

I'm funding my first fiction publication, an ebook of short stories entitled Supplicants to Other Gods. (I'm not married to the name, so I may change it.) 

Why I Am Doing That Thing I Just Mentioned

If you're thinking, "Hey, it doesn't cost any money to self-publish an ebook," you're correct! It doesn't. I don't even have to hire someone to format the book for me, as that is one of my many (read: few) skills.

The reason I'm trying to secure funding upfront is simple: I really need money as soon as possible. I've been saving up for over two years to move to a different state. It's been a very slow process because I live paycheck to paycheck, and any disaster that comes along wipes out my savings.

The reason I want to move to another state so badly is that my wife and I have been separated (not legally) for almost two years because she moved back in with her parents after her mother ended up with leukemia and lymphoma. (Thankfully, she's currently in remission, but she still needs day-to-day help.) I've been trying to scrape up the funds to move up there so we can, you know, be a family and stuff, but, again, it's a very slow process.

Why I'm Doing This Now

The plan was that I'd move up there by the end of this year but, unfortunately, yet another shitty situation has reared its head. I got caught driving in an offshoot of one of the bad storms that hit the Midwest the week of November 17th and had a minor accident. It wasn't a huge deal...

But I still had to pay a $500 deductible to my insurance to get it fixed. (The damage wasn't just cosmetic or I wouldn't have worried about it.) That was a pretty huge chunk of my moving money.

Point is, I'm sick of scrimping and saving, then having to start all over again when something else comes along a few months later. This time, I decided I'd try to do something about it. Besides shamelessly begging, that is, which brings me to...

"Didn't I Just Give You Money a Few Months Ago?"

You may have! I had to come to the internet, hat-in-hand, a few months back after a drunk driver smashed into my parked car and neither my nor his insurance would cover it. (According to his insurance company, his policy lapsed the day the accident happened. Somehow, my policy didn't cover uninsured motorists.)


I didn't have the few thousand dollars it would take to get another car, so I begged for it. I didn't like having to do it, but I was feeling pretty hopeless at the time and some friends encouraged me to do it. Luckily, some very kind people helped me raise just over $3,000 and I got the car from earlier. The silver one up there. Yeah, the busted one.

"Ugh, Fine. Whatever. I'll Help You Out, But Mostly Just Because I Feel Sorry For Your Wife. What Do I Get?"

Currently, I have three tiers of contribution.

  1. $1 gets you a short, tweet length post featured on Weird Shit Blog and its social media pages. I post two a day already, and they're just really bizarre jokes about the occult, other dimensions, and inhuman monsters. I call them hexts. You will decide the content of one hext and I will write it for you in my silly "trademark" style. I will also include your name (real or username) and a link to whatever you choose. (Keep in mind that links reduce the character count by 20 on Twitter, so we may have to work around that.)
  2. As a bonus, $1 also gets you a special thanks in my next book from Adams Media and in Supplicants to Other Gods as well. 
  3. For $3, you'll be preordering the ebook of Supplicants to Other Gods. It will be finished by February 1, 2014 and you will have your choice of DRM-free formats including .mobi (works on Kindle), .epub (works on iPad/iPhone/iPod Touch, Android, Nook, etc.), .pdf (works on everything) and any other format your heart so desires. I will put it in pictographs if that's what you want. You will also receive the $1 rewards. (NOTE: The book will be available on Amazon's Kindle Store and other digital bookstores, but I can't pre-sell copies of those, sorry. Also, I obviously wouldn't be getting that money until well after this fundraiser is over.)
  4. For $15, you can get a signed copy of The Book of Word Records. That includes U.S. shipping. (I'm still figuring out international shipping, and I might have to do it on a case-by-case basis. E-mail me at weirdshitblog@gmail.com if you're outside the U.S. and want to order a copy and we'll work it out.) You'll also get two DRM-free copies of Supplicants to Other Gods. One for you, one for a friend! Finally, you also get the $1 rewards!

"Anything Else?"

If I think of any more neat rewards I can do, I'll make sure to update this page. If you can think of anything you'd like me to add as a reward, e-mail me and let me know and I'll see what can be done.

Also, I'm not sure if you can do stretch goals on here, but I'm considering maybe doing a print run of Supplicants to Other Gods if this goes well. (Maybe with even more bonus stories?) Printing costs a bit, though, so it really depends.

Last Words

Okay, thank you for reading all that. I hope you'll contribute and I'll make a book you like and everyone is happy! Especially my wife.

(Campaign photo by Ashwini Sukhdeve.)

story:
About Me:

My name is Jacy Topps and I'm a fashion journalist and blogger. I moved to the extravagant city of New York three and a half years ago. When you decide to drop the comforts of a conventional lifestyle for a nonconventional one, you know there will be struggle, but I had no idea of the adversities that I would go through. 

About The Project:

There are always the ubiquitous stories of crashing on friends' couches, ramen noodle dinners and monthly requests of wiring money. But mine is not your average run-of-mill starving artist making it in the big city story. Hell, I haven't even "made it" yet. Is there still such a thing? This memoir is a hilarious look into my life as an over dramatic lesbian in my 30s conquering the fashion world. There are crazy internships, fashion week adventures, one night stands, all night dance parties, and drunken bon fires. I tackle lesbian dating, fashionably persevere through homelessness, and make awesome friends along the way. You can take a look at my blog as a preview of my unforgettable fashion exploits. I'm halfway done writing it and will come up with a book title then. 

What You're Funding:

You will be funding the production of this memoir: cover, publishing, printing, and marketing. 

Why Am I Writing A Memoir:

I have wanted to move to NYC since I was 9 years old. When I finally decided to man up and do it, all I heard from people was "Oh, are you sure? New York is so hard!" Well the truth is, it has been the hardest 3 years of my life. But the most rewarding too. Nothing ever extraordinary happens until you make that jump. Not that I'm saying I'm such an inspiration, but do I think people would benefit from hearing about my experiences. So I'm asking for your help. 

Other ways you can help

If you can’t contribute financially, please:

• Share this campaign with your friends and family

• Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.

story:
Epiphanies are more subtle than we realize!

The night it struck me, I was sitting on my patio with Roberto Bolano’s 2666 folded over my lap. The cicadas from beyond the mesquites that ensconced my yard slowly began to call in their disconnected chirps until they found each other and harmonized in a tangle of abrasive little bellows that rose and fell like city sirens. As I continued to read, a subtle a wave of recognition entered my thoughts—barely perceptible at first, more akin to awareness than any tangible idea. It gradually matured from a hint of suggestion into palpable understanding. Questions began to formulate. What truly is literature? What is the basis for a masterpiece?  What is the inextricable relationship between reader and author? I became fascinated by the tenuous bonds of literary understanding, reinforced each time a person opened a book and continued to turn the page.

 My epiphany was the subtle recognition in the potential power of literature. It wasn't the kind of dumbfounding moment where the heavens open up as the sun cuts through the sky, pushing through the clouds of uncertainty. It was much more modest and easily missed. A piqued interest moved me to seek out additional works. I began a personal journey, blindly navigating the literary landscape. Unguided, I stumbled through the great works, fumbling for knowledge. Moved by Hugo’s detailed characterizations, Tolstoy’s epic historical landscapes, and Hemingway’s penchant for brevity and subtext, I decided to pursue scholarship formally. 

Inspired but what did I do about it?

Those of you close to me know that I am currently enrolled in a graduate English Studies program at the University of Texas at Brownsville. My intent has been to expose myself to as many stories and styles of writing as possible. 

I have been on a journey. Writing and exploring the stories that are close to me, my family, and the region where I live. I have found that there is a voice within me that resonates in the words I cobble together out of my imagination and personal experience. I am a native Texan, third generation Mexican-American, father, husband, son, grandson, and friend who is marked  by the indelible connections between love, family and culture.

Cano the fiction writer!?!?

I have dedicated the last year to fine tuning my skills and developing stories. It has been a personal goal to reach the point where my work can be considered a serious offering. 

In pursuing opportunities to share my work I became aware of VONA Voices, http://www.voicesatvona.org/  an esteemed program hosted at UC Berkeley. 

The annual workshop is a competitive program where writers from across the country apply for the opportunity to work with some of the most talented authors active today. This year there were a record number of applicants and I was selected as one of about 10 fiction writers from a pool of nearly 1000 hopeful contributors.  My class will be led by Junot Diaz, a Pulitzer Prize winning author, whose most recent work This is How You Lose Her  was a finalist for the National Book Award in 2013. 

http://www.junotdiaz.com/

It is both humbling and exciting to know that my work was accepted.

I see this workshop as an opportunity to further sharpen my skills and refine my work for publication. My intention is to publish so that I may share the stories that have moved me. Sometimes they tickle, some times they knock me on my ass, but they always move me. 

You can see some of my recent efforts here:

http://canocostilla.wordpress.com


Why I need help...

The breakdown:

  • The Workshop costs $800 and there are travel costs associated with reaching California from Texas. In addition I need to pay my own accommodations and meals. I expect I will need about $2000 to attend the workshop which runs from Sunday June 22 to Sunday June 29th. I am only asking for assistance with the fee associated with the program, but any contribution beyond the funding goal will be applied to the additional costs related to the trip.
  • I have included a few perks. You can get advanced copies of my work as well as a signed manuscript of the work I produce as a result of the program.
  • If I don't reach the entire goal, the funds raised will be applied to the costs associated with the conference.

Thanks

Your consideration and contributions would mean a-lot to me personally. Thank You. Thank You. Thank You. 

I feel that with the support of my friends, family and community I am more than a man who writes stories. I am a voice and I will carry you all with me to California. These stories which I hold so dear, in a sense, become yours, because it was through you that they were realized.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute or have contributed already then I just ask that you share with your friends and family. 

You can help get the word out and make some noise about my campaign using the Indiegogo share tools to link to your preferred social media accounts. 

Thanks again

Cano

story:
Reconozco que fue una auténtica locura la primera vez en la que participé en el Marathon des Sables (2007), una auténtica osadía por mi parte y un auténtico milagro que lo finalizase...vivo.

Ahora, varios años después, tengo muchos más kilómetros en mis piernas y he ganado veteranía, y tras tres participaciones en la prueba por etapas en autosuficiencia más dura del mundo, me sigue sorprendiendo que mi cuerpo pueda finalizarlo.

La experiencia es un grado, pero el Desierto, si quiere, acaba contigo poco a poco.

Cuando mi familia y mis amigos me preguntan por qué hago esta locura de correr por el Sahara, deben de pensar que estoy loco,  porque no tengo respuesta. Yo solo puedo decir que es espectacular, pero ahí me quedo, no sé explicarlo con palabras. Es más, creo que aunque supiera dar una explicación clara del motivo por el cuál el desierto me ha atrapado, seguirían sin entenderme. Ojalá os pudiera llevar conmigo para que pudiérais sentir lo que yo siento en el desierto, pero cargar con mi mochila ya me llega ;)

Es un mundo que atrapa. No se trata de llegar el primero o el último, sólo es una competición para unos pocos, para los profesionales, pero para el resto es un reto no competitivo. El tiempo que voy a necesitar para completar cada etapa no me preocupa, sólo me preocupa llegar y que el resto de españoles lo logren también. Si alguien necesita ayuda te paras a ayudarle, ya sea en forma de agua, en forma de gel energético o en forma de un simple “vamos”… El compañerismo se encuentra dentro del campamento y también la convivencia más pura y sincera.

Reconozco y no me importa, que siempre he llorado al entrar en meta, o cuando recibo los mails de apoyo, o cuando echo de menos a mi familia... En realidad me he dado cuenta de que soy un llorón, pero es lo que me gusta, me gusta correr, pasar hambre, sed, soportar temperaturas de 50 grados sin brisas agradables o el dolor de pies. Y aunque durante la carrera siempre pienso en que no quiero volver, que no quiero volver a sufrir, al entrar por la meta me pregunto cuánto tiempo podré estar sin participar en una nueva edición.

Este año no he podido aguantar y voy por segundo año consecutivo. Los otros 2 años que he participado he tenido la suerte de contar con diferentes patrocinadores pero lamentablemente la crisis nos ha afectado a todos, y es por ello, que os pido que me echéis una mano...

Aunque no podáis ayudarme económicamente, todos podéis apoyarme compartiendo este enlace. A todos, por adelantado, MUCHAS GRACIAS! 


Para poder cumplir mi sueño necesitaré al menos 5000.-€, para poder cubrir:

1.- 3800€.- Inscripción y desplazamientos

2.- 800€.- Material deportivo: bastones, mochila, zapatillas, saco y esterilla, cargador solar y ropa técnica.

3.- 400.- Comida: Comida liofilizada para 6 días, geles, barritas energéticas y complementos vitamínicos


Mis anteriores participaciones en el Marathon des Sables ya están tatuadas en mi piel. Y con tu ayuda, estoy seguro que este año aumentare mi tatuaje :)  

Enlaces ediciones anteriores:

2013.-Apoyo a Alberto desde Facebook

2013.- La Opinion: ´Fue espectacular. No querría volver pero sé que lo haré´

2013.- La voz de Galicia: ´Llega un momento en el que el dolor es insoportable´
2010.-La voz de galicia: ´Cinco coruñeses participarán en el Maratón de las Arenas, la carrera de ultrafondo más dura del mundo´
2007.-Apoyo a Alberto desde Blog
story_txt:
Reconozco que fue una auténtica locura la primera vez en la que participé en el Marathon des Sables (2007), una auténtica osadía por mi parte y un auténtico milagro que lo finalizase...vivo.Ahora, varios años después, tengo muchos más kilómetros en mis piernas y he ganado veteranía, y tras tres participaciones en la prueba por etapas en autosuficiencia más dura del mundo, me sigue sorprendiendo que mi cuerpo pueda finalizarlo.La experiencia es un grado, pero el Desierto, si quiere, acaba contigo poco a poco.Cuando mi familia y mis amigos me preguntan por qué hago esta locura de correr por el Sahara, deben de pensar que estoy loco,  porque no tengo respuesta. Yo solo puedo decir que es espectacular, pero ahí me quedo, no sé explicarlo con palabras. Es más, creo que aunque supiera dar una explicación clara del motivo por el cuál el desierto me ha atrapado, seguirían sin entenderme. Ojalá os pudiera llevar conmigo para que pudiérais sentir lo que yo siento en el desierto, pero cargar con mi mochila ya me llega ;)Es un mundo que atrapa. No se trata de llegar el primero o el último, sólo es una competición para unos pocos, para los profesionales, pero para el resto es un reto no competitivo. El tiempo que voy a necesitar para completar cada etapa no me preocupa, sólo me preocupa llegar y que el resto de españoles lo logren también. Si alguien necesita ayuda te paras a ayudarle, ya sea en forma de agua, en forma de gel energético o en forma de un simple “vamos”… El compañerismo se encuentra dentro del campamento y también la convivencia más pura y sincera.Reconozco y no me importa, que siempre he llorado al entrar en meta, o cuando recibo los mails de apoyo, o cuando echo de menos a mi familia... En realidad me he dado cuenta de que soy un llorón, pero es lo que me gusta, me gusta correr, pasar hambre, sed, soportar temperaturas de 50 grados sin brisas agradables o el dolor de pies. Y aunque durante la carrera siempre pienso en que no quiero volver, que no quiero volver a sufrir, al entrar por la meta me pregunto cuánto tiempo podré estar sin participar en una nueva edición.Este año no he podido aguantar y voy por segundo año consecutivo. Los otros 2 años que he participado he tenido la suerte de contar con diferentes patrocinadores pero lamentablemente la crisis nos ha afectado a todos, y es por ello, que os pido que me echéis una mano...Aunque no podáis ayudarme económicamente, todos podéis apoyarme compartiendo este enlace. A todos, por adelantado, MUCHAS GRACIAS! Para poder cumplir mi sueño necesitaré al menos 5000.-€, para poder cubrir:1.- 3800€.- Inscripción y desplazamientos2.- 800€.- Material deportivo: bastones, mochila, zapatillas, saco y esterilla, cargador solar y ropa técnica.3.- 400.- Comida: Comida liofilizada para 6 días, geles, barritas energéticas y complementos vitamínicosMis anteriores participaciones en el Marathon des Sables ya están tatuadas en mi piel. Y con tu ayuda, estoy seguro que este año aumentare mi tatuaje :)  Enlaces ediciones anteriores:2013.-Apoyo a Alberto desde Facebook2013.- La Opinion: ´Fue espectacular. No querría volver pero sé que lo haré´2013.- La voz de Galicia: ´Llega un momento en el que el dolor es insoportable´
2010.-La voz de galicia: ´Cinco coruñeses participarán en el Maratón de las Arenas, la carrera de ultrafondo más dura del mundo´
2007.-Apoyo a Alberto desde Blog

story:
Only 5 years later...

Five years ago I was devastated when my best friend, business partner, and god father of my children left the country with millions of dollars from the sale of a business that we started.

"How could I have been so blind and so stupid", I asked myself as I ridiculed the tears falling from my eyes again. I found myself over and over again sitting on the side of my bed searching for the suicide clause in the insurance policy and the courage to take action.

This time I was going to do it.  I was going to make sure my family was taken care of in my absence but first I wanted to say good-bye.

One of my final good-byes led me to speak with a close friend and psychotherapist that explained how I lost who I was.  During our conversation he sent me on a journey;  "You must find your confidence again, your power, and your influence.  You have to get your MOJO back and then share the secret of getting it with the world."

Did he recognize my distress?  Did he know this was good-bye?  

I don’t know what his perception of me was at that moment, but he planted a seed that as it grew it perplexed my mind. 

For the first time in month, I could not sleep - but not because of depression - I could not sleep because my thoughts were consumed with the fountain of MOJO; that magical elixir that gives the caster to power to influence the world with a confidence that is unstoppable.  

"What if I could find it?”  I thought.  "What if it's out there and I could help others find theirs?"

Five years later with thousands of case studies completed and a manuscript near completion I need a little help reaching the finish line.

I learned that there are two elements of mojo - unstoppable confidence and powerful influence.  I discovered that incongruence kills influence and doubt destroys confidence.  

I discovered that MOJO can be powerful for good or for evil.  The point is that everyone has some - they just need to tap into it.

As the research grew and my knowledge increased I became a Mojo Wielding Maven.  I could barely see the broken pieces of me any more... and what's more - I had helped thousands of people tap into thier inner power!  The MOJO FORMULA was complete and I was like a mad scientist.

Now I just need to get it into the hands of the people that need it the most. 


Who am I? 

My name is Dawnna St Louis and I have been traveling, lecturing, and sharing the Science of Mojo for several years. 

As I mentioned, I have been compiling data and stories for this book for five years and it has been a wonderful life changing - no - life saving challenge!  It is a journey from confidence interrupted to mojo found and the secret formula I discovered in the middle.

The book is multi-layered with stories from my life and my first glimpses at Mojo. Through my passage through the experience of loss in my life, I am able to share the real and seemingly real ways that we have all seen mojo in action, how we react to it, and how we can acquire, increase, and wield mojo as a superpower in our personal, private, and professional lives.

The Science of Mojo speaks to every woman that did not feel the power to speak up and regretted it, to every man that wanted the courage to talk to the prettiest girl in the room but didn't because he thought he wasn’t good enough, and to every person that wants to be a leader but refrains from stepping out of the dark and taking a stand in their spotlight.  This book was written for the people that say, "I wanted to, but..." or,  "What if I can't,"  or, "I should have.”

This book is written for the people that want to move past a moment of doubt into a lifetime of doing. 

Here are the chapters:

Chapter 1  Confidence Interrupted
Chapter 2  Power And Influence
Chapter 3  Wielding A Superpower
Chapter 4  The Warning Label
Chapter 5  The Sunny Side Of The Road
Chapter 6  Changing Your Mind
Chapter 7  The Elements Of Mojo
Chapter 8  Your  Mojo Factor
Chapter 9  Your Unstoppable Confidence
Chapter 10 Powerful Influence
Chapter 11 Mojo Kryptonite
Chapter 12 Feeding Your Mojo
Chapter 13 The Mojo Elixir



Bryant's Case Study






What We Need 

The launch for the book is March 30th, 2014, but in order to that, I need people who believe in my message of MOJO. The release of the book is March 30th, but for those that donate to this campaign, you can grab you print or eBook copy on March 23rd. The audio book launch is May 10th, 2014, but you can have your own copy by May 7th, 2014.

(Only 2 available)

The Impact

The Science of MOJO has, not only changed my life, but save it.  Over the course of this project people have said how much I have grown stronger - even stronger than I was before when I was a business owner.

I have watched people on my journey drink the magical MOJO elixir and transform in front of my eyes.  There is something about knowing that you can reach a goal previously thought impossible that makes you feel unstoppable and causes other people to believe the same.

My goal is to donate FREE copies of this book to Women in Distress, Libraries, and to people that really need to put down the life insurance policy and pick up the pieces of their life like I did.

I want people to feed the Mojo within and bring their inner power out so they can be happy.

Other Ways You Can Help

So you are thinking DAMN!  I really want to help but I don't have the funds.  That's ok.  I didn't have the funds either.

But, you do have an internet browser, a mouse, and a finger.  Just share the project with your friends and ask them to contribute.  A little or a lot, but anything is appreciated.

THANK YOU FOR BELIEVING IN ME and THIS PROJECT!
Dawnna

want people to feed the Mojo within and bring their inner power out so they can
be happy.
Other Ways You Can Help
So
you are thinking DAMN!  I really want to help but I don't have the funds.
 That's ok.  I didn't have the funds either.
But, you do have an internet browser, a mouse, and a finger.  Just share
the project with your friends and ask them to contribute.  A little or a
lot, but anything is appreciated.
THANK YOU FOR BELIEVING IN ME and THIS PROJECT!
Dawnna

story:
The Discovery


It’s funny to think that the crazy stuff I did as a kid, or dreamed of doing, would ever make it’s way into a book, but that’s exactly what’s happening.

My name is JC Foster and I’m that short stocky kid in the drawing below. Actually, that’s Connor Luck, the main character in my upcoming book series that’s loosely based on the crazy things my friends and I talked about doing when we were in elementary and middle school.



We definitely weren’t bad kids, but we were creative and loved to play pranks. I had forgotten about all of the crazy things we did until the night my 7 year old nephew spent the night.

He was glued to his books, laughing his head off and feverishly turning the pages.  I had to know what was so enthralling about his books, so I grabbed one and started reading.

I found myself laughing and reminiscing about the things I did as kid and shared them with him. I even showed him a few of the harmless pranks we used to play on each other. 


The next day I had a new direction and new best friend, Connor Luck. Connor is my main character in a series of books for kids ages 7-12 that deal with things kids find funny, but also teaches them life lessons about friendship and bonds, bullying, science, safe fun and anything else we can dream up.

I've already completed the first 11 of 14 chapters in book 1 and begun working with an illustrator to bring my concept of The Prankster's Club to digital and paper form.

With your help, I can get there sooner and make my dream of becoming a full time author a reality. Together, we can bring Connor, Max, Milo, Molly(the teachers pet), Mr. Mooger(the principal) and Theodore Reginald Strong(a.k.a. T.Rex the Bully) to kids everywhere.

How funding will help

Once I sat down and began planning everything I needed to make my writing dream come true I quickly realized that being a writer and doing it the right way had expenses. Big expenses. This is no longer just a hobby, it's become my passion.

Your donation will help:

  • Make the story come to life with Illustrations from a talented illustrator.
  • Hire an editor to fix my numerous grammatical and spelling mistakes.
  • Create a compelling and interesting book cover.
  • Format both the eBook and printed book layout.
  • Purchase ISBN's for distribution via various channels.
  • Build a Facebook fan page and official website.
  • Plan the other books in the series.
  • Create a book trailer and audio version of the book.
  • Market like a mad man.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, then please, share this among your online social groups, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, anyplace you can think of that may help reach our goal.

Thank you for all of your help and support!

JC Foster

story:
"I am making a call to reclaim our Speech, which I believe is essential for both our survival and our prosperity."

As an initiate, guru, and now lineage holder in India’s most ancient and largest order of yogis and shamans, Juna Akhara, my studies and practices over the last 44 years in India are all part of an Oral Tradition passed down over the millenia from the voice of the guru to the ear of the disciple.
  
We personify Speech as Mother Goddess.  I am going to tell you a story of how Speech plays the determining role in our consciousness, in our experience of life, and in how we know ourselves.

“They praised Language as a powerful and benign Goddess 
              ever ready to bestow favors on Her devotees.”

Although I have been teaching and writing about Sacred Speech since 1977, a number of recent events regarding our freedom and privacy of Speech (and thought) and the wholesale corruption of mass media, have made me feel the urgency to share my knowledge and experience about the nature and power of speech with a wider public.

My goal here is much larger than the book.

I believe we are in a civilizational crisis, and at its very core is that fact that our Speech has been diminished, our languages are degrading, and along with this, the control of our own lives and thoughts. Philosophers, linguists, cognitive scientists and babas will all agree that our knowledge and our experience is determined from our Speech.

My story requires that I tell you about the great masters of Sacred Speech in ancient and medieval India, their lineages, their sublime teachings and practices, and how we may employ those teachings in our lives today.

We will explore what a tradition is and how it works, how knowledge is obtained and passed down, storytelling, what a practice really means, and what constitutes authority.

We will explore how Sacred Speech is actually used, in a spiritual discipline, in ritual, in mantra and tantra, and in daily life, for the purposes of self knowledge as well as prosperity.

Since my goal here is to not only entertain you, but also give you tools for personal growth, we will examine many of the assumptions we bring into the study of the "other" (whether another culture, religion, or even gender), to free ourselves of those limitations, especially in these times in which our speech has been so compromised by mass media. 

We will also look at how mass media has affected our speech, the use of abstractions and euphemisms, Orwell's rules, and how we may reclaim our speech and our empowerment.

It’s employment leads to prosperity - in the ancient Vedic rituals, as well as in the modern IT revolution; but its misuse leads to political and economic manipulation of the public, as pointed out by Orwell, with disastrous results.

“...the very words in our mouths have become colonial subjects
immigrating from mass media.” -- Baba Rampuri

The Matrix of Sacred Speech is not about the description and analysis of a particular language, even Sanskrit, but exploring the true nature and potentialities of language, emphasizing its role in effecting liberation;  that it may be used by my readers as magical formulae to employ in their lives, not only to be more successful, prosperous, and happy, but, to have real relationships, to increase perception and knowledge, and to do good things. 

Topics covered include:

•The Spiritual Mind

•Acquiring Knowledge

•Authority, Text, and Scripture

•The Enlightenment

•Panini, the Birth of Linguistics, and the IT revolution

•Deconstructing the Idea of India

•Deconstructing Yoga – Science & Yoga

•Mantra

•Tantra

Yantra: practical uses and applications

•Sacred Grammar and Grammatology

•Yoga Sutra and Patanjali

•Storytelling - Myth Structures/Modern adaptations

•The Mother Goddess - The Little Mothers – Matrikas

•The practice of Sacred Speech

•Manipulation of Speech – Orwell’s warnings

•Rules for empowering your speech


PLAN

I have cleared my schedule to focus on completing the manuscript of the Matrix of Sacred Speech in the next six months.  We will need 2 months of editing, so by July, 2014, I can start working with our translators for our editions in several languages.  The English Language edition will be ready for public release in September, 2014, while the other language editions by November, 2014.

PERKS

Everyone making any contribution of any kind will receive a personal "thank you" from me as well as my blessings.

My goal with the "perks" is to make them relevant to the principles of community and collaboration, to either include you in the creative process itself, or at least give you some special access, and a seat in the front row.  

Please check on the side bar for the levels of the perks.  Everyone participating in the perks will be receiving The Matrix of Sacred Speech about a month before public release, and you may have followed the conversation through updates on this page, or in newsletter, or personal contact with me.  So we may certainly have a conversation before the general public is involved.  As the perks move to higher levels, I want to be able to personalize the book for you, by signing it, and then be able to acknowledge your collaboration and generosity in the book itself, and be able to have personal contact with some of you over SKYPE.

Druvinka, the most exciting contemporary artist from Sri Lanka, is donating a painting, "The Mother of Speech" that she has created exclusively for this book.  She is known for the multilayered story myth-scapes she creates on large canvasses.  She is making 16X16 Fine Art Prints of her painting, which she will number and sign for some of our supporters.

Master Class

Also listed among the perks, for those of you who would like to take collaboration further, I will conduct an on-line Master Class, in the form of an interactive webinar, dealing with the subject or chapter that I am working on at the time. This will be once a week going on over 3 months. Besides allowing some supporters participation in discussions dealing with the actual content going into the book, and ask their questions, it also gives me an opportunity to know my audience better, and an insight into how to articulate the knowledge I have to give you, so that it rings bells. In this way, the audience collaborates with me in a new way. I have some important and valuable things to tell you, and I want to make sure they get through.  The subject matter will differ at each get together, so missing a session won't disturb the sequence.

The Matrix of Sacred Speech will be self published and translated into six other languages (so far) (German, Russian, Italian, French, Czech, and Serbian).  Those from countries for which there will be a translation in their language will receive the translation as well as the original English. 


Newly Added Perks:

We have just received a donation of a collection of rare Indian Mythology Posters of Gods and Goddesses to be used as perks for The Matrix of Sacred Speech Project.

Included in the collection are a large number of litho prints of Raja Ravi Varma (1848-1906), who almost single handedly created the genre of Calendar Art. These are all originals whose age exceeds 40-50 years, in some cases, more.  The Ravi Varma prints are labeled as such.

There are also included litho prints made in Germany in the 1930's.  They are labeled.

I've linked to hi-res images of the prints so you may see their quality.

Please send me a private comment or message with the number of the print that is listed below:


$35


$101


$151


Budget  (November 2013 - October 2014)

Printing                                               5000

Editing/Layout/Formatting                     8000

(including translations)

Research                                              500

Travel                                                  1000

Overhead                                             7000

Translation - 6 languages                      6000

Indiegogo/Paypal/Banking fees              5000

Cost of Perks including Shipping            9000

Web, Internet, Computer, Video             3500

Total                                                  45000


Schedule

Fundraising Campaign ends                      November 20, 2013

Webinar & Skype calls begin                     December 10, 2013

Rough Manuscript                                     May 1, 2014

Edited Manuscript                                     July 1, 2014

Public release of Book                               September, 2014

Rough translations                                     October 1, 2014

Public release of translations                      November, 2014



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

THUNDERCLAP -- an easy way way to support The Matrix of Sacred Speech

We have made a "thunderclap" campaign, which is a platform where people pledge a Facebook and/or Twitter message about my Matrix of Sacred Speech Indiegogo Campaign, which are collected and then released by Thunderclap all at one moment, giving the messages their greatest impact. It is totally safe and will automatically post only one message on your behalf.

All it takes is 5 seconds: click here 

and then click on "support with Facebook or Twitter"


  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
This Book is Now Available at


http://www.decomposingtheshadow.com

 

My name is James W. Jesso and I am a writer exploring the edges realms of consciousness. I was raised in south-western Ontario by my Mother and Father: devout Christians of contrasting denominations, hailing from rural Newfoundland. As children, my younger sister and I were taught the cultural values passed down to them through generations, such as "drugs are wrong". Like all great stories of healing, it is often that which our protectors fear the most that inflict the deepest wounds. At the age of 23, I found myself living in Melbourne, Australia and swept along in a sea of destructive substance use, reckless lifestyle choices, and confusion. It is somewhat paradoxical that among the very same substances that presented the “problem”, I found a gateway to healing myself.


Check out the Other Campaign Videos

 

What’s This Campaign all about?

In 2010 I began what would become a 13 month journey with the “magic” psilocybin mushroom that would lead me through the dark night of my soul, and out the other side, into personal healing and a sense of passionate direction like I had never known before. I found myself happy, confident, clean, passionate, with purpose, direction, and self-respect. Since then, I have been in the process of conceptualizing a paradigm for the psychedelic experience that merges the indigenous perspective of “sprit medicine” with the contemporary paradigm of science and psychology—a paradigm built off scholarly research, and rooted in personal experience.

Over the last three years I dedicated my life to a dream of sharing this story, and not only how, but why the psilocybin mushroom can help us effectively heal through our unconscious emotional wounds and cultivate true inner bravery. My soon to be self-published book, Decomposing The Shadow: Lessons from the Psilocybin Mushroom is the result of those three years.


Yet Decomposing The Shadowis about much more than just psychedelic mushrooms. It explores the potentials of what the unacknowledged aspects of ourselves have to offer our personal growth. It is about facing our darkness to discover our courage and nourish the fertility that lay inherent in the often-avoided shadow.

By supporting this campaign, you are supporting my vision of softening the stigma surrounding this ancient sacrament, furthering academic investigation into mind philosophy, and enabling those who intend to explore the mushroom as a healing tool to do so safely, with an awareness of the potential risks and benefits. With the funds raised in this campaign, I will not only launch the first stages of releasing this book, but will also tour the west coast of Canada, sharing my vision of healing, through workshops and book readings across 5 major music festivals and 5 major cities.

I consider this book and this tour to be the next steps in my career and an expression of giving my deepest gift to the world. Thank you for helping me to achieve this.

For a fuller look at the book's topics and premise, check out these media links or head over to The Gallery tab

View Other Promo Video Here

Entheogenic Evolution Interview

Conscisous Living Radio interview

Dosenation Interview

Adventures Through The Mind (my website)

 

The Press Release

As psychedelics re-enter the collective consciousness of the academic world, we are seeing a parallel resurgence of interest from the general public.  The broken stereotype of “flower-power hippies” -- left echoing from the late 60’s and early 70’s -- is dissolving away as the current generation of psychedelic enthusiasts continue to embody an increasingly sophisticated perspective. As humanity's understanding of the world evolves, so does today’s enthusiast's understanding of the existential implications of the psychedelic experience. We have come to further develop perspectives that are rooted in the exploring psychology, neurology, sociology and even the nature of reality itself -- perspectives that are inclusive and universal, yet also relevant to daily life. James W. Jesso, senior event coordinator for Evolver Calgary, presents this type of perspective in his new book, Decomposing The Shadow: Lessons from the Psilocybin Mushroom.

After 3 years of active investigation into the “magic” of the psilocybin mushroom, Jesso is ready to share his findings with the public. Decomposing the Shadow: Lessons from the Psilocybin Mushroom, has been drafted out of extensive study and hundreds of hours of direct personal experiences with the mushroom itself. His experiences have gone beyond just a scholarly vantage point, as Jesso says he has used psilocybin mushrooms to heal the emotional and psychological wounds he developed after a period of destructive substance use.

In discussing what lead him to write this book, Jesso says, “My personal experiences inspired me to do my best in turning the public perception of this medicine away from ‘party drug’ and into a tool for personal growth, self-awareness and psycho-spiritual healing."

Jesso explains that a self-guided practice with the mushroom has enabled him move through his self-deprecation and attain a “state of being” founded on self-confidence, passion and a sense of purpose in this world. Jesso may have found his way to navigate the darkness of life, but what does this mean for us?

Decomposing The Shadow is Jesso’s effort to accurately communicate the broader implications of the psilocybin experience and how to apply them directly to our lives. This book intends to re-sanctify this virtually demonized medicine, and inspire readers to investigate the full potential that psilocybin mushrooms may hold for the human species. He discusses his personal story, the science and history of psilocybin, a conceptual framework for navigating the implications of the psilocybin experience, how to potentiate deeply personal and applicable experiences, and how these concepts overlap into our waking lives.

And although these are seemingly complex topics, Jesso makes them easily understandable to a broad spectrum of readers. “I wanted this book to be interesting and applicable to the deepest psychonaught, but also something you could give to your mom,” says Jesso.

At a time when our society is starting to recognize the deep wounds inflicted upon ourselves by a history of violence, could psychedelic mushrooms be the key to releasing those wounds and moving towards a more beautiful future?

“It certainly isn’t for everybody, and it’s by no means an easy process. When we choose to enter the depth of emotional potential that psilocybin mushrooms can unlock, we enable an exploration of all the things that hold us back. In that place, we can come face to face with our greatest darkness – all that we fear about ourselves. I believe it is only by facing this darkness that can we discover our true bravery, and in turn, our ability to create beauty in this world.”

Click here to Download the Press Release as a PDF: http://bit.ly/DTSprPDF

Where is this money going?

The writing of this book emerged after Ileft my full-time wage job and dedicated myself to the full-time position of writer. Though I have gone back to wage positions during the writing process to re-stock on the funds required for living, the process of surrendering financial security to achieve my dream has been both invigorating and terrifying. I have done the first steps on my own (with some help from my credit card) and now, as I approach an even grander manifestation of my gift to this world, I recognize that I need help to see this vision come to fruit. But who would I be to ask for your financial support without telling you where it is going?

At this point, at least $6,000 is needed to successfully launch the book and follow through with the tour.  Funds will go towards:

The Book (Approx $2,500+):

As the book quickly approaches completion, there are still several pieces necessary for its successful launch.

  • Editing
    • Both developmental editing and Copy Editing (grammar and such)
    • Approx $400
  • Printing
    • Perfect stitch paperback
    • This is the major expense in the publishing process at this point, requiring approx $1,700 depending on demand
  • Ebook Conversion/Publishing
  • Distribution
  • Promotional
    • Both pre and post release marketing (including promo video for the books itself)
  • Website Creation
    • Dedicated to the book, related information on its vision, ability to order it
    • $500+
  • Living Expenses
    • I am working full-time on the book and all related elements to it completion and promotion.
  • Offsetting Indiegogo Fees (they take 4% of all donations if we reach the goal, 9% if we don't)

The Tour (At least $4,000+):

I have already begun to connect and establish positions at 5 festivals and 5 major cities. This tour will range from the middle of June to the middle of August, 2013 and span Western Canada from northern Alberta to Vancouver Island.

  • Transport
    • Including Gas, repairs, insurance, etc.
    • transport expenses are upwards of $1,300+ for the entire tour.
  • In-City Events
    • Venue Rentals, Equipment Rentals, Promotion
    • Upwards of $300+ per event, times 5 cities
  • Living Expenses
    • Rent , food and emergency funds
    • Rent alone for the 3 months I am on tour will be $1,600

Assuming the tour goes off with a great success, all extra funds raised from this campaign will go into furthering the reach of this book. Any extra funds that may go beyond that, will be put into completing my next project: a novel about the challenges and lessons in living in the polyamourus festival culture—relationships, dancing, psychedelics and getting your heart broken.

What’s So special About This Campaign?

As my life has progressed, I have come closer and closer to realizing what I can accomplish in this world. With each successive step I have come to see how much of an impact I can have on the people around me, and how fully I can embody my passions in this world. As I come to understand my true potential, I also have come to understand the responsibility that goes with it.

This book, and the tour planned around it, are expressions of me standing into a fuller embodiment of my passion: to write, to tell stories, to inspire people. It also stands as an expression of me upholding the responsibility that comes with that embodiment.

Unfortunately, from a mass culture whose intentions (supposedly) were to protect youth from drug use, the ultimate result of our official drug policy in North America is just as many (if not more) people taking drugs, yet without an understanding of what goes along with that choice. Psilocybin Mushrooms are a very powerful substance and the greatest risk associated to them is ignorance. Their use among adults and youth alike is not going away and I wish to provide an example of why the mushrooms are not toys, but tools. I seek to provide to those who choose to explore this substance an explanation as to why they are tools and an example on how to use them safely and constructively, so as to reduce their potential harm as much as possible.

By supporting this campaign, you are not only supporting me in living my passion, but also in seeding a new culture, where powerful substances like psilocybin mushrooms no longer harm our youth from being taken in ignorance.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are several other ways to help out, if for whatever reason you are not able to contribute but would still like to help.

Social Networking:

You can share a link to this campaign via whatever social networking platform you prefer.

To make this process easier, check out the landing page for this campaign here: http://mushrooms.jameswjesso.com/

Newsletters:

If you have a newsletter associated with a blog, website, or other community group and would like to inform them of this campaign, send out a link in your newsletter. Again, to make things easier for everybody, you can utilize the landing page at http://mushrooms.jameswjesso.com/

Blogger/Podcaster/Journalist

Do you have a blog, podcast, newspaper, magazine, etc. whose reader’s would be stoked on this book and campaign? Please contact me through indiegogo to set up an interview.

Shipping Details (For Perks)

All orders will be sent through the Canadian Post.

For Canadian orders: no extra shipping investment is required.

For Orders Outside of Canada:

  1.   Please visit http://www.canadapost.ca/cpotools/apps/far/personal/findARate
  2. Ensure that for “To” you have “International” or "USA" selected
  3. Under “From” Postal code Type “t2l0k4”
  4. For Width/length/heigt and weight enter:
  5. W: 28cm / L: 22cm / H: 3cm / Wgt: .25kg
  6. Hit “Find”
  7. On the following page scroll down to “Small Packet – internation Air”
  8. Add the calculated cost to your order (round to the nearest dollar).

*If you don’t want to go through with this process, simply add an extra $20 to your contribution (though it will likely be less if you check it)

** Psilocybin Super-Hero perk has no associated shipping cost

What’s a “Zine”?

According to Wikipedia “A zine (pron.: /ˈziːn/ ZEEN; an abbreviation of fanzine, or magazine) is most commonly a small circulation self-published work of original and/or appropriated texts and images usually reproduced via photocopier.”

These particular zines are completely original works which have been made from the ground up by my hard efforts. They are severely limited in number as I am no longer making them and will only reprint as many are needed for this campaign. The topics range from psychedelics, reality, consciousness, technology and society.

 

 

*** Cover image credit: www.thirdeyearts.com
story_txt:
This Book is Now Available at
http://www.decomposingtheshadow.com
 
My name is James W. Jesso and I am a writer exploring the edges realms of consciousness. I was raised in south-western Ontario by my Mother and Father: devout Christians of contrasting denominations, hailing from rural Newfoundland. As children, my younger sister and I were taught the cultural values passed down to them through generations, such as "drugs are wrong". Like all great stories of healing, it is often that which our protectors fear the most that inflict the deepest wounds. At the age of 23, I found myself living in Melbourne, Australia and swept along in a sea of destructive substance use, reckless lifestyle choices, and confusion. It is somewhat paradoxical that among the very same substances that presented the “problem”, I found a gateway to healing myself.
 Check out the Other Campaign Videos
 
What’s This Campaign all about?
In 2010 I began what would become a 13 month journey with the “magic” psilocybin mushroom that would lead me through the dark night of my soul, and out the other side, into personal healing and a sense of passionate direction like I had never known before. I found myself happy, confident, clean, passionate, with purpose, direction, and self-respect. Since then, I have been in the process of conceptualizing a paradigm for the psychedelic experience that merges the indigenous perspective of “sprit medicine” with the contemporary paradigm of science and psychology—a paradigm built off scholarly research, and rooted in personal experience.
Over the last three years I dedicated my life to a dream of sharing this story, and not only how, but why the psilocybin mushroom can help us effectively heal through our unconscious emotional wounds and cultivate true inner bravery. My soon to be self-published book, Decomposing The Shadow: Lessons from the Psilocybin Mushroom is the result of those three years.
 Yet Decomposing The Shadowis about much more than just psychedelic mushrooms. It explores the potentials of what the unacknowledged aspects of ourselves have to offer our personal growth. It is about facing our darkness to discover our courage and nourish the fertility that lay inherent in the often-avoided shadow.
By supporting this campaign, you are supporting my vision of softening the stigma surrounding this ancient sacrament, furthering academic investigation into mind philosophy, and enabling those who intend to explore the mushroom as a healing tool to do so safely, with an awareness of the potential risks and benefits. With the funds raised in this campaign, I will not only launch the first stages of releasing this book, but will also tour the west coast of Canada, sharing my vision of healing, through workshops and book readings across 5 major music festivals and 5 major cities.
I consider this book and this tour to be the next steps in my career and an expression of giving my deepest gift to the world. Thank you for helping me to achieve this.
For a fuller look at the book's topics and premise, check out these media links or head over to The Gallery tab
View Other Promo Video Here
Entheogenic Evolution Interview
Conscisous Living Radio interview
Dosenation Interview 
Adventures Through The Mind (my website)
 
The Press Release
As psychedelics re-enter the collective consciousness of the academic world, we are seeing a parallel resurgence of interest from the general public.  The broken stereotype of “flower-power hippies” -- left echoing from the late 60’s and early 70’s -- is dissolving away as the current generation of psychedelic enthusiasts continue to embody an increasingly sophisticated perspective. As humanity's understanding of the world evolves, so does today’s enthusiast's understanding of the existential implications of the psychedelic experience. We have come to further develop perspectives that are rooted in the exploring psychology, neurology, sociology and even the nature of reality itself -- perspectives that are inclusive and universal, yet also relevant to daily life. James W. Jesso, senior event coordinator for Evolver Calgary, presents this type of perspective in his new book, Decomposing The Shadow: Lessons from the Psilocybin Mushroom. 
After 3 years of active investigation into the “magic” of the psilocybin mushroom, Jesso is ready to share his findings with the public. Decomposing the Shadow: Lessons from the Psilocybin Mushroom, has been drafted out of extensive study and hundreds of hours of direct personal experiences with the mushroom itself. His experiences have gone beyond just a scholarly vantage point, as Jesso says he has used psilocybin mushrooms to heal the emotional and psychological wounds he developed after a period of destructive substance use.
In discussing what lead him to write this book, Jesso says, “My personal experiences inspired me to do my best in turning the public perception of this medicine away from ‘party drug’ and into a tool for personal growth, self-awareness and psycho-spiritual healing."
Jesso explains that a self-guided practice with the mushroom has enabled him move through his self-deprecation and attain a “state of being” founded on self-confidence, passion and a sense of purpose in this world. Jesso may have found his way to navigate the darkness of life, but what does this mean for us?
Decomposing The Shadow is Jesso’s effort to accurately communicate the broader implications of the psilocybin experience and how to apply them directly to our lives. This book intends to re-sanctify this virtually demonized medicine, and inspire readers to investigate the full potential that psilocybin mushrooms may hold for the human species. He discusses his personal story, the science and history of psilocybin, a conceptual framework for navigating the implications of the psilocybin experience, how to potentiate deeply personal and applicable experiences, and how these concepts overlap into our waking lives.
And although these are seemingly complex topics, Jesso makes them easily understandable to a broad spectrum of readers. “I wanted this book to be interesting and applicable to the deepest psychonaught, but also something you could give to your mom,” says Jesso.
At a time when our society is starting to recognize the deep wounds inflicted upon ourselves by a history of violence, could psychedelic mushrooms be the key to releasing those wounds and moving towards a more beautiful future?
“It certainly isn’t for everybody, and it’s by no means an easy process. When we choose to enter the depth of emotional potential that psilocybin mushrooms can unlock, we enable an exploration of all the things that hold us back. In that place, we can come face to face with our greatest darkness – all that we fear about ourselves. I believe it is only by facing this darkness that can we discover our true bravery, and in turn, our ability to create beauty in this world.”
Click here to Download the Press Release as a PDF: http://bit.ly/DTSprPDF
Where is this money going?
The writing of this book emerged after Ileft my full-time wage job and dedicated myself to the full-time position of writer. Though I have gone back to wage positions during the writing process to re-stock on the funds required for living, the process of surrendering financial security to achieve my dream has been both invigorating and terrifying. I have done the first steps on my own (with some help from my credit card) and now, as I approach an even grander manifestation of my gift to this world, I recognize that I need help to see this vision come to fruit. But who would I be to ask for your financial support without telling you where it is going?
At this point, at least $6,000 is needed to successfully launch the book and follow through with the tour.  Funds will go towards:
The Book (Approx $2,500+):
As the book quickly approaches completion, there are still several pieces necessary for its successful launch.

Both developmental editing and Copy Editing (grammar and such)
Approx $400

Perfect stitch paperback
This is the major expense in the publishing process at this point, requiring approx $1,700 depending on demand

story:
Right now there is a new wave emerging in our culture that supports the health of our people and the health of our planet. Projects, businesses and communities are springing up everywhere that are on the leading edge of sustainable living. They're addressing our economic needs in the 21st century while paying attention to the beneficial development of human society.

WHO WE ARE

You won't read about this on the front pages of mainstream media. We're a team of journalists and web designers who understand the need in our times for a society based on quality of life and the preservation of our natural environment. We've joined together to create an online magazine that brings you the latest news of this new wave in sustainable and cooperative living.

WHAT WE'VE CREATED  

Go Beyond Press is an online magazine that brings you the latest news of this emerging model for living and the individuals, communities and economic models that are making them a success.

In our first issue you'll read about Wild Earth, a not-for profit that runs nature-based programs for children, families, teens and adults aimed at building awareness in every-day life. This organization will pay over $200,000 to instructors and staff this year.

Our podcast interviews introduce you to the people we're writing about. You'll hear author Lenore Skenazy speak about why she thinks we should raise our children as "free range kids." This is just one of the many fascinating talks offered in every installment of Go Beyond Press.

We'll tell you about the O Positive Festival, a new model for cooperative and affordable health care that brings together communities by bartering medical and wellness care for music, artwork and community service. 

You'll get tips on how you can help sustain small local business in a global economy. In our premier issue of Go Beyond Press you will even have the chance to help us write one of the stories!

We'll bring you the latest news about emerging models in education, local farming and food supply, the restoration of vital riverfront communities, and a thriving retreat center that uses ancient wisdom teachings for healing in modern times.  Each issue will highlight the most interesting, inspiring news out there.

WHAT WE NEED

Go Beyond Press is free of charge. There is no subscription fee. Our revenue will come from modest advertising we feel will be of interest to you.  

Now we need your help. We founded Go Beyond Press based on our belief in the importance of a culture focused on sustainable and cooperative living. We are relying on your support to bring news of this new way of living to the front pages of innovative press.

We have support from experts, advisers and business leaders who tell us that having a place to find news of this kind is essential to support the emergence of innovative culture. Go Beyond Press fulfills that need.

Our goal is to raise $7000. One third of this money will pay for the initial costs of production for our first issue of Go Beyond Press including web design, computer equipment, software and hosting fees. 

THE NEXT STEP

The remainder of your contributions will allow us to expand the scope and quality of the magazine. Here are the details: 

1. The initial Go Beyond Press website is built using a template. Our goal was to give you a taste of the great stories Go Beyond Press offers. With your help we will give our site a fresh new look and feel to reflect the innovative thinking presented in our articles, photos and podcasts.

2. Go Beyond Press  is a forum for a new way of living. We will invest in interactive media to invite the stories from your comunities to the front pages worldwide.

3. We want to improve the sound quality of our podcasts. The purchase of two professional grade microphones will make a big difference.

4. In addition to audio podcasts we want to enhance our reporting by offering videos in conjunction with our news reports. Your investment will help us buy video equipment to make this possible.

5. We’ve been invited to several conferences and communities dedicated to cooperative and sustainable living. Now we just need to get there. Funds for travel and lodging expenses will help us bring you the most current and relevant news out there. 

Any amount you can contribute to Go Beyond Press will make a difference.  

Reaching our $7000 goal will put us on the road to expanding the scope and improving the quality of Go Beyond Press. Surpassing that goal will put us on the fast track to implementing the exciting changes already in progress.

It will benefit our communities, our children and our world.

Thanks for joining us.

Go Beyond Press is online now gobeyondpress.com - free of charge - but before you check it out please make your pledge to help bring Gross National Happiness to our communities. Thank you!

Incentive Perks include:

Check out the incentives our team has put together on this Indiegogo page to entice you to come on board. Our intention is to create a forum for new, inspired and creative models from communities everywhere.


“Narayana” by Amy McTear


“Meditate” by Pamela Miles


“Luminous Ragas” by Steve Gorn


Fine Art by Hardie Truesdale

story:
Short Summary

My name is Andrew R. Jones and I am a Marine Corps Combat Veteran of Operation Iraqi Freedom.  I served with Fox Co. 2/23 attached to 1st Marine Division, RCT-1 and performed combat missions in An Nasiriyah, Al Gharraf, Al Fajr and Baghdad during the initial invasion in 2003.  My post-war experience has ran me through an emotional hurricane with Post Traumatic Stress and a Traumatic Brain Injury suffered during the Battle of Baghdad on April 8, 2003.  As with many other Combat Veterans, I've turned to alcohol and drugs, attempted suicide, spent time behind bars for assault, been married and divorced twice and had my children taken from me. 
 
During the last two years I have finally began to get my life back on track.  I discovered how vitally therapeutic writing was for me.  I began seeing a Combat PTSD Counselor and through his guidance and my writing, I have turned my life around.  I still continue my healing process everyday and it has now become my mission to reach out to other Veterans and their supporting loved ones to motivate them to heal as well.  I now have a healthy relationship with my family, joint custody of my children and am engaged to an Angel. 
 
By contributing to this campaign, you will assist me in publishing and marketing an Anthology of poems and short stories focused on the issues Veterans and their loved ones endure.  By reaching out with my writing through Facebook and being published in 6 different literary journals including the International War Veterans Poetry Archives, I have already made an enormous difference in the lives of thousands of people and it is my mission to help others like me, heal their Warrior Hearts and get their stories out for everyone to read.  Along with my own writings, dozens of other Combat Veterans and loved ones have contributed their work to this Anthology and are dedicated to helping others heal. 
 
Your contribution to this book and to this movement is vital in allowing it to gain momentum and become a reality. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

To effectively publish and market this book so it gains enough exposure to quickly take off and reach thousands to hundreds of thousands and potentially millions of people, I am looking for an amount of $2,000. 


Every penny of this money will go directly to making this book become a reality and getting it in the hands of those who would benefit.  In addition to gaining exposure for the book, funds made from sales of the book will go towards helping Veterans organizations and continuing the movement of healing Warrior Heart's.


The perks for your contributions are explained in detail with the different levels of donations.  These perks range from my sincere gratitude, to personal "Thank You" messages, signed copies of the book, framed photos of my pictures on poems like the one featured above, canvas prints of the pictures on poems, a "Thank You" message featured in the book itself and if you donate the entire $2,000, I will consider it a loan that will be paid back in 12 months and you will be made aware of all decisions for the publishing and marketing of the book. 


If the entire amount of $2,000 is not achieved, the funds collected will still go directly towards the publishing and marketing of the book.  I am resourceful and will find ways to make this happen.  However, your help and contribution is important to achieving this mission in the quickest way possible. 

 

The Impact

Every single day in America, 22 Veterans are successful in killing themselves.  Much more make the attempt and countless more seriously contemplate the idea.  Our Veterans are homeless, behind bars, hiding behind drugs and alcohol and are in need of help!  Unfortunately, the pride of a Veteran makes it difficult to reach out.  It is my mission to reach out to these Veterans, motivate them to speak up and tell their stories and to be heard!  This book is only the beginning.  From this book, will spawn a movement to help Veterans and their families.  The people are there who want to help, the families and the Veterans themselves are calling for help in their own unique ways.  the impact of this book and more projects like it in the future, will cause a cultural change in America and our allied nations. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, please get the word out about this campaign.  Share it with everyone you know and even those you don't know. I am a Marine and I will not stop fighting until my mission is accomplished. Much love and God bless you all.
 
Follow the links below to see some of my writing that has been published and is available online.  Also visit my Facebook Community Page to see the impact that is already occuring.  www.facebook.com/AndrewJones0351
 
http://www.mbc.edu/outrageousfortune-new/current-issue/volume-4-1/essays/al-gharraf-4/

http://canyonvoices.asu.edu/i6/cold-water

http://iwvpa.net/jonesar/dark----.php

http://iwvpa.net/jonesar/i-envy-y.php
 
http://www.loveyourveterans.org/triumphblog/
