Folks are spread pretty thin on the ground and a living can be as marginal as the farmland. This locale makes fundraising a challenge, especially when there are so many needs more basic than poetry. Supporting a team of poets in Montreal for a week is a hard 'ask' anywhere, but with fewer pockets and shallow means, sustaining a slam scene is tough.
But, the truth is, Lanark County needs to be in Montreal! The Canadian slam scene needs to hear rural voices! It needs to be shaken out of its complacent, uber-urban narrow-mindedness and reminded that diversity is open-ended. And that there is a rich, deep and ancient arts scene out beyond the four-lane.  If we can get on that stage, we will be heard. 
So..what do we need, and what do you get?
Money for food, accommodation and travel. Pretty basic stuff, really.  
CSFW Montreal have arranged very economical accommodation  The hotel suites have fully equipped kitchens which we will use to reduce the cost of food. We can drive to Montreal. Parking will add some additional costs. All the venues are nearby, but CFSW still recommends getting a transit pass for the week. 
Nevertheless, our budget for the trip is $2500. We run a monthly slam season throughout the year and do fundraisers at farmer's markets, etc. but bake-sales, and gate receipts have only taken us so far. Last year's trip to CFSW in Saskatoon was an artistic success but a financial burden that carried over into this year. We are still short at least $1500 and that amount is a deal-breaker for us.
Paddling For Poets! 
I am offering canoeing and river rescue instruction in exchange for donations to Lanark Live Poets Society [LiPS]. I have taught canoeing for over 24 years and guided canoe trips in Ontario and Quebec for over 40 years. I have worked as a rafting guide on the Ottawa River in Ontario and on the Rio Antigua in Veracruz, Mexico. My teaching style is based on positive encouragement and enjoying the lesson. I am happy to work with children 8 yrs old and up.  No certification will be provided. ALL monies will go to Lanark LiPS trip to CFSW 2013 in Montreal. All activities are taken at your own risk.
What you get depends on what you want and the size of your donation.
FOR CANOE TRIPPING INSTRUCTION  PERK, please contact me before claiming these to ensure that timing and details can be worked out. I will do my best to accommodate your schedule but I cannot guarantee availability.
Other Ways You Can Help
Transport to Montreal and parking while we are there is a problem. [You would think that poets would travel light!] Any help out with either of these issues would be great. Perth to Montreal and back a week later - Nov 4th to 10th.

story:
Update: We've added video interviews with the illustrator, as well as the interview with the author on 91.5 FM radio in the Gallery Tab. :)

SOME GREAT STUFF!
  • The first three books of the series have been written
  • Artist extraordinaire, Erin Layton, has offered to illustrate this book
  • Theatrical director, Misti Wills, is directing the book into performance
  • Costume Designer, Arnold Bueso, is busy designing and assembling the costumes

                                NOW WE JUST NEED YOU!


 

Our Goal...
Post-production plans include:
•  Publishing the first full color children’s book of the series filled with beautiful images and equipped with lesson plans and vocabulary
•  Nationwide education tour performing the children’s book and meeting the author
•  Bunny Blog featuring a dialogue with children about faith, the bunny trail hop detailing Sniffy’s personal appearances and daily musings of scripture.
 
If we exceed our campaign goal, we will move to our stretch campaign which focuses on adding locations to our tour and starting on the second book!

Where Will The Money Go...
Marketing: (General materials, Travel, Costume)      $1,800
Post-Production: (for Self publishing and general distribution)   $1,800
Administrative: (Website production, Fees to designers & director)  $400

How You Can Help...
1. Make your pledge
2. Forward this video on to friends and ask them to make their pledge
4. Give us a holla on Facebook and Twitter

Meet Our Team...

Our Story...
Eleven years ago, the warm brown eyes and big pointy ears of my sweet bunny hopped into my life and enveloped my heart. 

I had baptized him and he joined the Episcopalian faith.  Together we established our love of Christianity and embraced our Christ-bound life. 

This August marks the one year anniversary of his death, and in honoring his memory, I’ve written a children’s book series in dedication to him.  He was the best companion anyone could ever want...full of life, hilarity, love, compassion and resilience. 

Meet The Author...
Kris Lundberg is an actress, teacher, writer and artistic director of the Shakespeare's Sister Company, a nonprofit dedicated to empowering women through the theater in education and performance.

For the past twelve years, Kris has worked as a teaching artist and theater department head teaching acting, creative play, storytelling, improvisation, theater management, Shakespeare and playwriting.  As a teacher, she teaches k-12 students and has witnessed first hand the transformation that occurs when children think outside the box by excelling socially and academically by applying techniques from the theater.  As a working actress (IMDB), she's worked on the stage and screen and as a writer, her plays have been produced in New York, London and the Carolinas. 

Kris holds her B.S. in Theater Education from East Carolina University and is a member of the League of Professional Theater Women, The Shakespeare's Society, Actors' Equity Association, Screen Actors Guild and the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists.

story:
The short of it: It's a Post Card Story...each postcard we send has a part of the story written on the back about our live adventures house (and pet) sitting around the world. 

How it works: You order the post card. We write more of the story on it then we send it from our current location. Once all the post cards are sent the entire story will be made into a book. 

Why we need you: We need to send parts of the story on postcards to people, like you! So really, without you, there is no story. That's why we need you. And since each postcard is part of the whole story you not only get an awesome postcard from somewhere in the world but you also get an original part of the book too! 

What you get: We have four perks,$1, $5, $10 & $25. 

$1: A private link to read the story as it unfolds.

$5: The private link AND a copy of eBook once it's finished. 

$10: Everything above PLUS we will send you a hand written post card with part of the story on the back from our current location.

$25 will get you the eBook, the private link AND we will send you a postcard with your one of a kind photograph (taken by us) on location and a part of the story on the back!

Want to see more? Check out our writing at our blog, browse our photography in our store and check out our fine art galleries. 

Where the money goes: The money goes towards purchasing, printing, creating and mailing the postcards. It will also be used for the ebook distribution and the physical creation of the book.

Who we are: Legend has it these two people spent years bringing other people’s vision to life on the big screen with over 70 movies between them. When they realized their own dreams were taking a back seat they decided to take action but they did it a little differently than others. They became The Globe Squatters: two artists on a little adventure house sitting their way around the world. It all began in a little village known as Ballycastle, Ireland with a bunch of ducks, chickens, a cat and a cool little dog. They have no idea where they will be next but it's going to be a great adventure!

Check out our site to find out where we are: www.theglobesquatters.com, and don't forget to sign up for the blog too. Thanks for being a part of the story!

story:
Dear reader,

Thank you for taking the time to read this.

I am about to publish my Fiction Trilogy in Dutch. I have choosen to do the publishing myself as todays statistics show that approx 1 % of all manuscripts make it to the public.

I also would like to have the 3 books translated from Dutch into English. For that I need a professional translator who charges approx 10 dollarcents per word. I have in total around 500.000 words. So in short I need up to 50 K USD.

As the content of the book is perfectly suitable for a larger audience, I thought of crowd funding. People who help me out to accomplish that target will get a copy of the result (see Perks).

The target audience is young adults but I expect that adults like the story as well. The story contains historical facts that have been used as base for the remarkable events that are being described.

I added as PDF the first two chapters of Book 1 to give you an impression (See Gallery section).


As I did the translation myself, please ignore the current quality as English is not my mother tongue.

I also show here a small summary of Book 1:

This story tells about a French boy who gets unwillingly involved in a conspiracy with far reaching consequences. He becomes part of one of the best kept secrets in history and gets involved in various strange and dangerous situations. Thanks to his knowledge, empathy and intelligence, as well as a large portion of luck, he succeeds each time in making one step further ahead. In the beginning he learns that he cannot rely on others and bears his fate in his own hands.

He becomes familiar with the world of monks and knights. Together with his brother he meets the very first Temple Knights in Jerusalem, but before he has to deal with the past. He is thereby often assisted by his brother, who is competative to him. Together they go a long way and know to make progress step by step. When he gets older, he increasingly becomes aware what his ultimate goal will be. He is persistent in order to accomplish this, even if this will cost him his life again.

This story is a combination of facts and fiction. It is up to the reader to determine the dividing line between them. The result is a composition where tension, sadness and humor interspersed.

If you like this story, pleases be so kind as to alert others that might have an interest as well. Thank you for your help. It is really appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I'm Todd DeBonis, author of The Monkey King's Daughter® —novels for middle readers. 

The Monkey King's Daughter® series offers the warm coming-of-age story of a contemporary teenage girl tightly wrapped in high adventure and fantastic mythological Chinese settings.

Steeped with the philosophical universal tenants of Compassion, Humility, Loyalty, Balance and Honor, The Monkey King's Daughter® delivers solid family core-values and a new female hero for a multicultural world.

I wrote the first book for my eldest daughter —and I’ve continued them—for not only my own children—but because I’ve learned that they can help make a difference for other children—even if in a very small way—through the various charities and foundations that use the novels to help raise money for their causes (China Care Foundation, China Adoption with Love.) This, to me has been my greatest reward. These organizations receive 50% of the cover price for every book sold on their behalf. In fact, I welcome the opportunity to associate the novels with any charity or foundation that helps better the lives of children, anywhere in the world.

Since books are now available worldwide (including China)— I feel it's time to get them translated into other languages. Because the stories are a wonderful blend of east and west cultures, Simplified Chinese (Mandarin) would be the logical first choice. I'd like to follow this with Spanish, then Portuguese, and hopefully someday French, Vietnamese, Korean and Japanese.

There are currently 4 books available in the series, with the 5th book on the way for 2013. I intend to write at least 10 books, and as many as 20, before Meilin's journey is complete.

What We Need

It will cost about $5,500 to professionally translate each individual book into Mandarin (or other languages,) and have them verified for accuracy, (it's important that the translations be accurate and true to the story.) I'd like to start with Book #1. If I'm fortunate enough to receive additional funding, then I'd apply those funds to have Book #1 translated into Spanish, in order to reach out to young readers in the Spanish-speaking world. Portuguese would follow. 

The novels, themselves are for middle readers, ages 7-12. They're particularly empowering for young girls, and offer them a new, exciting, strong role model they can call their own, positive messages and values. Boys love the adventures too, since there are plenty of demons to fight, and a lot of Kung-fu.

 

If I do not make the initial individual goal of $5,500, the funds will be donated to China Care Foundation.

China Care provides state-of-the-art medical care to as many as 80 children (orphans) at any given time in their pre and post operative Special Care Nurseries and Family Housing Units. The Nurseries offer round-the-clock love and care until the children are strong enough to either return to the orphanage or further recuperate and receive ongoing medical treatment at their Family Housing Units for long-term recuperative care. The China Care Home Preschool ensures that their toddlers and preschool-age children do not miss out on the fun activities that enhance young children’s development and lift their moods. While in their care, the children are watched over by doting trained nannies who wipe away their tears, patiently coax smiles onto their faces, and embrace them with soothing hugs. At the China Care Home, these children who have lost their families and are fighting to survive, are never again alone in the world. 

 

 

Reviews

Exciting… Loving… Adventurous… these are some words that help explain The Monkey King's Daughter... ...The Monkey King's Daughter is fantastic and I give this book five stars.—BookTrends.org

"The Monkey King's Daughter" is excellent reading for young people and reinforces ideas of loyalty, honoring cultural authenticity, respectful development and use of special talents, and the virtue of planning ahead (for all events). "The Monkey King's Daughter" is exciting reading with a core of solid values. —Children's Bookwatch (April 2010)

5 out of 5 stars Quite the entertaining read, highly recommended. Some people wish they had extraordinary origins, others wish they were normal. "The Monkey King's Daughter" is the story of Meilin, who soon finds out that she is the daughter of the mythical Sun Wukong. With that knowledge, she finds herself missing the days when homework and boys were the only thing on her mind. A fun mix of classical Asian mythology and a charming young adult read, "The Monkey King's Daughter" is quite the entertaining read, highly recommended. —Midwest Book Review

Brilliant! Empowering—especially for young girls! With everything that children have to contend with growing up today, The Monkey King's Daughter is exactly the kind of novels they need to be reading.—Fatinha Kerr, Executive Director, MCS-Inc. 

Like the Percy Jackson series, The Monkey King's Daughter is a fast paced, adventurous read combining a kid in modern times with the mythology of his or her past. Add in a royal secret background replete with special powers that include impressive hand-to-hand combat skills and hair ornaments that morph into fighting weapons, and you have every kid’s secret Harry Potter fantasy. For girls seeking an Asian version of the Percy Jackson series, The Monkey King’s Daughter by T. A. DeBonis is a fast and fun read. —PragmaticMom.com

 

 

So....

Literacy — Empowering young readers — especially girls, to know that they can realize their full potential if they only believe in themselves — making a difference — this is what The Monkey King's Daughter® is all about. 

Many thanks for your time and consideration.

story:
Short Summary

Love, GIRLS Magazine is a free quarterly publication for girls by girls. Our motto is that "every girl has a story" that deserves to be told. We highlight the every day girl doing amazing things in and around the DMV. 

Our four core principles are represented with the word LOVE - Lead, Overcome,Value and Empower.

We highlight the accomplishments and struggles of the everyday girl plus tips on exercise, fashion, makeup, and succeeding in school and life. We provide hands on learning opportunities in writing, interviewing, photography, marketing, graphic design and event planning.  It is for girls by girls.

What We Need & What You Get

We are a FREE magazine and want to keep it that way! We need funds to cover the printing costs, software upgrades and training for the girls.

We publish a 32 page full color glossy magazine and print 1,500  - 2,000 copies per issue. We want to upgrade our software and have some of our younger girls trained to use design tools. YES, that's what your contribution will do! 

Some of our amazing perks:

  • LGM souvenir items range from pens, note pads, notebooks, tote bags and t-shirts.
  • LGM gift set includes 2 LGM souvenirs, a recycled bag, and a beach towel.
  • LGM featured model perk* is for the Fall Issue, where a girl (ages 12-18) will participate in our Fashion Forward photo shoot. We supply the clothes, hair, make-up and photographer - she just has to show up!
*This perk is reserved for the first 10 models that contribute and submit required materials.

The Impact

Love, GIRLS Magazine (LGM) was started by Jasmine Babers in 2012 to to help a friend deal with the effects of bullying! The magazine was launched  in the Quad Cities located in Illinois and Iowa and in three short years it has expanded to Tennessee, Arkansas and the Washington, DC metro area. LGM is designed to help teenage girls build self-esteem, become leaders, and pursue their dreams.The magazine and Jasmine have impacted nearly 10,000 girls nationwide.

"Words hurt. Words are powerful," said Jasmine. "I wanted to create a place where a girl could express herself, find shelter, gain courage, and embrace how special she is." 

Since starting LGM, Jasmine has been recognized nationally for her work to empower girls including the 2012 White House Council on Community Solutions SparkAction Winner, Build-A-Bear Workshop 2013 Huggable Hero, Let Girls Lead 2014 finalist, Prudential 2014 Illinois Volunteer of the Year, and USA Characters United.

Your contribution will help us build stronger, more confident girls - one story at a time.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is time and money! We work with girls on all writing levels so some articles take more time to get ready for publication.

From design to printing, we are pressed for time and money. Our girls design some pages while a graphic designer (usually a recent graduate) will come and polish up the work for the final print.

We publish quarterly and have been able to work out a good deal with our printer. They have extended us credit so that we can continue to print, however, that bill has to be paid. We do risk losing that opportunity if our funding efforts aren't successful.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We need volunteers willing to serve in a variety of areas. Some of them include:

    • Writing Mentors
    • PR/Marketing Support
    • Community Outreach & Engagement (Maryland)
    • Community Outreach & Engagement (Virginia)
    • Special Events Coordinator
    • Copy Editor
    • Graphic Designer

      If you want to volunteer, please complete this form.

      Most importantly, make sure to tell a friend...or two!

LGM souvenir items range from pens, note pads, notebooks, tote bags and t-shirts.

LGM gift set includes 2 LGM souvenirs, a recycled bag, and a beach towel.

LGM featured model perk* is for the Fall Issue, where a girl (ages 12-18) will participate in our Fashion Forward photo shoot. We supply the clothes, hair, make-up and photographer - she just has to show up!


*This perk is reserved for the first 10 models that contribute and submit required materials.
  The Impact 
Love, GIRLS Magazine (LGM) was started by Jasmine Babers in 2012 to to help a 
friend deal with the effects of bullying! The magazine was launched  in the Quad Cities located in Illinois and Iowa and in three short years it has expanded to Tennessee, Arkansas and the Washington, DC metro area. LGM is designed to help teenage girls build
self-esteem, become leaders, and pursue their dreams.The magazine and Jasmine have impacted nearly 
10,000 girls nationwide. 
"Words hurt. Words are powerful," said
Jasmine. "I wanted to create a place where a girl could express herself,
find shelter, gain courage, and embrace how special she is."  
Since
starting LGM, Jasmine has been recognized nationally for her work to empower
girls including the 2012 White House Council on Community Solutions SparkAction
Winner, Build-A-Bear Workshop 2013 Huggable Hero, Let Girls Lead 2014 finalist,
Prudential 2014 Illinois Volunteer of the Year, and USA Characters United. 
Your contribution will help us build stronger, more confident girls - one story at a time.
  Risks & Challenges  Our biggest challenge is time and money! We work with girls on all writing levels so some articles take more time to get ready for publication.
From design to printing, we are pressed for time and money. Our girls design some pages while a graphic designer (usually a recent graduate) will come and polish up the work for the final print. 
We publish quarterly and have been able to work out a good deal with our printer. They have extended us credit so that we can continue to print, however, that bill has to be paid. We do risk losing that opportunity if our funding efforts aren't successful.  
  Other Ways You Can Help We need volunteers willing to serve in a variety of areas. Some of them include:

Writing Mentors
PR/Marketing Support
Community Outreach & Engagement (Maryland)
Community Outreach & Engagement (Virginia)

Special Events Coordinator

Copy Editor
Graphic Designer



 If you want to volunteer, please complete this form.Most importantly, make sure to tell a friend...or two!

story:
Letters from B.S is a self published, absurd comedy book that was written over a period of 2.5 years and released at the end of 2010. B.S stands for Bernard Simpson - the main character of the book and also hints of what is embedded as well. The book follows a series of ludicrous letters that he wrote to all kind of places and then shows the real responses he received along with various gifts and promotions from different companies. Bernard's life story and family tales are also shared through the collection of letters.This unique format received wonderful responses from our readers in Canada and then copies of B.S found themselves in book stores throughout Europe. For this reason we are tranforming it into a very special kind of Audio Book.

"The revenge of one citizen against the bureaucracy has never been served so cold".

Who we are: I come from an acting background and my drive to do comedy never stopped. I guess this is why I started writing this book which among other reasons, resulted from an angry letter to the city due to a parking ticket in 2007. Though it was a specific incident, my overall respect for the Canadian civil servants is what sparked my interest and imagination. Like many things in life this had no real direction or form in the beginning, however, as my communication with the authorities developed I started to imagine what if...

...after publishing the written book with the help of Avi - my good friend that illustrated the whole thing with an exceptional talent, we collaborated with a producer friend named Eyal and together we wanted to take this unique project to the next level. Along the way we formed a team and together we wish to bring this project to the public.

                            

        producer Eyal Pevzner                       

 Our aim is to finalize both the recording stage and the website where the Audio Book may be purchased. The funds requested would enable us to launch the website to the public and make you people laugh for a while. Every dollar counts and will go directly to the completion of this project and for the maintenance of the site. Once online, people will be able to purchase the Audio version at will. 


Video and Audio Samples:

Video Sample: Watch our promitional video of folks who got a real taste of it all and agreed to share their thoughts on our product. For that they have our deepest appreciation :B.S Rocks  


 Avi Shachar - Illustrator & a Genius Animator


Audio Sample: 

A letter to the C.I.A


Audio#2: Lufthansa Airlines:

Travel B.S


Audio#3: Gold rush...oh man, the things we'll do for gold...

R. Mining


Video Promotion:

30 Seconds Animation Promo: As part of our promotional effort, here is what will be online soon: The Truth Behind The Truth...


Sample letter - A King for an day...not

(To read easly please use right click to open in new window)





Checkout our perks ad help us bring some laughter to the world.

story:
ABOUT EAP

I'm Tod Davies, and, er, apologies for my tiny meltdown in the video above (explanation follows in the next section). I’m the publisher and editorial director of Exterminating Angel Press, which started out as an art project and blossomed into a full scale indie publisher, with ten books out and two more on the way. It always was a different kind of publishing project: we develop relationships with authors through our online magazine, people who write in all genres and all subjects, but have one thing in common: they believe that finding and telling new stories will lead us to finding new, more creative ways of being. 

We publish books of any subject, as long as they spring from that one passionate belief. Whether it’s rock musician Danbert Nobacon (Chumbawamba) collaborating with filmmaker Alex Cox (Repo Man) on an illustrated anarchist fairy tale or actor Miguel Sandoval directing Linda Callahan in a film trailer for poet David Budbill’s genre-bending poem/play Park Songs, we want our books—and our strategies for promoting them—to transcend the page and spark readers’ imaginations in new and unexpected ways.

We never stop finding new ways to advocate for our books because we believe each deserves a long life contributing to our cultural conversation. Our books don’t have a sell by date; we want to keep them in front of the conversation. And the more titles we publish, alas, the more our expenses increase. And the more we need to expand. 

THE COMMUNITY

As you can see from the meltdown I had in the video here, like a lot of us, I hate asking for money—it was the one part I could not get right, no matter how I tried. I finally lost it and just blurted. But what I’m realizing is we’re not asking for money; we’re asking for support. And like any normal, healthy person, I do love to give and get support. Because that knits us together as a community; it’s what DOES knit us together. 

As EAP has expanded past the small art project where it began, as we expanded our reach, person by person, so did those expenses involved in getting out there and meeting people at events and festivals, as well as printing costs for larger runs of our books, costs to get the word out about those books, time needed to use social media to find others of like mind, interact with them, and tell them about our books.

We can't do this on our own. We need help. What we're looking for is enough funding to expand our word-spreading and community building: organizing events, going to book fairs, reaching out and meeting like minds in a number of different ways.

More than anything, we hope to foster a community of passionate people who will keep the important conversations we have in person with readers, writers, librarians, and booksellers, going online. Part of what we raise through this campaign will allow us to pay the brightest and most capable intern we’ve ever had to step up our efforts at community building. The more we are able to raise, the more we’ll be able to utilize her outstanding talents. And supporting the talents of the generation that’s coming onto the scene with a bang is one of our cherished goals.

PERKS

There are a lot of amazing talents from all generations already contributing to Exterminating Angel Press. Our incentives, just like our organization in general, show a wild assortment of cool contributions by cool people, anarchic and fun, who want to contribute getting out new stories. From a poem written by David Budbill, to a song sung by Danbert Nobacon, to an illustration from one of our books drawn by filmmaker Alex Cox—and more—these are no mere incentives, they're invitations to play with the rest of us at Exterminating Angel Press. 

Illustration by Alex Cox from 3 Dead Princes

Photograph by R.C. Irwin from Park Songs

One of our incentives, the copies of Wickedly Sisters’ award winning Spoon and the Moon app, comes from an EAP contributor who originally found one of our books in a Kentucky library and said, “We want to play there!” So they do.

We’re also offering a whole book club package with a Skype conversation with me. This is definitely self-serving (if there is one thing I love, it’s talking about books with other enthusiasts!) and I’m so particularly looking forward to that one.

SPREAD THE WORD!

If you can't contribute with cash–and we know how tough that is these days–but you want to be a part of Exterminating Angel, we're always looking for people to help us spread the word about our books, and add to the conversation about new stories and new ways of being. There are other ways to join with us to do that. You can consider contributing to our online magazine. And you can spread the word about our campaign, and (Indiegogo reminds us to remind you!) you can use the Indiegogo share tools to do it.

LAST, BUT NOT LEAST...

Thanks for your time in listening to us – and thanks to all who support Exterminating Angel Press, and who will support it. It's our community that powers us and makes all our work a worthwhile joy.

And remember: We did say “Please.”

story:
Short Summary

My name is Catherine and I've been developing an ebook called Journaling Your Goals: Prompts, Motivation, and Advice to Help You Achieve Your Dreams. It's a non-fiction self-help book which introduces writing techniques for dreamers to help set, track, and follow through with personal goals and development.

I run a blog on tumblr called Writing in Notebooks which, though it was originally created for personal inspiration, gained almost 1000 followers in its first year. It was intended as a place just for me to gather pictures of notebooks, journals, and writers from various places around the internet but I soon learned that other people felt as creatively inspired from these pictures as I did, and I started interacting with the community by sharing my own journaling techniques and ideas.

This ebook project is already underway with 23653 words written (as of January 2, 2014) and a few books being released to alpha readers as part of a giveaway on my blog. Though the book could technically be considered "complete," it is still relatively short and I feel like I have much more information I could share. I want to take the time to expand the work I have, properly develop it with marketing and promotional tools, design an ebook cover, and release the final product on websites like Amazon and B&N.

What I Need & What You Get

I have set a modest goal of $500 to fund this project.

Here are my intentions:

1. Between $50 and $100 will go towards hiring someone to design a professional ebook cover.

2. About $100 will go towards promotional and marketing materials.

3. At least $100 will go towards the variety of small and negligible fees I would ordinarily have to pay out of pocket such as buying stock photos, registering for certain online retail websites (such as ejunkie so I can set up a shopping cart on my own website), and things of that nature.

4. If there is any remainder, the rest will go towards supporting me as I continue to develop this project. This is work that I am, so far, not getting paid to create. I do not, however, anticipate that there will be very much left over to go into my own pocket and of the items on the list, this is the lowest priority. The money will go towards all the other materials first.

5. If this project exceeds the minimum donation, I will use the additional money to hire a professional editor, support myself some more, and maybe even create additional bonuses and perks for my supporters. (Maybe some stickers, fancy writing utensils, washi tape, and other crafty supplies...)

Donor Goodies

  • If you contribute at least $2 to this project (TWO DOLLARS. That is half the price of a Starbucks cup of coffee...), you will receive a copy of the finished ebook Journaling Your Goals: Prompts, Motivation, and Advice to Help You Achieve Your Dreams in any format you choose (pdf, mobi, epub, etc).
  • If you contribute at least $3 to this project (getting close to the price of an actual cup of coffee, now...) you will receive TWO copies of the finished ebook. One for you and one gift copy for a friend. Also in any format you choose.
  • If you contribute at least $20 to this project, you get TWO copies of the finished ebook (any format) AND a notebook. You won't know what kind of notebook. It will be somewhat randomly and personally selected by me. Everyone will get something a little different. It will be a notebook that I recommend. It will likely be college-ruled, well-made (nothing shoddy), attractive, and NOT spiral-bound. I will hand-select each one. It will also come with some sort of handwritten note, postcard, or letter of gratitude. I promise that this note will be very pretty.
  • If you contribute at least $40 to this project, you get FOUR copies of the finished ebook (any format) and TWO randomly and personally selected notebooks. They will be two different ones. I will try to make them as unique as possible so you won't get two of the same. They will also both be a surprise but mostly following the criteria I listed above. This perk also comes with a handwritten note, postcard, or letter of gratitude. It'll be fancy. All you crafty people out there can scrapbook it.

(Note: at least for the time being, I won't be able to make the two notebook options available to donors outside of the United States because of shipping. You are still free to purchase the ebook, however, and if you email me I would be happy to recommend notebooks to you that you can buy in your country!)

The Impact

Journaling has helped me grow and develop in so many ways. I've kept journals since I was eight years old. Over the years, I've developed many methods and techniques for understanding what I want and how to motivate myself to achieve it; my desire to share these methods inspired me to write this ebook.

I'm committed to personal development and to helping others realize their full potential. Journaling Your Goals clearly defines how to format your notebook, how to set goals so you are more likely to achieve them, how to keep yourself motivated during the process, and how to use methods of self-care and comfort to keep yourself steady and stress-free.

Here’s a sample section (not the whole thing!) of the table of contents for Journaling Your Goals:

I. Part One: Starting Out

  • Supplies and Tools
  • Formatting Your Notebook

II. Setting and Tracking Goals

  • How to Set Goals
  • Make Your Own Challenge
  • New Year’s Resolutions
  • Active Projects
  • Tracking Your Progress

III. Journaling

  • Become Obsessed
  • Daily Prompts
  • How to Start Fresh
  • Make a Life Wheel
  • Start a Ritual
  • Aim For Rejection
  • Nourish Your Soul
  • Use Morning Momentum
  • Adventure Studying
  • Adopt a Role Model
  • Make Your Quest Enjoyable
  • Methods for Self-Care and Comfort
  • AND LOTS MORE SECTIONS

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit, your personal blog, or wherever you have friends and followers.
  • If you really really want a copy of the final ebook but can't afford it yourself, convince a friend or relative to buy the Gift Package! It's only $3 for two copies of Journaling Your Goals  so they can keep one and give you the other.

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
NOTE: Please check the updates for important and current information.

(Including sample chapters and a metaphorical description of depression for download.)

Summary

Imagine trying to climb a muddy slope your entire life and never understanding why. Imagine the incalculable frustration of being blessed with abundant talents and abilities and having extraordinary potential and yet, always meeting with failure.

Depression destroyed me. It ostracized me from my family. It cost me successive groups of friends. It drove me into alcoholism. I lost opportunities and careers. It ruined my credit. On at least three occasions it nearly cost me my life.

My life disappeared as tears in the rain.

Worse than my own lack of understanding was battling the ignorance of others, especially supposed professionals.

Throughout it all, the only thing that has sustained me is my faith.

This is my best shot in about twenty-five years to get on my feet. Helping me publish As Tears In The Rain will restore my life.  Nay better, it will give me an actual life since I've never really had one. Even better, it will give me the life I was meant to have.

Together, we can ensure this doesn't end up being just one more failure. Together, we can make this a success.

The Money

I need $20,000USD for publishing and a website.

The publisher will take care of several critical tasks including editing, printing, marketing and distribution. It will cost $15,000USD. More specifically those tasks include:
  • Three rounds of professional editing
  • Design and formatting for both traditional and mobile device formats
  • Availability on Amazon.com®, Barnes & Noble® & 25,000 retail locations 
  • FaceBook and Twitter fan websites
  • Comprehensive marketing to traditional (national and local) media outlets, online social networking sites, book review blogger sites
  • Book fulfillment
  • Returns policy
  • And more!
They have an A+ rating with the BBB. Having the publisher handle these tasks has several advantages. One, they have the experience and reach I couldn't possibly match. Two, it frees me up to concentrate on what I do best which is to write. Three, it removes the question of my health from the equation. In other words, regardless of how well I may or may not be doing at any particular time, the job still gets done.

As you no doubt know, it is far easier to create a reputation or image than it is to change one. That's why the website must be professional from the very beginning. The website will have three integrated sections:
  • Blog
  • Social networking
  • Shopping cart
Successful blogs are entertaining, informative, controversial or humorous. I have all those attributes.

Subjects for discussion include depression, poverty, faith and tainted blood scandals.
Each area brings with it an enormous dedicated base.

The shopping cart will have two divisions. The main one will feature my writing as well as books from other self-published authors within the subject areas. I already have two books (potentially three) besides mine with another currently in progress. The other division will offer Specialty Items. These will include films (in both digital download and hard copy purchase) and works from established authors in the subject areas.

The website will be quick, extremely secure, fully mobile device compatible, diverse yet focused, and offer the opportunity for continuing donations to support the blog. And who knows? It might even be fun!

The $5,000USD for the website will go for hosting, design, marketing, and purchase of additional software.

Your contributions will get As Tears In The Rain published complete with an extensive marketing plan increasing its exposure and sales. The website will be dynamic and professional. It will start strong with large numbers registered (see Perks below) and multiple offerings for sale. It can take years to achieve what our site will have at its launch.

For so little you can do so much.

Living in poverty for decades creates a lot of needs. Therefore, money raised beyond what is required will go to address those needs. They include:
  • Supplements and equipment for my health
  • Outfitting the kitchen
  • A proper diet
  • Clothes

Thank you.


Benefits

This is my best chance in a long long time.

It means I can finally break free of government dependence and control.

It will provide me with an income through book sales, commission on sales from other authors, and donations for the blog. Even a modest income will allow me to acquire the supplements and equipment I need to attain and maintain health. I can burst through the barrier and never return to the morass that is depression.

By contributing you help other self-published authors who, like me, struggle financially by giving them another opportunity to sell their works and consequently increase their income.

Finally, together, we can shed light on the dark pit of ignorance surrounding depression and poverty.

Your contributions make it possible for me to stand on my own feet and in the process help countless others through exposure, discussion and education.

If you are an institution or agency contemplating investing, consider this. The amounts directed to you are $2,500 and $5,000. How much does it cost to treat or care for one person per year? How much of that goes to critically sustaining them without the benefit of helping them rise up? Even those of you who assist people to become independent again what is the cost per person per year? And it's not like you would be losing anything since there will always be, unfortunately, some one to take my place. Any way you look at it, your contributions to ensure As Tears In The Rain gets published and consequently my gaining self-sufficiency, is great value for your dollar.

It is a scenario where everyone involved wins. It’s my favorite kind!

Perks

Beyond the listed perks everyone who contributes will receive the following:
  • A Thank You! on the website
  • Automatic registration on the website
The reason for the first one is obvious. You deserve to be acknowledged for your generosity and support.

There are two reasons for the second. First, it gives you the opportunity to monitor exactly how and where the money is being spent. How often does that happen? Second, with the large numbers required to make this a success automatically registered it means I overcome one of the most difficult hurdles facing new websites--traffic. With those numbers the website will explode out of the gate.

You get this regardless of how much you can comfortably contribute!

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute but you can still help!

I couldn't possibly reach the number of people necessary to make this campaign a success. But you can. Please reach out to your networks. If you tell ten people and they tell ten people and they tell...you get the idea. I've tried to make it easier by providing material you can pass along.

Talk about it on your FaceBook and Twitter accounts. Direct them to this campaign.

Use the Indiegogo share tools.

Before we know it the story will have found its audience!

Thank you so very much for your contributions and support.

God Bless.
story_txt:
NOTE: Please check the updates for important and current information.

(Including sample chapters and a metaphorical description of depression for download.)Summary

Imagine trying to climb a muddy slope your entire life and never understanding why. Imagine the incalculable frustration of being blessed with abundant talents and abilities and having extraordinary potential and yet, always meeting with failure.Depression destroyed me. It ostracized me from my family. It cost me successive groups of friends. It drove me into alcoholism. I lost opportunities and careers. It ruined my credit. On at least three occasions it nearly cost me my life. My life disappeared as tears in the rain.Worse than my own lack of understanding was battling the ignorance of others, especially supposed professionals.Throughout it all, the only thing that has sustained me is my faith. This is my best shot in about twenty-five years to get on my feet. Helping me publish As Tears In The Rain will restore my life.  Nay better, it will give me an actual life since I've never really had one. Even better, it will give me the life I was meant to have. Together, we can ensure this doesn't end up being just one more failure. Together, we can make this a success.The Money

I need $20,000USD for publishing and a website.The publisher will take care of several critical tasks including editing, printing, marketing and distribution. It will cost $15,000USD. More specifically those tasks include:
Three rounds of professional editing
Design and formatting for both traditional and mobile device formats
Availability on Amazon.com®, Barnes & Noble® & 25,000 retail locations 
FaceBook and Twitter fan websites
Comprehensive marketing to traditional (national and local) media outlets, online social networking sites, book review blogger sites
Book fulfillment
Returns policy
And more!


They have an A+ rating with the BBB. Having the publisher handle these tasks has several advantages. One, they have the experience and reach I couldn't possibly match. Two, it frees me up to concentrate on what I do best which is to write. Three, it removes the question of my health from the equation. In other words, regardless of how well I may or may not be doing at any particular time, the job still gets done. As you no doubt know, it is far easier to create a reputation or image than it is to change one. That's why the website must be professional from the very beginning. The website will have three integrated sections:
Blog
Social networking
Shopping cart


Successful blogs are entertaining, informative, controversial or humorous. I have all those attributes.Subjects for discussion include depression, poverty, faith and tainted blood scandals. Each area brings with it an enormous dedicated base.The shopping cart will have two divisions. Thank you.

story:
Keep Kids in School Inc. and The Master Communicator’s Writing Service are sponsoring a literary initiative for senior high school and college age students at the 2013 Authors Networking Summit.  Our charge is to address the critical need to empower them to be competitive in today’s writing market. 

It is our mission through this writing imitative to provide a coaching opportunity for these students as they are mentored by published authors for the day. The youth will be embraced with Houston hospitality and mentored by several published authors who will donate their time to these budding writers at the 2013 Authors Networking Summit on October 5, 2013.
story_txt:

The youth will be embraced with Houston hospitality and mentored by several published authors who will donate their time to these budding writers at the 2013 Authors Networking Summit on October 5, 2013.

story:
Hi, I'm Jessica Burde, of Polyamory on Purpose. I've been in polyamorous relationships for nearly 10 years, and I've been using my experience, and the experiences of people I know, to share information on polyamorous living. Most people fall into polyamory by accident. It isn't something we plan, and there are a number of small things that take us by surprise: legal issues, health concerns, household challenges (like meal planning for mixed allergies, health problems and religious restrictions), and pregnancy.

Pregnancy is a big deal for anyone, but there is a whole cultural and medical template to see monogamous couples through the challenges it creates. For poly-folk, pregnancy creates many challenges that monogamous couples never need to confront, from the unexpected pregnancy when you can't be sure who the bio-father is, to deciding if everyone in your polycule will be raising the child together. There are legal hoops, medical hassles, and relationship issues challenges every polycule will need to confront when someone in the polycule becomes pregnant. If your polycule has been through a pregnancy, you know what I am talking about.

I started writing the Polyamory on Purpose Guide to Pregnancy to provide information to poly-folk on these challenges. I want to create the guide that I wish I'd had during my pregnancies. I want to create a something that is a concise and complete guide to pregnancy in a polyamorous relationship, so that the information is out there for future poly-parents.

 

Why We Need Your Help

At this point, I am making good progress on my manuscript and need to look ahead. There are several expenses in publishing a book, and the worst is paying an editor. Based on the length of my manuscript, I can expect editing to cost around $625. Copyeditors charge about $35 per hour, and on average complete work on 7 pages each hour. For a 125 page manuscript (yup, there's a lot of info in this book!) that comes to $625, plus the fee IndieGoGo charges puts the total funding needed at $700.

So that is what I'm asking for - $700 to help me turn out a comprehensive guide for any poly-folk who are dealing with or considering starting a new pregnancy.

 

Rewards

I'm not asking you to help for nothing – I started this to benefit the polyamory community, and it would be silly not to start giving back right now.

I've setting contribution at three different levels: $10, $25 and $100.

All contributors who donate $10 or more will receive a free eBook copy of the Polyamory on Purpose Guide to Pregnancy. Your copy will be formatted as an epub, which can be read with any eReader.

Contributors who donate $25 or more will receive a signed paperback copy of Polyamory on Purpose Guide to Pregnancy. You will also get a mention in the Acknowledgements section, with a link/url to your blog or website. (I reserve the right to refuse to include links to offensive material, including hate speech and spam sites. I do not consider sex-related material to be offensive.)

The first 5 people to contribute $100 or more will receive the $25 perk, and a free subscription to future Polyamory on Purpose Guides.


What I'm Planning

The Polyamory on Purpose Guides will be an ongoing series. I currently have rough outlines for three titles, and plans for several more. I am hoping to publish two books a year for the next several years. Future books in the series will include topics such as: The Poly Home, Children, Safer Sex, Religions & Polyamory and more.

If the campaign is extremely successful and I end up getting funded with more than the $700 that I”m asking for, the extra money will go towards paying a professional cover designer, and towards improving the Polyamory on Purpose website – I'd like to take it off WordPress, get it self-hosting, hopefully add a forum section, eventually for people to discuss day-to-day issues and how they deal with medical issues, legal hassles, and the rest of the kind of stuff that I've been talk about..

Why This Matters

I think the Polyamory on Purpose Guides will provide an important resource to the polyamory community. There are some great books and resources out there about polyamory relationships, but nothing I have found on just... living life. And as an poly knows, most of what we do in a polyamorous relationship is just that – life. It's juggling schedules, having children, building careers, coping with sickness and loss... And it's time we start talking about that.

I hope you will help me make this resource a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

We all know times are tough right now. If you want to help support the Polyamory on Purpose Guide to Pregnancy, but don't have any extra money to donate, there are other ways you can help. The biggest is to spread the word about this campaign.

*Use the IndieGoGo share buttons to spread the word on Facebook, Twitter and other Social Media.

*Tell folks in poly-forums, chat rooms and your local poly MeetUp about this campaign.

Anything you can do to spread the word about this campaign, and about the book, helps.

 

Thank You

Thank you for you time, and your help. I hope you enjoy the finished book as much as I and my family have enjoyed the experiences that went into creating it.

story:
Harper is a huge bully.  I have been closely following Stephen Harper's attack on Canada's democracy and good governance since his first prorogation on December 4th, 2008.  I find Harper and his Conservative Reform Party appalling and dangerous.

Since Harper's 2nd prorogation of Parliament sneakily done on December 30th, 2009, I have spent almost every single day trying to bring to light his attacks on Canada to ordinary people who are too busy unfortunately to notice what has been going on.

I’ve done this freely on my own time since then.

If anyone wishes to donate a small amount, it would help keep me going in this endeavour until Canada can rid itself of the Harper CON Reform pest, who seems to be controlled by the 1%.  I live on very little and rarely enter malls, stores, restaurants or fast food places.  Any money collected would be used towards shining a light on Harper and his unelected backroom goons in Ottawa.

****If you’re broke like me and not in a position to help, there is something even more important you could do for me:

Please copy and paste below snippet into your Facebook status, or email it out to your Canadian friends and family.

.............................

Harper’s Conservative Reform Party have been caught up in many shady activities since coming to power.  The revelation they are behind a robocall operation to suppress voting for opposition parties would rank among the more serious offences.

In giving or not giving the benefit of the doubt on matters like these, the question of the track record figures prominently.

To the misfortune of Team Harper, its record on duplicitous activities is hardly one to inspire confidence.

http://www.ipolitics.ca/2012/02/27/lawrence-mar...

 

 

☻

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kayci Sartori, I'm a 3rd year college student, and my dream is to write Science Fiction stories and screenplays when I graduate. I have a passion for science and for space, as well as a passion for sketching and illustrating mermaids. I wondered how I could combine these passions, and started formulating a story about space mermaids! 

The story itself is very loosely based off of "The Little Mermaid," the connection being that the main character is a young princess who falls in love with a world apart from her own, and one of the people who live in it. In this case, the princess of the space "mermaids" (a alien race that were born from the stardust of a supernova long ago and are able to travel through space) wanders away from her people while they are searching for a new world to live on and encounters a young astronaut who tells her all about his planet. The story is all about finding a home and overcoming differences, with some science and fantasy sprinkled on top!

The book is already written, and I plan on hand drawing and coloring the illustrations in watercolor all myself. However I'm putting off drawing the official illustrations for the book until after this campaign (read on and you'll see why!)

What We Need & What You Get

Since I'm writing, illustrating, and publishing this book all by myself- I need some funding. I want to earn enough money to get a bunch of copies of the book printed so that I can sell them myself at comic conventions and art shows that I tour (the next of which being the beginning of April) and also to pay to work on some goodies to go along with the book (most of which will be offered as perks for donating here).

I've set my funding goal at the minimum amount the site will let me, which will be plenty to self publish this book. Every bit of money you donate will go towards helping the Space Mermaid campaign in some way, whether it be in actually printing the book or things to go along with it.

Any money that I raise that I find I do not need for the initial printing process, I will donate half to the Sandy Hook School Support Fund, and half to Reading Is Fundamental, a non-profit Children's Literacy campaign.

I've come up with a bunch of sweet little goodies to give everyone who donates, so anyone who donates even a little bit of money will get something! Anyone who donates even a dollar will get thanked in the book, and you can also recieve anything from keychains of the characters to art prints to a copy of the book to even being drawn in the book yourself as a space mermaid or merman!

The Impact

As a college student taking Astronomy courses, I realized there was a lot about the universe that we aren't taught as young children, most of us can recite the names of the planets in our solar system and know that stars are suns, but there is so much more to even this solar system than that. I wanted to create a book that was not just enjoyable for kids (and adults alike) with it's cute characters and story, but also taught them a little more about the solar system and universe. I talk a little bit in detail about each planet in our system, as well about supernovas and stars. 

The story also is primarily about friendship, the space mermaids are hesitant to trust others because they have been let down and hurt in the past, but the story shows that there are truely good people out there who want to help and protect you, a moral I think we all need in times like these. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, try telling others about the project! I want as many people to know about it as possible, even if they can't donate. This project is my pride and joy at the moment, and I would love for others to hear about it! You can watch for updates at http://www.facebook.com/TheSpaceMermaid.

story:
Former students, check perk near bottom of page.

           

I would appreciate any contribution to fund my first book titled, Government Cheese and other Treats. The title is a reference to my first years of teaching when teacher pay in South Dakota was so low we qualified for free lunches and other government assistance. 

After teaching for a quarter of a century, I decided I wanted to be a writer when I grow up. Freelancing for several publishing sites and orders from a few private clients keep me as busy as I want to be. But, like many English teachers I've always wanted to write a book.

Government Cheese and other Treats

The book is a memoir of sorts. A few stories reflect on my days as a single parent. Thinking everyone ate eggs, macaroni and dark meat chicken, my kids didn't realize we were poor.  

One of their favorite childhood foods was the infamous free commodity known as government cheese. They loved it. We had grilled cheese, macaroni and cheese, cheesy eggs, cheese casseroles, cheese bread, cheese and crackers and plain sliced cheese. The government cheese always disappeared long before the next batch of commodities was handed out in our small town. But, it was a big deal. Thankfully, we lived near a neighbor with an apple tree so my kids didn't suffer from constipation. 

We didn't have much but we always had food on the table. And, we never missed our spot in line waiting for that amazing government cheese. 

Eventually, we moved to Iowa. My paycheck increased, we enjoyed more diversity and my kids were challenged more in academics, athletics and extra-curricular activities. But, the government cheese was no longer an option.

*****************************************************************************************************    The oldest of six kids, I was blessed to live on my grandparent's farm during my early childhood. My grandmother cooked and baked almost everything from scratch. When I was little, she let me punch down the bread dough before I was old enough to make it. 

Whenever I smell homemade bread I can picture Grandma Marge in her flour speckled apron mixing up a batch of dough to bake rolls and bread. Throughout the book, a few special family recipes appear-many including the title ingredient of government cheese. 

finding inspiration

It seems many writers carry around some drama or trauma at some point. I've experienced both the pretend and real kind. A few ugly events took away a big chunk of my carefree disposition. When Amy suffered through cancer of her nasal pharnyx, I hit a low point in life. The empty, desperate feeling of my daughter enduring the hell of cancer while I couldn't fix it is a feeling no one should experience. 

Another turning point in my own pity party, my vibrant, athletic, youngest daughter was diagnosed with a rare type of terminal brain cancer. Andy started radiation treatment on her 31st birthday. She says everything happens for a reason. She's doesn't feel sorry for herself. Her strength is amazing. But, it's her determination to live each day- to refuse to allow the disease to define her and to appreciate friends and family, that motivated me to start writing new stories and finishing the old ones.

details on funds 

Any funds donated to this campaign will be used to self publish my book. Expenses are listed below. If the project is not fully funded, all donations will be used to do as much as possible on the project. Expenses include:

  • self publishing fees

  • professional editing

  • professional assistance with cover design

  • printing costs for hard copies

overcoming challenges

Readers will identify with some stories and be entertained by others. Through hardships I've learned to laugh as much as possible and keep my sense of  humor. Life is better when you come from a positive place. Every time a friend helps my daughter or sends her a special gift, I'm reminded of good in the world. I hope enough of those kind generous people read this page and help me recognize my dream of self publishing this collection of stories.

I hope sharing my personal experiences can help other women realize they can rise above society's labels. Sharing details about my daughter's deep faith and unbelievable courage will inspire others to never give up. Having two children who have faced cancer, I rediscovered we should explore options and turn away from those who insist we must follow a formula in life. 

other ways you can help

I appreciate your support. If you have any friends who might be interested in contributing to my campaign, please forward and post the address on your Facebook Wall, on Twitter, any social media or email addresses.

If you have a bulletin board in your workplace, please share this address http://igg.me/at/govtcheeseejyoung/x/5699002. Thank you so much for taking time to help me publish my book. Thank you for helping me realize a life-long dream.

story:
Short Summary

Do you listen to what is going on in our political world shake your head and say WTF?  Anyone who did this in the real world would get their ass chewed out and fired. You take $40MM and blow it on a website by hiring loons from Canada that got fired by the Canadian government.   WTF?

My name is Orest, like FOrest without the F.  I live and breathe politics and I say WTF more than most and firmly believe that all this deserves radical edgy commentary that won’t be held back by the fn PC police. I will bring that and more to you.

We are here to smoke cigars, drink scotch and poke disrespectful fun at the political elite, rule-creating bureaucrats and many others.  The list is truly endless.  

We need money to create a website capable of mass interaction without crash (healthcare.gov) and superheated for interactive, multimedia use. We’ll check references before we hire because I respect your contribution. I won’t hire any long lost college friends or their kids to do this like our Community Organizer and Chief did. Of course anyone can learn how to build a basic site (except the government) but I need bells and whistles.  The site we have now. Reallydumbpolitics.com, can’t handle what we need to do or to bring the best of what is on the web as well as our own outrageous content.    And of course as we start to grow buttholes and their lawyers are going to come after us.  We need to make sure all we are doing is legit and on the up and up. That leads us to our favorite fee:  the attorney fee.  No more needs to be said.

  Don’t be shy.  Get in on the ground floor become a part of the ridicule, even if you prefer to sip wine and enjoy e-cigarettes.

To make RDP happen I need you to:

  • Send me the outrageous from your area (to OrestThePrez@reallydumbpolitics.com)

  • Send me money by joining one of my groups.  You can join for as little as $5 but be brave, be bold, and be a Cabinet Member - surely you are smarter than those who occupy these chairs!

  • I need at least  $25Gs to pay some young techie to set up the website and some legal genius to save me from myself (think defamation suit).
  • Share my message with the world!

story:
Time of Blessing

A new home and an opened door to a promising new career; life was finally beginning for Raphaela Edwards. This was a time in her life that she had prayed for, waited for and desperately needed.  After taking major steps to initiate the beginning of the independent life she’d thought she’d lost sight of one would

believe that all would naturally begin to fall into place and life would be good, finally. Good does come with an unexpected opportunity and unexpected new partner and friend and a mystery man but along with the good arises the all the unresolved issues and unhealed wounds that were thought to be left behind. 

Trying to continue on with forging this new life and wanting to hold on to the joy of all that has come her way proves nearly impossible when rejection and abandonment from the past come to her front door.  This was not how Raphaela envisioned a time of blessing to be. How is it possible to experience blessings and still feel like you are drowning?


Introducing JNicole 

It is with great joy that I get to introduce myself as not just a writer but as an author; while there are  other skills and jobs on my resume that I could list at this present time that is that one aspect of me that matters. Alright there is one other important aspect of my character that should be known which is I am a dreamer and after years of supporting and promoting the dreams of other the time came for me to finally focus on one of my own... Becoming a published author!

I fell in love with the written word at such a young age that I cannot recall a time when I did not want to write. This desire was well nurtured throughout my education from pre-school straight through to my days as an English major at The University of Connecticut. Countless hours growing up were spent in my room filling notebooks with poems, songs, short stories and the beginnings of quite a few books. With the completion of my first novel all of my notebooks now have a new life. It is my desire to allow this novel to lead way to a career doing what I love.

Write what you know. Those words attributed to  one of my favorite authors, Mark Twain, have been countlessly given as advice to aspiring writers to keep their work genuine and organic. No one had to offer that advice to me because never before have I had the pleasure of creating something so real, so inspired by life itself that I felt my characters with me as their lives were penned and it is my desire that they become real to those that read the page of Time of Blessing. This is not a novel with deep complex themes or a plot that must be studied and dissected in order to grasp an understanding of it. This is a novel of real life. In this first book of a two part (at least) series we meet a thirty something woman that has taken charge of her life and stepped out on faith believing that God has brought her to a great new season in life. Faith is shaken when all that she’d hoped to have moved on from shows that it is still very much with her and prevalent in her current situation.  So the question is how do you welcome the new when the old still occupying space? How do you find strength to believe in the better when life keeps attacking?

Writing Time of Blessing  was not a choice for me, it was not on my writing to do list but one night this determined young woman, Raphaela Edwards, found me and her story interrupted my plans. What I was writing at the time and desired to have as my first novel was put on hold while this story spoke to me. This inspirational fiction novel is a story of life transitions, of dealing with what is broken, of shifting relationships, of open doors and learning what it really means to be in a new season in life.  I am so grateful to have been given the assignment of bringing this woman to life and I hope that through this one woman’s test of faith and strength someone will be encouraged much as I was in writing her story.

Going from Manuscript to Life

What is needed for the process

After seeking advice and doing an exhausted amount of research I made the decision to go the route of self-publishing for my novel.  Further research has lead me to the final decision to not go through a self-publishing company or vanity press rather do this on my own to protect myself, my work, my vision and the quality of my final product. It is a major undertaking, daunting at times but very appealing to my business side. I’ve educated myself on the process and have already begun to move forward this however there is one issue… Doing this on my own also means financing this on my own. Now I have some great people, professionals, in place to work with me through this process and I am beyond grateful for how they have been willing to work with my financial situation. At this time with the way things look the project will be slowed down and push the release of the book into mid-2015 and without some sort of financial backing it might be pushed back even further. I am not one that likes to ask for help when it comes to money but I am determined to do what needs to be done to get Time of Blessing on its feet for this is only the beginning.

What is needed? I am looking at a need of $15,000 to get through the entire process which includes

Editing

Design( cover and interior)

ISBN purchase

Barcode

Copyrighting

Printing

EBook formatting & release

Distribution

Marketing- website, reviews, advertising, etc.

Also because I am not going through a self-publishing company I will be publishing under my own company name so on top of the publishing cost I face startup costs as well.

Now $15,000 may seem like a gross amount to spend on just a book and may seem unnecessary to many but it is to publish a book the right way. This may be a dream but it is still a business and in order to be truly market ready there are no short cuts to be taken here all must be done with excellence.  With everything that is contributed through this campaign know that everything I am is invested in this project, in this dream. I do not ask of others what I am not willing to do.

I am truly grateful for you willingness to support this dreamers dream and for each act of generosity please except the gifts that I have to offer to you. When you take the time to bless me I must bless you in return. 

 


This is a very important project to me and it is my hope that it is the first of many. The success of this campaign means that I will be able to produce a quality professional product that is capable of entering an industry where new independent authors have to do all they can to get noticed. I will be able to lay the foundation for what is next to come for my career and total vision. I have already begun  Time of Blessing book two and there are other books planned to follow as well and success in this campaign means I will have things already in place for the process to begin for those projects.

Now the bigger picture is this, I don’t write for myself if that was the case I would be content in just filling up shelves with notebooks of my scribbles. I write to breathe something into someone else, to speak into someone else, to give to someone else.

I am a writer of inspirational fiction for that purpose. I have not set out to write some sensational novel, yes I want to be successful but I’m here with a purpose to effect the lives of others with the gifts that I have been given.

Once I am able to complete this first project my intent beyond establishing my own writing career is to be able to be a help to others like me that desire to share their gifts with others. This is about more than me.

I ask one more thing

Every way that you can contribute is greatly appreciated and besides monetary contribution please spread the word. Tell family, friends, friends of friends, anyone that you know that is a believer in dreams, lover of the written word, supporter of the arts and its power to inspire and effect lives. I need the support of many to help give Time of Blessing a life.

Blessings!

JNicole


For more information feel free to contact me at jnicvic@gmail.com

Please follow me and my journey

https://www.facebook.com/jessica.nicole.fripp

https://www.facebook.com/TOBNovel

http://apieceofmyvictoriousheart.blogspot.com/

https://twitter.com/jnic_vh

https://twitter.com/TOBNovel

https://www.youtube.com/user/jnicvic/feed

story:
The Noir

A Fistful of Nothing is a hardboiled detective novel by Dan Glaser.  This dieselpunk noir centers around an ex-private eye who scours the collapsed metro tunnels of a revisionist 1950's-era Hollywood for payoff on a gamble gone wrong, but stumbles instead on an underground city divided by vice, vendettas, mysteries and murder plots.

The Novelist

Glaser has spent the last five years as an independent filmmaker. He has written, produced and directed a number of projects, including his first feature film Pinching Penny, shot in his hometown of Fargo, North Dakota and which went on to receive international distribution. He frequently collaborates with fellow Midwestern-bred artists Timothy J. Meyer and Steven Molony through their joint production company Unmarked Van Films.

His love of film aside, Glaser has always been a storyteller: whether smashing together superhero action figures and plastic dinosaurs in the backyard as a youth (catching the chaos with his parents' beat-up yet trusty 80's camcorder), or scribbling his first novella in his seventh-grade English journal...all the way to Pinching Penny, Unmarked Van Films and beyond, Glaser has loved to craft stories both visually and scrawl them on the page.

It has always been a lifelong dream of Glaser's to write and publish a full-fledged novel, and he has taken his love of detective stories, dystopian fiction, speculative sci-fi, and 1940/50's-era Hollywood and blended them into a volume that is part unique invention, part loving homage--and he's reaching out now to his endlessly supportive family, friends, fellow artists and fans, for their help in aiding this story to see the light of day.

The Nitty-Gritty

Further specifics, for the more inquiring sleuths:

  • The author is trying to raise $4,500 to cover the costs of writing, submitting, and publishing the novel, including: 
  1. Contracting an artist and/or graphics company for a professional cover design
  2. The creation of a stellar website/purchase of a domain name
  3. Studio recording time for the audiobook version
  4. Printing and shipping costs for submissions
  5. The massive marketing/advertising costs it will take to truly get the word out about the novel's release
  6. As well as allowing the author a small amount of breathing room to take the proper time to write, revise, edit, submit, etc. 
  7. Not to mention accounting for the cut Indiegogo takes from the money raised (up to 9%).
  • An issue that plagues many crowdfunding campaigns is the delivery on promised prizes. Each perk presented in this fundraiser has been specifically designed to be delivered digitally. The problem with physical prizes is that the creation and shipping costs end up draining a huge portion of the donations pledged, thus greatly defeating the purpose of the fundraiser in the first place. Each reward included to your right is a nifty gift, meant as a more personalized thank you from the artist for helping him get the novel off the ground and onto the shelves! Faster, guaranteed to be delivered, and without the monetary restraint on the artist you're trying to support! Think of it as a grab-bag of goodies, a little extra thanks for spending the time and energy to help!

The Nightcap

For those readers who'd like to contribute, but money is tight, that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Here are a few less pricey ways to lend your support:

  • Get the word out! Tell a relative or steer a friend to the fundraiser to help make some noise about this campaign!
  • The Indiegogo share tools are an easy way to spread the love!
  • Remember that even contributions of $1 to $5 really go a long way! 

Lastly and most importantly, thank you all for taking the time to read up on this campaign! Your support means the world to the author, and if sounds like a story you'd like to pick up and read, please consider doing what you can to help make this dream a reality today!

*Special Thanks to Nicholas Collins for the photo creation
