He has written, produced and directed a number of projects, including his first feature film Pinching Penny, shot in his hometown of Fargo, North Dakota and which went on to receive international distribution. He frequently collaborates with fellow Midwestern-bred artists Timothy J. Meyer and Steven Molony through their joint production company Unmarked Van Films.
His love of film aside, Glaser has always been a storyteller: whether smashing together superhero action figures and plastic dinosaurs in the backyard as a youth (catching the chaos with his parents' beat-up yet trusty 80's camcorder), or scribbling his first novella in his seventh-grade English journal...all the way to Pinching Penny, Unmarked Van Films and beyond, Glaser has loved to craft stories both visually and scrawl them on the page.
It has always been a lifelong dream of Glaser's to write and publish a full-fledged novel, and he has taken his love of detective stories, dystopian fiction, speculative sci-fi, and 1940/50's-era Hollywood and blended them into a volume that is part unique invention, part loving homage--and he's reaching out now to his endlessly supportive family, friends, fellow artists and fans, for their help in aiding this story to see the light of day.



The Nitty-Gritty
Further specifics, for the more inquiring sleuths:
The author is trying to raise $4,500 to cover the costs of writing, submitting, and publishing the novel, including: 

Contracting an artist and/or graphics company for a professional cover design

The creation of a stellar website/purchase of a domain name
Studio recording time for the audiobook version

Printing and shipping costs for submissions
The massive marketing/advertising costs it will take to truly get the word out about the novel's release
As well as allowing the author a small amount of breathing room to take the proper time to write, revise, edit, submit, etc. 
Not to mention accounting for the cut Indiegogo takes from the money raised (up to 9%).


An issue that plagues many crowdfunding campaigns is the delivery on promised prizes. Each perk presented in this fundraiser has been specifically designed to be delivered digitally. The problem with physical prizes is that the creation and shipping costs end up draining a huge portion of the donations pledged, thus greatly defeating the purpose of the fundraiser in the first place. Each reward included to your right is a nifty gift, meant as a more personalized thank you from the artist for helping him get the novel off the ground and onto the shelves! Faster, guaranteed to be delivered, and without the monetary restraint on the artist you're trying to support! Think of it as a grab-bag of goodies, a little extra thanks for spending the time and energy to help!


The Nightcap
For those readers who'd like to contribute, but money is tight, that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Here are a few less pricey ways to lend your support:

Get the word out! Tell a relative or steer a friend to the fundraiser to help make some noise about this campaign!
The Indiegogo share tools are an easy way to spread the love!
Remember that even contributions of $1 to $5 really go a long way! 


Lastly and most importantly, thank you all for taking the time to read up on this campaign! Your support means the world to the author, and if sounds like a story you'd like to pick up and read, please consider doing what you can to help make this dream a reality today!



*Special Thanks to Nicholas Collins for the photo creation

story:
Dear family and friends,


          Hey how are you? I have decided to send a month news letter over the next year just to keep you informed as to whats going on in my life. I am doing amazing, over this past year god has delivered me from depression, drugs, emotional abuse, alcohol, suicidal thoughts and reconciled with all I have hurt and all those who hurt me including my family. And I am proud to say that I am now 1 year and 1 month clean from it all. God has blessed with an opportunity now to go into master’s commission.


         

         God has opened the door to an amazing opportunity to Metro Atlanta masters commission (mamc) which is based out of Victory World Church, in Norcross, GA It is a nine month discipleship training program, beginning September 19, 2011. They works along side with other local churches all over the world. Through hands-on experience, as well as theological training, I will be trained and equipped in most every facet of ministry while being challenged to grow in my walk with Christ. This is the cry of my heart. I really believe god has opened this opportunity for me because he has an awesome plan for me over another intense year. This year through masters I am going into the missions study so I can better help troubled teens with their struggles as I went through to give them hope and a new way to live through Christ.


          

          As you may have guessed, this is a major step for me and I would greatly benefit from your prayers at this time in my life also, I am diligently working to raise money for tuition: if you feel impressed to help me financially, I would very much appreciate any support you are able to offer. There are a few ways that you can contribute you can give a one time gift, monthly, weekly, or send a check directly to the church. I have also decided to get a financial accountability to hold me accountable to stick to the budget I have drawn up. His information will be induced for any one who is curios on how I am doing in the next letter.


          

          You can make your check payable to the metro Atlanta masters commission and mail it to the church (MAMC, 5989 financial drive, Norcross, GA 30071) any financial gift to MAMC Tuition will be tax deductible. My budget includes for gas, food, cell phone bill, Landry, personal hygiene and insurance, with all that being said if you chose to write a check directly to me, (Walter Roland Arnold III)They can also be written to the church however, this will not fall under the tax guidelines of being tax deduction. Regardless of how you are able to participate, I want you to know that I am praying that god will continue to bless you and reveal to you in a more intimate way.


        

           I also wanted to say to really pray to god on how he wants you to take this letter, in 2 Corinthians 9:7-8 You must each decide in your heart how much to give And don’t give reluctantly or in response to pressure. “For God loves a person who gives cheerfully And God will generously provide all you need. Then you will always have everything you need and plenty left over to share with others”. So I ask that if god wants you to pray or give to do so with a joyful heart because it is all going toward his kingdom. I really appreciate you taking the time to read this letter. I know god is going to use this training to propel me in to his perfect plan over my life. May you have a blessed day in Jesus’ name!



PS-you can find more information at mamc.org

 yourself and tell your campaign's story. Make sure to cover the who, what, where, when and how of your campaign.)

story:
Who we are:

The New Quarterly is a magazine of Canadian fiction, poetry, and essays primarily about the writer’s craft that has been publishing out of Waterloo, Ontario for 31 years. Our mandate is to nurture emerging writers by publishing and promoting their work alongside that of well-established writers we admire, and to provide an editorial context in which both can be read. We try to balance serious consideration of matters literary with playfulness and invention. TNQ writers have gone on to be nominated for Giller prizes, Governor General’s Awards, Griffin Poetry Prizes, Writer’s Trust Notable Author awards, Journey prizes, Commonwealth prizes, National Magazine Awards, and more.
We're working with Words Worth Books, The Jazz Room, and The Balsillie School to present Waterloo's first writers festival!

 

 

What we're doing:

The Wild Writers Festival will provide a platform for established and emerging Canadian writers to share their writing and expertise with readers and writers in the region, fostering a local love of literature. It will take place on November 2-3, in Uptown Waterloo.

The Festival will combine a mix of readings and educational opportunities (Master Classes and panel discussions) for aspiring writers and lovers of literature, in a fun and engaging way. We will host a series of masterclasses for writers to be presented by experts in their field that will range in subjects from literary to general interest.

Master Class topics include:  sessions on professional development (e.g. how to establish a relationship with a publisher)  as well as on issues having to do with the craft of writing ( e.g. The Art of Blogging,’ ‘Writing from Life’). The line-up will be established in the coming months.

The schedule of events includes a ticketed public literary event on the evening of Friday Nov 2nd, all day readings and classes on Nov. 3rd and a closing literature and music celebration on the evening of the 3rd.  The Balisille School has generously donated our day-time venue, and our closing celebration will take place at The Jazz Room.

What We Need

We've already booked our venues and planned our programming. We're looking for help to bring writers to the region to share their stories and teach our master classes! Your donation will go toward travel expenses and fair compensation for the writers who will share their work and expertise with local book-lovers and aspiring writers.

The Impact

The New Quarterly has a reputation for launching the careers of some of Canada's best writers. Our "Wild Writers We Have Known" Symposium in 2000 featured a number of rising-star writers we were betting on; the list included emerging writers Michael Winter, Michael Crummey, and Caroline Adderson who each went on to win the Writers Trust Notable Author Award. The Wild Writers Festival will give Waterloo the opportunity to say "I knew them when..."

The Wild Writers Festival will:

  • provide a platform for established and rising-star writers  to share their work and expertise with writers—and book lovers—in Waterloo Region and surrounding areas.
  • allow writers and book-lovers to get to know the next generation of emerging Canadian Writers while supporting those rising stars

  • provide educational opportunities for local writers seeking to improve their craft and achieve their goals of getting published

  • create a sense of community among local writers and book-lovers

Other Ways You Can Help

If you think that Canlit is worth sharing, please share this campaign with your friends!

story:
Hi,

my name is Marcos Nagele, i created the idea of a photography print magazine called POG (stand for "Peace of Grey"), on paper in black & white. 

I am companied by good people helping me, rented a perfect office and made a plan until release in November 2014.  The flexible budget defines a pure existence in an European city for the period of six months.

Thanks for reading and all support.

story:
The New Old Age - The Book and The Movement


Who Is David Glover?

Vocalist /Actor, award-winning playwright and composer. Glover began singing at age 5.  Through the years he continued his performance interest singing in churches, schools, on street-corners and recording studios. He eventually earned a Bachelor's Degree in Music.

In 1981, Glover wrote his first musical play, Doo Wop, a 50s R&B musical, which included a book. He received the Bay Area Theatre Critics Circle Award for his outstanding work. In 2000, Glover brought in the new millennium creating his first one man show entitled Relationships, a romance from a man's perspective.

In 2010 Glover reached  a pivotal turning point in his life as he approached his 65th birthday. He had a VISION to create and perform his most recent one man show entitled, Old Happens!  Today, David Glover is now ready unveil his latest work The New Old Age .


The New Old Age Campaign

Everyone ages. Maybe you are over 50 years old or maybe you aren't there yet but your parents, grandparents or aunts and uncles are. 

I have written a book. Now my goal is to get it published and circulated. Help me reach the goal of eradicating AGEISM. 

Your contribution will be the landmark for change. It starts with you. Thank you.


Testimonial by Burt Kranzel

"Thank you for providing new insight into -NOW- i.e. 66 & beyond (I was born 10/17/46)  Your work really has altered the way I am relating to my age, etc.  & I would love to help "spread the word"  

 See more 

The Goals and Your Perks

  • The book is written. Now I need your help. The New Old Age needs to be edited and printed.  We want to deliver professional, quality copies of The New Old Age to you, the campaign supporters and readers across the globe.
  • I am asking you to help me reach the minimum goal of $5,000 to help get this book off the ground. I want to share it with you. The New Old Age should be available in any establishment that serves the aging population. Aren't all of us aging?
  • My hope is that we not only reach the goal of $5,000, but that we surpass it. If The New Old Age has great marketing, this innovative concept  can reach the hearts and minds of people far beyond my geographical area. I want people to have access to The New Old Age regardless of their location or income.
We have put together a list of great perks available only through this campaign. Gain valuable insight, be entertained and get your piece of history first.


Oakland Tribune Article (Angela Hill)

David Glover is taking a new approach to growing old, and it's getting him rave reviews.

In his one-man musical comedy show "Old Happens" -- performed in senior centers and at aging conferences here and across the country since 2011 -- Glover, 67, of Oakland shares an uplifting message about "glorifying" advanced age rather than fearing it, reaching his audience through song, humor and conversation.

By day, Glover works as a substitute teacher in the East Bay, and he previously taught music in Oakland public and private schools for many years. But his soul thrives as an artist, composer, playwright, actor and vocalist who has performed with the likes of Sly Stone, Al Jarreau and Larry Graham.

See More


The Impact of The New Old Age

  • Your contributions will help get The New Old Age printed faster. It will ensure that this book is delivered in a professional and high quality manner.
  • I am a 69 year old going full sail, so can you at any age. Learn how utilizing the five point principle fortified in this book.

Once the books are ready for distribution, any additional funds will greatly help with marketing and with taking the book and the one man show "Old Happens" on the road. The greater the funds raised, the greater reach this powerful message will have.


The Challenges 

  • I want people to understand how important the topic of Aging is. How important it is to embrace aging. I have to be sure to not let my passion get in the way of effectively communicating with others. I could write all day about this!
  • One of my concerns is that soo many of us get busy with LIFE. I have something valuable to share with you. I have teamed up with some amazing marketing folks and experts to help me devise a plan. First step, this crowdfunding campaign.

The New Old Age book helps us to understand and appreciate who we were and who we are.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    $5, $20, $50, $100 any amount you can contribute is greatly appreciated. I also humbly ask that if you are moved by what I am doing, please help me spread the word and help this campaign become wildly successful:

    • Help me spread the word. Please share this Indiegogo Crowd Funding campaign info with 5 of your friends and family members verbally, by email and on social media. It would greatly help in spreading the message and raising the necessary funds.
    • Remember Indiegogo has some pretty good tools that will help make it easier for you to donate and spread the word on my behalf!

    Words cannot express the gratitude that I have for you giving my your time, donations and support.

    Thank you...David Glover

It would greatly help in spreading the message and raising the necessary funds. Remember Indiegogo has some pretty good tools that will help make it easier for you to donate and spread the word on my behalf!

Words cannot express the gratitude that I have for you giving my your time, donations and support.Thank you...David Glover

story:
Short Summary

FROM THE BACK COVER of Joan: Drop Dead Diva It ain't a culinary book, although characters eat a lot of fantastic dishes and dish about celebrities.This is not biography of any kind either. It's full of real data from Joan's life to keep it more close to our hearts and down to earth. Joan was once a comedienne. Due to unfortunate tour of events she crosses over to a new world that seems to be so like ours, but it's not the same. Before afterlife of star treatment she has few more assignments on the menu. With her new pals Mandy, Ksav, Monique and Mary she must go to new frontiers, to declutter and clean talentless celebrities from public life. You will "Meet the Farthashians", "Cleaning Ladies of Hollywood-end”, “Divas without the voices”, “Housewives from the Sexy mansion” and “Spoiled and dumb - kids of Beverly Halls” plus many more in the book, that glorifies true talent and puts satire treatment on so called stars of the hollywood. Did I mention Joan's dog is back? Max will give you extra thrills.

---------------------------

I always admired funny and strong independent women. Joan was one of them- with sharp tongue and crazy jokes. She was one of a kind.  I was totally saddened by her departure in September this year. I have decided to give her second life in my book. I sincerely hope that small part of her will bring smiles once again to all her fans, comfort and once again joy to people close to her.


What I Need & What You Get

  • It is totally independent project by a fan and for fans.
  • You can help me hire professional copy-editors
  • Big part of donations will help me make a printed version of the book (first run 1000 copies)
  • Your donations will help me to prepare professional versions for all major e-readers (like kindle, nook, iPad etc).
All donors no matter how big your contribution is will receive digital copy of the book in (epub and mobi formats) on release date.
There is more perks:
You can have your name printed on Thank You page
You can have logo of your company printed on the back of the cover
You can have a printed copy of the book autographed by yours truly :)

The Impact

Your contributions will help me to sort out all financial issues related to the book faster and in more efficient manner.

    Risks & Challenges

    No matter what book will be published digitally. I am planing to finish it by end of this year. Premiere is planned for Valentine's Day 2015 (may be changed). 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you would like to help me please spread the word about the project and get sneak peeks into the Hollywood-end and Joan's adventures :

      We're on Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/jrdropdeaddiva 


      Thank You for reading this and your help!

      Rafal

      -- from the book---

      About the Author

      Rafal Kudlinski is a Polish physicist and journalist.  His career choices were very diverse. During high school years he was fascinated by science fiction television shows like “Quantum Leap”, Buck Rogers in the 25th Century and Time Trax. That led him to the first stage of his education as a Physicist. In 2003 he graduated from Wroclaw University of Technology with degree in Computer Physics. During the studies period he became obsessed with Hollywood stars. When internet approached “Big Bang” years, he started to create websites for all the stars he loved and admired, starting with Scott Bakula and ending with Hugh Jackman. He was avid viewer of E! Entertainment network and always dreamed to work for his crazy institution.  Unfortunately life took a different scenario and led him once again in different direction to pursue a stable career. In 2004 he graduated from Wroclaw University of Economics with post grad diploma in Quality Assurance. Life was good he had a steady job but the dream of becoming a journalist and desire to become part of media world started to bite again. In 2008 he started his 3rd degree at University of Wroclaw in Journalism and Social Communication from which he graduated in 2010. The same year he started an online magazine(NEWSFix Magazine) with his best friend Piotr. Also in 2010 he published his first book dedicated to journalism students about themed television channels.  “Joan: Drop Dead Diva” is his first novel which he wanted to write second he heard Joan Rivers is dead. Joan was a very special to him. Her jokes were often taken out of his mouth. As much he admires true artists he hates pseudo celebrities who have nothing special but gain popularity with the masses.

Did I mention Joan's dog is back? Max will give you extra thrills.
---------------------------
I always admired funny and strong independent women. Joan was one of them- with sharp tongue and crazy jokes. She was one of a kind.  I was totally saddened by her departure in September this year. I have decided to give her second life in my book. I sincerely hope that small part of her will bring smiles once again to all her fans, comfort and once again joy to people close to her.



  What I Need & What You Get 
It is totally independent project by a fan and for fans. You can help me hire professional copy-editors 

Big part of donations will help me make a printed version of the book (first run 1000 copies) Your donations will help me to prepare professional versions for all major e-readers (like kindle, nook, iPad etc). 
All donors no matter how big your contribution is will receive digital copy of the book in (epub and mobi formats) on release date.
There is more perks:
You can have your name printed on Thank You page
You can have logo of your company printed on the back of the cover
You can have a printed copy of the book autographed by yours truly :)
  The Impact Your contributions will help me to sort out all financial issues related to the book faster and in more efficient manner.

  Risks & Challenges No matter what book will be published digitally. I am planing to finish it by end of this year. Premiere is planned for Valentine's Day 2015 (may be changed). 

  Other Ways You Can Help If you would like to help me please spread the word about the project and get sneak peeks into the Hollywood-end and Joan's adventures :
We're on Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/jrdropdeaddiva 

Thank You for reading this and your help!
Rafal
-- from the book---

About the Author

Rafal Kudlinski is a Polish physicist and journalist.  His career choices were very diverse. During high school years he was fascinated by science fiction television shows like “Quantum Leap”, Buck Rogers in the 25th Century and Time Trax. That led him to the first stage of his education as a Physicist. In 2003 he graduated from Wroclaw University of Technology with degree in Computer Physics. During the studies period he became obsessed with Hollywood stars. When internet approached “Big Bang” years, he started to create websites for all the stars he loved and admired, starting with Scott Bakula and ending with Hugh Jackman. He was avid viewer of E! Entertainment network and always dreamed to work for his crazy institution.  Unfortunately life took a different scenario and led him once again in different direction to pursue a stable career. In 2004 he graduated from Wroclaw University of Economics with post grad diploma in Quality Assurance. Life was good he had a steady job but the dream of becoming a journalist and desire to become part of media world started to bite again. In 2008 he started his 3rd degree at University of Wroclaw in Journalism and Social Communication from which he graduated in 2010. The same year he started an online magazine(NEWSFix Magazine) with his best friend Piotr. Also in 2010 he published his first book dedicated to journalism students about themed television channels.  “Joan: Drop Dead Diva” is his first novel which he wanted to write second he heard Joan Rivers is dead. Joan was a very special to him. Her jokes were often taken out of his mouth. As much he admires true artists he hates pseudo celebrities who have nothing special but gain popularity with the masses.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
UPDATE: WE GOT TO 30K BUT IT'S NOT OVER. 

10% OF THE PROFIT THAT WAS MADE AFTER REACHING MY INITIAL GOAL (20K$) WILL BE DONATED TO THE NGO “LEBANESE FOOD BANK”, WHO IS FIGHTING FOR FOOD SECURITY IN LEBANON.

*** A very very Special Thank You to:
Alexie Monnerville for the kickass video
Valeria Bismar for the food photography
Laure Corten for the food styling
Nour Tohme for the book renderings and book layout
Lara Zankoul for the portrait photos
Hoda for the illustrations (and for being my sister)
Sabiha Chaudry for the copy editing 
Jennifer El Hage for the logo
AND Ramy, Marielle, Nathalie, Soha, Roanne, Mo, Anthony R., Marc S., Marc T., Elie, Jad, Paula & many more for your help and support to create this crowdfunding campaign. I LOVE YOU ***

You guys know how moms cook. They’ll say things like a handful of rice, a pinch of cumin or even measure things with a mug/arabic coffee cup. That’s totally ok when you’re right next to mama, and you can ask her “yaani this much??”                                                                                                           

But when you’re not, this is when things get complicated. I can’t tell you how many voice notes I’ve received from my mom, my aunt, my mom’s friend to explain how to make something, or how many times I’ve held my phone over a pot or a bowl to make sure I was doing things right.                                            

I was so intimidated. And when I spoke about it with people around me, I wasn’t the only one.

Living in Montreal meant that I’ll be raising my kids here, and it scared me that I couldn’t reproduce the meals I grew up eating and loving so much. Food that tasted like home.

So I decided to bridge that gap.

This is how Mama Ghannouj was born. This cookbook brings together our most loved Lebanese recipes from 10 mamas that are known to be excellent cooks in the community. It was created to (finally) have a written record of our mamas' recipes, and for our cultural food traditions to get passed down and live on.


photo by Valeria Bismar, styled by Laure Corten.

So. Many. Things. 

A lot of beauty, some laughs, and a whole lot of knowledge.
You’ll get to know the mamas through Lara Zankoul’s lens and through my words. You'll get to see the delicious recipes that they have shared and insights, shot by Valeria Bismar and styled by Laure Corten. You’ll have a whole chapter dedicated to setting you up right for Lebanese cooking, no matter if you’re a beginner or a seasoned cook. 

The most important part of it all is that you’ll have access to these recipes we have longed to have written down in a clear and concise way, full of priceless tips and insights. 


Think of this crowdfunding as a pre-order of your copy, but that’s not all. You’re getting it at a discounted price!

I’ll also be giving out so many cool perks, like a tote illustrated by the illustrator of the book, Hoda (my sister!), and wait for it… classes with me!

But essentially, I'm doing a crowdfunding to get your FULL support! Pre-order the book, tell your friends about it, talk about it with colleagues, share the link, everything helps!

The work is done: the recipes have been collected, tested and written down. The photos have been taken, the illustrations have been completed, and the book has been laid out.
All that is left is printing.
But this part is expensive, so pre-order the book to get the ball rolling!      


photo by Valeria Bismar, styled by Laure Corten.

As I’m at the end of my process, this limits uncertainties quite a bit.

The book is already in final stages of layout, and will be ready to go to print after this crowdfunding is over. 

Printing deadline

Once the files are sent out to the printer, it will take 4 to 5 weeks for them to print and manually bind each and every copy. Delays are not supposed to occur, but it is important to mention this as this part is out of my control.

Delivery deadline

As mentioned before, I’m doing this project on my own, which means I will be handling, and packaging every box myself (with a little help from my family and friends because… covid). I’m hoping that this campaign goes so well that I will have thousands of books to package, but this also means that some time should be factored in to process your orders as fast as possible.
That being said, I already have a system in place to ensure this goes as smoothly and efficiently as possible! 

Please get the word out there and make some noise about Mama Ghannouj! Every share, mention and contribution counts to have this book in as many kitchens as possible around the world!

Please get the word out there and make some noise about Mama Ghannouj! Every share, mention and contribution counts to have this book in as many kitchens as possible around the world!

story:
What is Stories By The River?

A picture paints a thousand words. But I prefer to use words to paint pictures.

Stories By The River began as unrelated poetry and prose I’d been writing whenever I could, mostly inspired by the area around the Singapore River and life in Singapore. Some were first written as early as 2007 and some as recently as three months ago.

You'll be taken on a narrative journey across styles, settings and states of mind, complemented by wonderful watercolour art by my cousin Odilia, and I hope you'll find that this collection as a whole is also its own kind of poem.

 

Why should you buy this?

Well, why would you buy any book, film or painting? I can’t promise you a groundbreaking piece of literature. But I can assure you that I've done everything I can to make this something I'm distinctly proud of - and I write for a living.

Also, and this is the part that has genuinely surprised me: When I first showed a whole bunch of early readers my works in progress, everyone liked a different poem best. Everyone identified with something different. It’s been a joy seeing my work through other peoples’ eyes and listening to their own interpretations of it. That’s the complete beauty of written word and I hope you’ll enjoy it the same way.

 

What you're paying for

Not many tiers to this. For USD$4 you’ll get a high-quality PDF for digital reading, and for USD$12 you’ll get the printed edition (with free postage). For you generous folk, at USD$72 you'll get three copies, limited edition prints of Odilia's art (size and quantity not yet determined), and a mention of your name in the book's "thank you" notes. This page functions as a pre-order system so that I don’t over-print (and over-spend).

If I have enough proceeds from sales, I'll also organise a launch party for which you are more than welcome to attend. I'll shout this out on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/storiesbytheriversg/

 

Any risks?

The only moving parts left are the printing and the postal service. I'll post updates when printing is done, and when I mail the books out so we can all track this together.

story:
56 Days of August is a collection of postcard-sized poems with more than 30 beautiful color artworks, edited by Paul E. Nelson, JI Kleinberg, and Ina Roy-Faderman, and published by Five Oaks Press. Paul, co-founder the August Poetry Postcard Festival, developed the project to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the festival and honor the spontaneous, authentic poetry that it gives birth to. We picked each poem and piece of art to explode with vivid flavor -   bursting like fresh, perfectly ripe berries in the mouth and mind.

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to raise $2,500 to thank the poets and artists whose work is included in the anthology and to support the launch of this book internationally. The funds will be used to:

  • provide a contributor’s copy to each poet and artist whose work is included in the anthology ($1,200)
  • support the anthology’s primary launch event, a poetry reading at the Cascadia Poetry Festival in Tacoma WA as well as  develop and support subsequent anthology events, currently scheduled for Bellingham, Washington, and Palo Alto, California, in addition to hoped-for events on the Portland, Oregon,  the US east coast, Canada, and India. (launch events are expected to run $100-$ 200 event for space rental, food and drinks, and sound equipment)
  • token support for the editorial staff and coverage for the cost of managing the project through the SPLAB non-profit org (IRS# 91-1618296)
  • technological support (website development, cover and interior art assistance)

In addition to the joy of supporting terrific art and vibrant poetry, we are offering perks for early donations at different levels including:

  • Copies of 56 Days of August
  • Collections of poetry signed by their authors, including Michael McClure, Brenda Hillman,  Mary Miriam, Sam Hillman, Daniel Ari, and others (see the complete list in the perks sections)
  • Signed copy of George Stanley’s poem “Vancouver”
  • A limited edition poster of the 56 Days artwork, signed by the designer
  • Fiction editing services

And, in gratitude, we will be posting the names of all donors at all donation levels (except those who wish to remain anonymous) on the 56 Days website (www.56daysofaugust.com).

If we don’t reach our goal, your donations will go to covering the cost of contributor’s copies and supporting launch events. The poets and artists generously contributed their works to this anthology – providing contributor’s copies and venues for increasing the visibility of these works is our primary goal as editors.

The Impact

William Carlos Williams once said,

“It is difficult / to get the news from poems /yet men die miserably every day /for lack of what is found there.” (Asphodel, That Greeny Flower)

The combination of universality and specificity of beauty captured in poetry is unique to the poetic form. Poems can encompass a shared experience, an opening of an unexpected doorway into other worlds, a comfort in times of trouble. The poems that are written during the August Postcard Poetry Festival tell the kind of truth that can be communicated directly from one person to another. Help us   share that beauty and those truths of living with people beyond the festival itself.

SPLAB has created successful crowd-sourcing campaigns to install a plaque for Denise Levertov at her Seward Park (Seattle) home and raise money for Wanda Coleman's medical bills in the last months of her life. This campaign is our most precise and detailed campaign yet and our ask is modest. (Levertov plaque: http://splab.org/2016/12/levertov-plaque-unveiled/

Risks & Challenges

There are few risks to supporting projects like this - each dollar you spend goes directly to supporting writers and artists and to promoting the project that contains their work.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Sometimes those of us who love the arts, in any of its forms, aren’t in a position to provide financial help. But there are so many other equally valuable ways you can help us:

  • Please let your poetry and art loving friends know about the 56 Days anthology.
  • And please share the info for this fundraiser with your friends on social media! The indiegogo share tools make it really easy.

With many thanks for your support  

- Ina, Paul, and Judy

(video credits: editing Chris Vaughan, music by N. RoyFaderman

story:
¡Hola! 

Mi nombre es José Luis Miglietti. Soy venezolano. Tengo 26 años de edad y soy aspirante a novelista.

Seré conciso. Tengo incontables años escuchando a gente decirme que estoy loco. Que mi meta es inalcanzable. Que en esta época no hay cabida para los ilusos. Que los sueños mueren junto a nuestra infancia. En fin, ustedes saben de lo que hablo, porque alguien, en un momento, también trató de enterrar sus sueños bajo polvo. Es un patrón común en la sociedad en la que vivimos.

El Fénix de Ardyann desplegó sus alas por un motivo muy simple: yo he decidido no creer en palabras de cínicos. En vez de eso, me he aferrado a la ilusión de quienes creen en mí; personas a quienes resalto como el adalid de mi propia revolución.

A través de este proyecto, simplemente busco mi sitio en este mundo. Mi razón de ser es pasar mi vida brindándoles relatos que les hagan soñar, reír, llorar y cuestionar. Sin embargo, no puedo hacerlo solo. Necesito de su ayuda para lograrlo. Todo esto nace con el Fénix de Ardyann.

El propósito de esta campaña es recaudar los fondos necesarios para financiar los gastos de edición, impresión, distribución y promoción de esta obra literaria en la cual he trabajado durante casi tres años de mi vida. Aurora Libros mostró un apasionado interés por esta historia desde el momento en que les presenté el proyecto, y es gracias a ellos que hoy les traigo una suculenta propuesta a través de la cual me pueden ayudar.

Hemos creado una lista de incentivos para fomentar la recaudación. El plan es simple: yo ofrezco mi obra y una serie de recompensas a precios módicos y, con el dinero recolectado de la venta, nosotros invertimos en el potencial de nuestro trabajo para hacer crecer la obra como marca. La idea es hacer de El Fénix de Ardyann un fenómeno internacional. No nos queremos adelantar a los hechos..., pero tampoco queremos poner techo a nuestra ambición.

Recaudando los 3000 € propuestos como meta, podríamos cubrir los gastos de edición, impresión, distribución y además marcaríamos presencia publicitaria en puntos claves de Madrid, España, que impulsarían la obra a niveles sin precedentes. Con el crecimiento de El Fénix de Ardyann en la capital de España, planificaríamos la expansión en el territorio español, y después, ¿quién sabe? 

Es por todo esto que los necesito en mi equipo para cumplirlo. Me estarían ayudando a cumplir el sueño de toda una vida... así que, de antemano, ¡les ofrezco toda mi gratitud!
story_txt: ¡Hola! Mi nombre es José Luis Miglietti. Soy venezolano. Tengo 26 años de edad y soy aspirante a novelista.Seré conciso. Tengo incontables años escuchando a gente decirme que estoy loco. Que mi meta es inalcanzable. Que en esta época no hay cabida para los ilusos. Que los sueños mueren junto a nuestra infancia. En fin, ustedes saben de lo que hablo, porque alguien, en un momento, también trató de enterrar sus sueños bajo polvo. Es un patrón común en la sociedad en la que vivimos.El Fénix de Ardyann desplegó sus alas por un motivo muy simple: yo he decidido no creer en palabras de cínicos. En vez de eso, me he aferrado a la ilusión de quienes creen en mí; personas a quienes resalto como el adalid de mi propia revolución.A través de este proyecto, simplemente busco mi sitio en este mundo. Mi razón de ser es pasar mi vida brindándoles relatos que les hagan soñar, reír, llorar y cuestionar. Sin embargo, no puedo hacerlo solo. Necesito de su ayuda para lograrlo. Todo esto nace con el Fénix de Ardyann.El propósito de esta campaña es recaudar los fondos necesarios para financiar los gastos de edición, impresión, distribución y promoción de esta obra literaria en la cual he trabajado durante casi tres años de mi vida. Aurora Libros mostró un apasionado interés por esta historia desde el momento en que les presenté el proyecto, y es gracias a ellos que hoy les traigo una suculenta propuesta a través de la cual me pueden ayudar.Hemos creado una lista de incentivos para fomentar la recaudación. El plan es simple: yo ofrezco mi obra y una serie de recompensas a precios módicos y, con el dinero recolectado de la venta, nosotros invertimos en el potencial de nuestro trabajo para hacer crecer la obra como marca. La idea es hacer de El Fénix de Ardyann un fenómeno internacional. No nos queremos adelantar a los hechos..., pero tampoco queremos poner techo a nuestra ambición.Recaudando los 3000 € propuestos como meta, podríamos cubrir los gastos de edición, impresión, distribución y además marcaríamos presencia publicitaria en puntos claves de Madrid, España, que impulsarían la obra a niveles sin precedentes. Con el crecimiento de El Fénix de Ardyann en la capital de España, planificaríamos la expansión en el territorio español, y después, ¿quién sabe? Es por todo esto que los necesito en mi equipo para cumplirlo. Me estarían ayudando a cumplir el sueño de toda una vida... así que, de antemano, ¡les ofrezco toda mi gratitud!

story:
Love Poetry Project

BACKGROUND:

The Love Poetry Project was born out of a perceived need for greater empathy, love, compassion, and understanding in this world, during our time of great upheaval, war, social division, and xenophobia during the election season of 2016, and resurgence of fear-based politics in America, and elsewhere. It aims to remind people of some of our common experiences, involving love, that great glue of the universe, in the face of the many people who feel isolated and lonely.

This book of poetry on love began as a relatively modest exposition of about 10 local artists and friends of mine, in upstate New York. I have perceived for some years that poetry has a mysterious power to draw honesty from deep within folks, allowing them to say things they wouldn't normally speak aloud. This book is, at its core, poems about love, in all its various forms. It has continually grown since that modest inkling of a vision, into a burgeoning community of authors from around the world sharing their stories of love, and making connections through understanding.

As word spread, friends came to me and share excited stories about their writing; one friend searched all her journals and past poetry but could not find a single entry about love itself. She was so happy to be meditating deeply about love for the first time; success! Other friends were reaching so deeply within themselves, revealing such delicate and personal aspects, that they preferred to write under a pen name; success! Another friend told me repeatedly that he could not write poetry, and did not even know what love was. He wrote a poem about struggling to know what love is; success! One poem, by my dear friend Alex Kochkin, is published posthumously, having also been published posthumously by his mother Anna Kochkin. I perceive that this project, and exuberant expressions of love in all forms, embodies an energy which can heal the soul and sooth the mind. The reader's understanding and empathy provides healing in itself.

Please join our conversation. The love poetry project provides a venue for artists through our anthologies. To find out how to contribute your love poetry, please visit www.LovePoetryProject.com

ABOUT THE AUTHOR:

Christopher is working to complete a Ph.D. in philosophy and clinical ethics, at SUNY Albany, New York. He currently studies clinical ethics, with a focus on empathy and compassion from doctors to patients and families. Through his studies, he has gained an ever greater appreciation for the importance of compassion, empathy, and understanding of the importance of actively maintaining vibrant relationships through gentle love.

Christopher is also author of Peace Poems of the Soul: Meditations on Buddha. Please share my campaign on your Facebook, Twitter and other social media, thank you!

with love

Christopher

story:
Short Summary

"I have a faint memory of swallows from my childhood in Iran. I remember laying under the sun at my paternal grandparent’s terrace and imagining shapes out of the clouds when I saw a quick black bird with a strange tail decent in the sky. I asked my mother if the blackbird was also a pigeon because many of them coo coo-ed in my grandmothers’ trees."

Immigrant is a book about change and adaptation which explores the personal and professional identities of a 30-year-old immigrant woman.

My name is Golara Haghtalab and I am the author of Immigrant. I wrote this book because I believe everyone can learn something about accepting what is, letting go of what is not working, and starting anew from immigrants.

I hope that, in reading this book, you will discover the resiliency of a thirty-year-old immigrant woman and her journey to self-realization in a new country. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement I have for immigrants and the lessons of enduring change and achieving adaptation. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you unlock your superpowers when faced with a new situation that is unknown to you.

I decided to write this book with hopes of helping other people, especially immigrants, keep track of their thoughts and relearn the lessons of the past as they walk through their journeys. On my journey as an immigrant, I have noticed the lessons on the road aren’t always clear. The realization only came to me recently as I started regularly meditating. While meditating, I investigated some of my memories and linked them to my behaviors today. Because of this realization, I can now try to relearn lessons of the past for myself and capture the process in this book to share it with others.

Investigating the past includes reflecting on my memories from before my immigration and comparing them with my life today. I call my approach “weaving the old world into the new world.”

You might already know that the United States has a larger immigrant population than any other country, with 45 million immigrants as of 2018. This represents 16.5 percent of about 272 million international migrants globally in 2019, equating to about four percent of the global population. These numbers do not consider the estimated 740 million internal migrants in 2009 (UN, World Migration Report 2020).

You will love this book if you are:

  • Keen in understanding diverse experiences
  • Interested in self/career development
  • An immigrant yourself or are interested in learning about some aspects of the immigrant journey
  • Curious about the origin of your thoughts and triggers
  • Fan of stories that contain real-life experiences with a philosophical and psychological spin to them

 

Immigrant communities are just like a coral reef, diverse, rich, and the value of their diversity in many ways is unknown. Similar to the bleached coral reefs, the diversity that comes into this country will eventually blend in and become one with the culture of their host society. Unpreserved and undocumented, this richness can be erased before it is acknowledged. The purpose of this book is to get a hold of the wealth that comes in with immigrants before it is too late.

 

The Book - Immigrant
Immigrant is written in three parts.

Part 1: Immigration contains the introduction and chapters [1 - 4]. These initial stories mainly focus on the unclear state of mind we experience after going through a major change in our lives. The main character feels as if she has been dropped into the unknown and asks the question, “where am I?”


Part 2: Acculturation contains chapters [5 - 10]. These stories are mostly about adjusting to the new change. The main character feels the need to feel, act, and think similar to most Americans and attempts to forget about her past.

Part 3: Integration contains chapters [11 - 16]. The focus of these last few chapters is on finding a balance and looking ahead. The main character finally cracks the code to be her authentic self and appreciate her multicultural and multilingual identity in America.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. We set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2020.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer

 

The Impact

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Golara Haghtalab is a technology strategy consultant at Accenture. She finds her day-to-day job exciting because it allows her to impact leaders on strategy and modernization efforts in organizations while helping them leverage their unique superpowers at work.


Following the recent social justice movements in the U.S., Golara decided that all people must hear immigrant voices. Her decision made it necessary for her book Immigrant: Turning 30 in America to be published this year.

Golara Haghtalab is a curious and free-spirited individual. She is fascinated by people, different cultures, and the ways organizations operate. In her life and between her many adventures, there is no time for a dull moment. In addition to her career and authoring her first book, Golara is currently working on her M.S. in Organization Development degree at the American University. The MSOD program has taught her many ways to find and connect with her authentic self. 

For more information, you can connect with Golara Haghtalab at golara.hagh@gmail.com, LinkedIn, and @g_o_l_a_r_a on Instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #IMMIGRANT30 and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Golara Haghtalab

story:
Story of My Book

This book tells the story of how families have lived and learned to take control of their lives and provide for themselves and future generations using tools once reserved for the wealthy. I wrote this book as a way to help more families create or transform their nonexistent, simple, or incomplete estate plans to help protect their health, wealth, and happiness. My book will publish in July, 2020.

Over 100 books pre-ordered, less than 70 to go to publish in audiobook and hardcover!

Trustworthy: The Evolution and Enlightenment of Modern Estate Estate Planning for Family Health, Wealth, Happiness and Love

My name is Tara Wilson and I am the author of Trustworthy. I wrote this book because far too many Americans never put an estate plan in place simply because it seems confusing, overwhelming, and expensive.  It is also an emotional process. This book demystifies and simplifies estate planning to show why every American family is worthy of a trust.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that estate planning is not about death; it is about taking control of your life for the benefit of you, your family, and generations to come. Just like the entrepreneurial revolution has hit America, an estate planning enlightenment has swept throughout the country over the past twenty years, but it has not reached a tipping point where it is accessible or even understood by everyone, yet.

In this book, I hope to instill the same passion and excitement in you that I have for protecting families and their assets. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you take control of your life, your assets, and your legacy to help protect and provide for you and your family. My goal is to simplify the process and excite everyone to join this movement to help themselves and their families. This book simplifies the estate planning process to make it more understandable and economical so that everyone can take control of their lives, their assets and their legacy in an unprecedented fashion.

In this book, you'll learn about the best methods to take care of yourself and your family with estate planning, and more specifically, revocable living trusts:

  • Brynn experienced the loss of her mother and then her inheritance, most notably a home that had been in her family for generations, because her mother’s estate plan was not well thought out and discussed.
  • An original de Kooning painting worth $160 million was sold to a thrift store with a truckload full of other household belongings for $2,000 by a family member who wasn’t told there was anything valuable in the home.
  • A woman who failed to document her wishes in an estate plan lived in a brain-dead state for 15 years while her husband and parents went to war in the courts, legislatures, and public arena to determine what she would’ve wanted.
  • A family who had the forethought to organize their paperwork and establish trusts was able to privately protect themselves and three generations to come.

You will love this book if you want to learn what wealthy families have done for over a century to perpetuate their wealth.  This will teach you how to organize your life, protect yourself, your family and your assets, minimize the time, fees, hassles, and emotional issues during some of life’s inevitable events, and establish a legacy that will live on.

Trustworthy: The Evolution and Enlightenment of Modern Estate Planning for Family Health, Wealth, Happiness and Love is a non-fiction book that speaks to all Americans.  This will help shed traditional beliefs and teach everyone how to implement their estate planning and, more specifically, trusts, for the first time.

There are 5 parts to the book:

Part I contains the Introduction and Chapters 1-3. The Introduction gives an overview of how this topic impacts families.  It helps individuals to shift to a positive mindset, one that revolves around life, personal control, and peace of mind.  

Part II. Evolution contains Chapters 4-6. In this part, you will see the beginning of the evolution of estate planning from a point of procrastination and lack of knowledge in one generation and its impact on the next generation. These chapters focus on Brynn Robertson and her journey into adulthood, facing some of life’s most joyful moments and the depths of despair.

Part III. Enlightenment contains Chapters 7-10. In these chapters, Brynn’s story continues with her enlightenment from the lessons learned from her mother’s estate planning. Determined to do things differently, she takes control of her life and proactively plans for the expected and unexpected. This planning helps her get over her heartache and trust again, in large part because she shields herself from experiencing the financial ruin she previously faced.

Part IV. Keys to Happiness contains Chapters 11-13. These chapters focus on love, health and wealth. Chapter 11 focuses on love; your relationships with family and friends; caring for others and allowing them to care for you in time of need. Chapter 12 focuses on your financial wealth, both tangible and intangible. Chapter 13 shifts focus to your health and how some well-thought out decisions can help you and your family when you cannot speak for yourself, learning a valuable lesson from the story of Terri Schiavo.

Part V. Living Trustworthy contains Chapters 14-17. These chapters will guide you to form the foundation of your estate plan. Chapter 14 details the story of my estate plan evolution, one that you can replicate with a bit of legwork. Chapter 15 focuses on the legal foundation, the revocable living trust, that safeguards your assets and elaborates on the guidelines for you and future generations.  It teaches you how to not make the same mistakes as one of America’s richest families, the Vanderbilts. Chapter 16 leads back to your assets and some more legwork, this time organizing and aligning those assets with your new revocable living trust. Chapter 17 takes your estate planning to the next level by leaving a legacy.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Summer
  • When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. ($4000 goal met - Thank You!)
  • When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. (Working on $6000 Goal Now!)
  • When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some EXCLUSIVE REWARDS FOR PEOPLE WHO PRE-ORDER my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • Invitation to launch party
  • Invitation to book speaking engagements where I will share experience of writing my book and teaching how to create your family trust including setting up special gatherings for you and a group of family and friends
  • Superfans will be entitled to one-on-one counseling on how to best protect your family & assets

About the Author

Tara Wilson is an estate planning attorney with almost two decades of experience, practicing in some of the top law firms in the United States.  Her resume includes Morgan Lewis & Bockius, LLP, Skadden Arps Slate Meagher and Flom, LLP, Howrey, LLP, as well as a boutique trusts and estates firm. In addition, she is a Lecturer of Law in Boston University Law School’s Graduate Tax Program, teaching Advanced Estate Planning to Juris Doctor and Master of Laws students. Tara graduated with her Masters of Law in Taxation and a Certificate in Estate Planning from Georgetown University School of Law, a Juris Doctor from George Washington University Law School, and a Bachelors of Art from American University in Washington, DC.

Tara has built her practice by taking a holistic approach to develop a customized and comprehensive solution to meet each client’s unique estate planning goals. This includes foundational trust planning and funding, as well as gifting and estate-freezing techniques, such as grantor retained annuity trusts, qualified personal residence trusts, and intentionally defective grantor trusts. Upon an incapacity or death, Tara counsels family members and fiduciaries in probate and trust administrations, including the preparation and submission of probate court cases and estate tax returns.

Most importantly, Tara is a mom to two amazing children, Colby and Kaylin. It was while she was on maternity leave with her son, Colby, that prompted her to revamp her own estate plan so that any member of her family could easily understand what they needed to do.  She created a novel more comprehensive estate planning manual to align her life with her estate plan and organize her life so that it serves as a set of instructions for everyone she named to help her family in her absence.  It will also minimize the expense and headache if anything were to happen to her.  Over the ensuing years, it served as the model for the custom estate planning manuals she creates for all her clients.

For more information you can connect with Tara at tkw30@georgetown.edu and
https://www.linkedin.com/in/tarakwilson/
https://www.facebook.com/tara.wilson.524

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to pre-order the book? You can still help!

Thank you for all your support!

All the best,

Tara Wilson

story_txt:
Story of My Book
This book tells the story of how families have lived and learned to take control of their lives and provide for themselves and future generations using tools once reserved for the wealthy. I wrote this book as a way to help more families create or transform their nonexistent, simple, or incomplete estate plans to help protect their health, wealth, and happiness. My book will publish in July, 2020.
Over 100 books pre-ordered, less than 70 to go to publish in audiobook and hardcover!
Trustworthy: The Evolution and Enlightenment of Modern Estate Estate Planning for Family Health, Wealth, Happiness and LoveMy name is Tara Wilson and I am the author of Trustworthy. I wrote this book because far too many Americans never put an estate plan in place simply because it seems confusing, overwhelming, and expensive.  It is also an emotional process. This book demystifies and simplifies estate planning to show why every American family is worthy of a trust.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that estate planning is not about death; it is about taking control of your life for the benefit of you, your family, and generations to come. Just like the entrepreneurial revolution has hit America, an estate planning enlightenment has swept throughout the country over the past twenty years, but it has not reached a tipping point where it is accessible or even understood by everyone, yet.In this book, I hope to instill the same passion and excitement in you that I have for protecting families and their assets. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you take control of your life, your assets, and your legacy to help protect and provide for you and your family. My goal is to simplify the process and excite everyone to join this movement to help themselves and their families. This book simplifies the estate planning process to make it more understandable and economical so that everyone can take control of their lives, their assets and their legacy in an unprecedented fashion.In this book, you'll learn about the best methods to take care of yourself and your family with estate planning, and more specifically, revocable living trusts:

Brynn experienced the loss of her mother and then her inheritance, most notably a home that had been in her family for generations, because her mother’s estate plan was not well thought out and discussed.
An original de Kooning painting worth $160 million was sold to a thrift store with a truckload full of other household belongings for $2,000 by a family member who wasn’t told there was anything valuable in the home.
A woman who failed to document her wishes in an estate plan lived in a brain-dead state for 15 years while her husband and parents went to war in the courts, legislatures, and public arena to determine what she would’ve wanted.
A family who had the forethought to organize their paperwork and establish trusts was able to privately protect themselves and three generations to come.

You will love this book if you want to learn what wealthy families have done for over a century to perpetuate their wealth.  This will teach you how to organize your life, protect yourself, your family and your assets, minimize the time, fees, hassles, and emotional issues during some of life’s inevitable events, and establish a legacy that will live on.Trustworthy: The Evolution and Enlightenment of Modern Estate Planning for Family Health, Wealth, Happiness and Love is a non-fiction book that speaks to all Americans.  This will help shed traditional beliefs and teach everyone how to implement their estate planning and, more specifically, trusts, for the first time.
There are 5 parts to the book:
Part I contains the Introduction and Chapters 1-3. The Introduction gives an overview of how this topic impacts families.  It helps individuals to shift to a positive mindset, one that revolves around life, personal control, and peace of mind.  Part II. Evolution contains Chapters 4-6. In this part, you will see the beginning of the evolution of estate planning from a point of procrastination and lack of knowledge in one generation and its impact on the next generation. These chapters focus on Brynn Robertson and her journey into adulthood, facing some of life’s most joyful moments and the depths of despair.Part III. Enlightenment contains Chapters 7-10. In these chapters, Brynn’s story continues with her enlightenment from the lessons learned from her mother’s estate planning. Determined to do things differently, she takes control of her life and proactively plans for the expected and unexpected. This planning helps her get over her heartache and trust again, in large part because she shields herself from experiencing the financial ruin she previously faced.Part IV. Keys to Happiness contains Chapters 11-13. These chapters focus on love, health and wealth. Chapter 11 focuses on love; your relationships with family and friends; caring for others and allowing them to care for you in time of need. Chapter 12 focuses on your financial wealth, both tangible and intangible. Chapter 13 shifts focus to your health and how some well-thought out decisions can help you and your family when you cannot speak for yourself, learning a valuable lesson from the story of Terri Schiavo.Part V. Living Trustworthy contains Chapters 14-17. These chapters will guide you to form the foundation of your estate plan. Chapter 14 details the story of my estate plan evolution, one that you can replicate with a bit of legwork. Chapter 15 focuses on the legal foundation, the revocable living trust, that safeguards your assets and elaborates on the guidelines for you and future generations.  It teaches you how to not make the same mistakes as one of America’s richest families, the Vanderbilts. Chapter 16 leads back to your assets and some more legwork, this time organizing and aligning those assets with your new revocable living trust. Chapter 17 takes your estate planning to the next level by leaving a legacy. 

What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020.
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. ($4000 goal met - Thank You!)
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. (Working on $6000 Goal Now!)
When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some EXCLUSIVE REWARDS FOR PEOPLE WHO PRE-ORDER my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover


Invitation to launch party

Invitation to book speaking engagements where I will share experience of writing my book and teaching how to create your family trust including setting up special gatherings for you and a group of family and friends

Superfans will be entitled to one-on-one counseling on how to best protect your family & assets


About the Author
Tara Wilson is an estate planning attorney with almost two decades of experience, practicing in some of the top law firms in the United States.  Her resume includes Morgan Lewis & Bockius, LLP, Skadden Arps Slate Meagher and Flom, LLP, Howrey, LLP, as well as a boutique trusts and estates firm. In addition, she is a Lecturer of Law in Boston University Law School’s Graduate Tax Program, teaching Advanced Estate Planning to Juris Doctor and Master of Laws students. Tara graduated with her Masters of Law in Taxation and a Certificate in Estate Planning from Georgetown University School of Law, a Juris Doctor from George Washington University Law School, and a Bachelors of Art from American University in Washington, DC.Tara has built her practice by taking a holistic approach to develop a customized and comprehensive solution to meet each client’s unique estate planning goals. This includes foundational trust planning and funding, as well as gifting and estate-freezing techniques, such as grantor retained annuity trusts, qualified personal residence trusts, and intentionally defective grantor trusts. Upon an incapacity or death, Tara counsels family members and fiduciaries in probate and trust administrations, including the preparation and submission of probate court cases and estate tax returns.Most importantly, Tara is a mom to two amazing children, Colby and Kaylin. It was while she was on maternity leave with her son, Colby, that prompted her to revamp her own estate plan so that any member of her family could easily understand what they needed to do.  She created a novel more comprehensive estate planning manual to align her life with her estate plan and organize her life so that it serves as a set of instructions for everyone she named to help her family in her absence.  It will also minimize the expense and headache if anything were to happen to her.  Over the ensuing years, it served as the model for the custom estate planning manuals she creates for all her clients.For more information you can connect with Tara at tkw30@georgetown.edu andhttps://www.linkedin.com/in/tarakwilson/https://www.facebook.com/tara.wilson.524

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
Other Ways You Can Help
Unable to pre-order the book? You can still help!
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #LivingTrustworthy and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
Share this Pre-Sale Campaign Page as well with anyone who you think might be interested in the topic.
Send a text message or direct message on social media about the book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. 
Thank you for all your support!
All the best,
Tara Wilson

THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH for helping reach my 100 pre-ordered books campaign goal!  I am excited to share that after speaking with my publisher (New Degree Press), we believe the momentum of this campaign could allow me to also produce my audiobook and hardcover.
I need to sell 50 more more to create my audiobook ($6000 total raise) and another 50 to create my hardcover ($8000 total raise) in order to make this next step possible.
If we reach my 150 pre-ordered books goal, all backers will receive a FREE copy of my audiobook!
