story:
Story of My Book

The Brain Hut explores the intersections of intentionality and proactivity.

My name is Nick D’Souza and I am the author of The Brain Hut. I wrote this book because I want to express the importance of intentionality in the scope of our private and social life, technology use, and goal-related actions. I decided to write this book, because I want to give insights into how we can harness our brain, and past experiences to improve our internal growth. What makes my perspective different in my book, is that I am able to provide a framework to help you better understand how to implement 6 principles into our daily lifestyle! Such examples involve technology and our social interactions.

This book also explores the intersections of intentionality with imagination, self-care, self-control, fear, as well as time management, and habits. My goal is to explain how they interconnect, and can be exercised into a proactive lifestyle.

This book includes stories, from some of the world’s most successful people such as

  • Canadian psychologist Jordan Peterson (author of The 12 Rules for Life)
  • Motivational speaker Mel Robbins (author of 5 Second Rule)
  • Retired Navy Seal David Goggins

 

My hope for this book is that readers will get a new perspective from my framework to have a better understanding of how to organize their ideas and actions and how to make the necessary adjustments to improve on certain bad habits.

You will enjoy this book if you are a motivated individual searching for a calling or a direction in your life, and also have a relevant background of the neuroscience of our brains. The interesting details I share are real life examples of motivational experiences within The Brain Hut framework. It will give a new perspective and some insights on how you, personally, can illustrate your own Brain Hut map, laying a ground work to good habits and time management.

 

The Book - The Brain Hut

The book is written in 3 Parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + insights on a common flaw in a real world mentality. I will elaborate on the importance of proactivity and intentionality.

Part 2 contains Chapters 3-8. They introduce the 6 principles with a general background on their neuroscience and importance towards proactivity and intentionality. I have referenced some insights from notable psychologists and experiments to back up my content.

Part 3 contains Chapters 9-14. Chapter 1 introduces the Brain Hut and the significance of the mental “rooms” I created to help the reader understand the different mindsets we have on a daily basis. Chapter 2-5 reintroduces the 6 principles from Part 2 and separates them into the context of silence, social life, technology, and goal-related actions. Chapter 6 introduces the 7 deadly sins and the 3 H’s: Heart, Humility, and Humor.
 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Nick D’Souza is currently an Accounts Receivable Specialist at Materne North America. He was a four year Division I swimmer at Fordham University and graduated with a B.A. in Economics in 2017.

I wrote this book because I have a big passion for how the brain works and have established a framework for a new perspective. I want to help people realize that every single human being has the potential to be great and is filled with a purpose on this planet. I believe that regardless of how successful someone is, his or her character is what matters most. Principles are important to be cognizant of and that is what the Brain Hut entails.

In my spare time, I enjoy watching professional sports, researching investment articles, and socializing with friends. My long term goal is to be a philanthropist and help those around the world in need.

For more information you can connect with Nick at:
   Email: nickdsouza1@hotmail.com
   Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/nick.dsouza.127201/
   Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicholas-d-souza-b3...
   Instagram: lilnick_swimming
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheBrainHut and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Nick D’Souza

story:
Story of My Book

Askholes: How to give first and network later to build valuable relationships.

My name is Kasra Khalili and I am the author of Askholes. I wrote this book because in my journey as an entrepreneur I’ve learned the hard way that networking is broken. I went on a journey that’s led me to launch a startup, run an event series, and a build a community from scratch.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that giving can be your key to meet anyone. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for giving first and building relationships in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you stop networking and start connecting with people in a whole new way.

In this book, you'll learn about give-first networking and harnessing your community:

  • Understanding the intention behind every interaction you may have
  • Identifying your value-add and how it can be delivered to everyone you meet
  • Applying a give first approach in your interactions
  • Learning from others is a gift, not a weakness, and the art of asking for help
  • Building sustainable connections on trust resulting in lifelong relationships

You will love this book if you love connecting with others and learning from the stories of entrepreneurs.

Askholes is a non-fiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs and leaders who are looking at growing their network in an authentic way and building a community of support around themselves.

 

The Book - Askholes

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. This section covers the history of networking, the types of networks around us, and where we go today to build those connections. We’ll dive into the pros and cons of our current networks, as well as, the story of LinkedIn’s rise on the scene and how their early team sought to redefine professional connections.

Part 2 contains Chapters 7-10. Give first is at the heart of how we’re changing our approach to building connections, and ultimately valuable relationships. I share the story of Alexis Ohanian, co-founder of Reddit, and where giving immense value to both his team and users that launched a network effect of the ages.

Part 3 contains Chapters 11-14. Finally, we go deeper into how we as entrepreneurs, community builders, leaders, and individuals from all walks of life can redefine our own value, package it into our personal brand, and connect like never before. We see how Elon Musk uses tactics of giving to meet who he needs to launch his empire.

Each part dives into the stories and research I've conducted to share real life examples of how they are used. Connection is now a tool available to all us, regardless of experience or status.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Fall

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Kasra is the CEO & Co-founder of Mintor, an exclusive networking app for entrepreneurs to connect and meet. He is also the Chapter Director of Startup Grind in Baton Rouge where he holds monthly fireside chats with successful founders to share their stories of triumph, failure, and struggle with his community. His passion lies in building trust and connection among entrepreneurs. From showcasing the success of local founders to volunteering as a mentor to help young entrepreneurs, you can count on him to be a voice for others.

Kasra wrote this book to dive deeper into the technique of give-first networking and how we can build more authentic, purpose-driven, connections in this digital age. He sought to analyze the history of networking, what characteristics are found in strong relationships, and how our social networks have impacted our connections.

Kasra considers himself a “learn-it-all” and happily admits what he doesn’t know. Be careful about getting into deep conversations around AI, psychology, politics, or space travel with him - it might cost you the afternoon! If he’s not working, you’ll find him on a tennis court, in the gym (well maybe not now), or having a beer with friends (virtually that is).

For more information you can connect with Kasra at khaliliauthor@gmail.com and Twitter or LinkedIn

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #askholesbook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

All the best,
Kasra Khalili

And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you stop networking and start connecting with people in a whole new way.In this book, you'll learn about give-first networking and harnessing your community:

Understanding the intention behind every interaction you may have
Identifying your value-add and how it can be delivered to everyone you meet
Applying a give first approach in your interactions
Learning from others is a gift, not a weakness, and the art of asking for help
Building sustainable connections on trust resulting in lifelong relationships

You will love this book if you love connecting with others and learning from the stories of entrepreneurs.Askholes is a non-fiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs and leaders who are looking at growing their network in an authentic way and building a community of support around themselves.
 
The Book - AskholesThe book is written in 3 Parts....Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. This section covers the history of networking, the types of networks around us, and where we go today to build those connections. We’ll dive into the pros and cons of our current networks, as well as, the story of LinkedIn’s rise on the scene and how their early team sought to redefine professional connections.Part 2 contains Chapters 7-10. Give first is at the heart of how we’re changing our approach to building connections, and ultimately valuable relationships. I share the story of Alexis Ohanian, co-founder of Reddit, and where giving immense value to both his team and users that launched a network effect of the ages.Part 3 contains Chapters 11-14. Finally, we go deeper into how we as entrepreneurs, community builders, leaders, and individuals from all walks of life can redefine our own value, package it into our personal brand, and connect like never before. We see how Elon Musk uses tactics of giving to meet who he needs to launch his empire.Each part dives into the stories and research I've conducted to share real life examples of how they are used. Connection is now a tool available to all us, regardless of experience or status. 
What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: 
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Fall

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

 
About the Author
Kasra is the CEO & Co-founder of Mintor, an exclusive networking app for entrepreneurs to connect and meet. He is also the Chapter Director of Startup Grind in Baton Rouge where he holds monthly fireside chats with successful founders to share their stories of triumph, failure, and struggle with his community. His passion lies in building trust and connection among entrepreneurs. From showcasing the success of local founders to volunteering as a mentor to help young entrepreneurs, you can count on him to be a voice for others.Kasra wrote this book to dive deeper into the technique of give-first networking and how we can build more authentic, purpose-driven, connections in this digital age. He sought to analyze the history of networking, what characteristics are found in strong relationships, and how our social networks have impacted our connections.Kasra considers himself a “learn-it-all” and happily admits what he doesn’t know. Be careful about getting into deep conversations around AI, psychology, politics, or space travel with him - it might cost you the afternoon! If he’s not working, you’ll find him on a tennis court, in the gym (well maybe not now), or having a beer with friends (virtually that is).For more information you can connect with Kasra at khaliliauthor@gmail.com and Twitter or LinkedIn
 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #askholesbook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!All the best,Kasra Khalili

story:
My name is Sean Keefer and I write books – legal thrillers set in Charleston, South Carolina. My first book was published in 2011 and the second, The Solicitor, will be published in 2017. 

This campaign isn’t about hoping enough funding will be raised to allow for publication, rather it is about giving readers and supporters pre-release access to The Solicitor and special perks available only here.  Supporters will have the opportunity to not only have first access to the book on the day of release, the campaign is designed to allow readers to even obtain the book early.  It is about providing special incentives to readers that are not available anywhere but through this campaign. I also predict that during the campaign there will be special perks that pop up.

I’m fortunate in that I have no challenges or hurdles  to overcome to bring the book to print as publication will occur in 2017.  Rather, I’m hoping that with your help I can maximize the number of readers of The Solicitor.  I'd be honored if you would help spread the word about my campaign and share it as often as you like.  

Feel free to share the campaign and contact me with any questions.  Follow me on any of my social media platforms and I always love feedback.  Following the release I'll be traveling around talking about The Solicitor and I'll hope to see you then!

Thanks to everyone who has contributed your support is humbling.  Also, please feel free to share the campaign and also to leave a comment.  It would be much appreciated!

Thanks in advance for your support.

story:
This book provides “leaders” and really everyone, with practical tools for creating flow and avoiding burnout. I wrote it because as a consultant I saw the same pattern repeat over and over. The corporate world is desperate for brave, diverse, amazing creative thinkers but can't seem to help crushing them.

This is how we can do better. My book will publish in April 2020.

Story of My Book

My name is Heather C. Ingram and I am the author of Applied Flow: Practical Tools for Doing Your Best Work, Creating Flow and Preventing Burnout. I wrote this book, after working in data and innovation consulting. The future is here - we have AI, machine learning and robots to do work. We can create robots to act like robot, we need humans to act like humans.

We need to stop burning and churning through our best and brightest. It's stupid; petty and de-humanizing.

So I dug into the research and created some easy, accessible tools both for leaders, individual contributors, and everyone in between. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what gives you flow energy, learn how to maintain the boundaries that help you channel that flow, and increase your impact. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for being productive and adding value. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you learn to

  • use your feelings as data and align with your goals
  • use the flow checklist to take action to get you back into the flow,
  • finally understand understand how the oppositional nature of the creative brain may be hold you make -- and how mindful awareness can help you skip the catch-22, double BS that traps way too many. 

In this book, you'll learn:

You are not alone. A lot of amazing folks from Larry Page to Sallie Krawcheck have been caught in the bizarro land of double binds and Catch-22s. While being in this situation feels shitty - you’ll learn to recognize these situations and access mindful self-awareness tools to “Keep Calm and Prove the Irrelevance of Hierarchy.”

You'll learn how to defend your boundaries and “flow channel.”  Learn how to play the game right and how to get out of bizarro recursive mind traps (both your own and others). Stoping playing life on the default settings. Understand and own your truth. Own your duality and muchness, Be intimidating and humble. Awe-inspiring and curious. Overwhelming and enough. Fierce and kind. Critical and caring. This, dear hearts, is the secret of buoyancy and power. The tension between these seeming paradoxes is what creates energy. 

You will love this book if you are both creative and analytical, fierce and kind, brave and vulnerable, curious and knowledgeable, a lone wolf and pack wolf.

The Book - Applied Flow: Practical Tools for Doing Your Best Work, Creating Flow and Preventing Burnout

The book is written in 4 Parts

  • Part One - Flow Awareness - In this section, you’ll learn contemplative tools and meditations. 
  • Part Two - Flow Mind - Mihaly C.‘s initial research provides a clear map of the emotional state - when we are out of Flow. High EQ individuals can use that awareness to gain insight from their system about potential risks and stressors and take action to manage themselves and their teams.
  • Part Three - Flow Checklist - Learn the Flow Principles and how to apply them. 
  • Part Four - Flow Integrity - This last section is for creative weirdos, badasses, and rule breakers - to understand the neuroscience of how you are wired, what motivates you, why you threaten people and how to use your new mind magic to get what you want. 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise my manuscript by the end of January 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish (OMG! OMG! OMG!) this April 2020

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish! When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. When I publish you will receive:

A personally signed copy of my book

  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book group where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • There will also be digital meditations and content you can download both as part of the book.

Early supporters will also have the opportunity to request special meditations and mantras created for their unique challenges.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

About the Author

Heather Ingram is a recovering corporate data, organization and innovation consultant for Fortune 500 companies. Her current work focuses on helping leaders and individuals do their best work by accessing their unique flow - using psychology, economic decision-making and mindful practices.


Frustrated off by the burn and churn approach to management — she wrote this book for over-achieving nerds-- er that is to so other "first generation to the corporate world" folks to counteract mindless managers and help them prevent burn-out. It’s a practical guide to help people define boundaries and to help them focus on doing the work and avoid having their souls sucked by the corporate machinery.

When she’s not teaching people how to mediate or why hierarchy irrelevant, she’s hanging out with her dog, hiking, watching Netflix - and definitely not yoga-ing as much as she should ;) 

For more information, you can connect with her on Linkedin.com/in/heathercingram

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AFthebook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Heather Ingram

story:
Short Summary

My name is Scott Vaughan. Since seventh grade, I have been paid to write. I walked into my hometown newspaper office and was paid $1.50 for a report on my scout troop’s weekend camping trip. I am an award-winning former newspaper publisher and editor, communication strategist, and award-winning independent author. I lend my talents to families, helping with obituary notices and eulogies, and I help speakers with speeches and presentations. I still write love letters to my wife of 34 years.

I am a native of metro Atlanta (Cumming, GA), and a 1981 graduate of the University of Georgia. My family relocated to Lexington, SC (near Columbia) in 1991. Our four sons were raised in Lexington. Learn more about me at scottdvaughan.com.

I love baseball.

Here's the thing. I only played for three years, between the ages of 8-10. I was terrible. Despite being a terrible player, I loved the game. My first newspaper job, while in high school, was as a sports writer. I eventually moved into news reporting, but always kept a hand in sports writing.

I was the last person Terry Thompson should have asked to be a volunteer baseball coach back in 1982.  I will forever be thankful that he did. Over the next 30 years, coaching in three communities, my teams won 70 percent of the time. Looking back, I do wonder, "How in the world did that happen? To me?" 

My new book, NINE INNINGS, was actually the first book I started writing. The idea came out of my love for baseball, the fun I had while coaching boys ages 9-12, and the lessons I learned about life. I paused NINE INNINGS, in 2014, to write what became Brookwood Road, and then three other books followed. In 2020, it became time to reach back and finish NINE INNINGS. Here's a summary.

A Summary of Nine Innings
There’s a melancholy that’s settled on Frank Wilcox as he enters the Empty Nest chapter of his life. His four sons are grown and gone, and with them went a 30-year span of coaching boy’s baseball in three different communities across the South. Life is suddenly quiet, and the quiet is maddening. As baseball season begins, Frank has an idea – he will travel to Turner Field in Atlanta and attend a Braves game all by himself. It’s during that game that Frank is reminded of the memories: a miraculous comeback, an answered prayer, a friendly mortician, a fox in the outfield, a search for new catcher’s equipment, four-piece chicken baskets, and draft strategy. Frank remembers hundreds of players with nicknames like Spongebob, Big G, Killer, E-Mar, Jet, Snooky, Hoss, Ace, Big A, Sugarman, and Vegas. The Braves game becomes a time of healing for Frank, and his return to Concord launches a new chapter in this life. 

This IndieGogo campaign is to raise $5,000 to fund NINE INNINGS' publication. Funds will pay for professional services, including cover design, editing and proofreading, interior formatting for print and Kindle editions, and advertising availability of the book. My desire in publishing is to present high-quality, bookstore-quality books that are well-written, well-edited and thoughtfully marketed. Though independently published, I like to envision my books in bookstores maintaining the same quality as corporately published books. I personally funded my first four books, and this campaign allows for partnerships in publishing the fifth book.

I believe my novels can be read for pure enjoyment and fun. Still, I also believe there’s a greater message within them, whether it’s the importance of faith, family, friends, the mystery of romance, or the value of service and community. I hope readers have fun with my stories but are also moved in some measurable way to appreciate the past and present and look toward the future. Contributors to this campaign will help achieve this goal.

What I Need & What You Get

The book is written.
To offset publishing costs, I am looking to raise $5,000 to pay for the following professional services.

Cover Design ($300.00)
I contract with Graham Publishing Company, of Denver, CO, to help with cover design. This includes front, back, and spinal design and adjusting the cover to fit around the final book size before publishing. My goal is to have a cover that is bookstore-quality. Utilizing a publishing company ensures great graphic design and graphic design that is on point with publishing. I do not have a personal relationship with Graham Publishing Company, its partners, or employees, ensuring arms-length service not clouded by relationship.

Formal Edit & Proofreading ($2,000.00)
I contract with Stacey Lenn of Birmingham, AL as my formal editor and proofreader. The formal edit is a line-by-line edit for grammar, spelling, factual consistency, and clarity. I am provided with the ability to accept, reject, or rewrite around each editing suggestion. Just before publishing, Stacey provides a final proofread. I do not have a personal relationship with Stacey Lenn, her associates, or employees, ensuring arms-length service not clouded by relationship.

Formatting ($1,200.00)
I contract with Graham Publishing Company, of Denver, CO, for the formatting of my books. Formatting includes the pre-press setup for the print edition as well as the Kindle edition. This service also includes uploading both editions to the appropriate amazon.com servers. I do not have a personal relationship with Graham Publishing Company, its partners, or employees, ensuring arms-length service not clouded by relationship.

Advertising ($1,500.00)
I contract with Ben Sauls Productions to produce a book trailer that can be used in promotion. Funds will also be used for social media advertising to help with circulation.

At varying levels, contributors to my campaign will have access to the following perks:

  • Books at my cost. Shipping is included.
  • Autographed books with personalization to individuals. Shipping is included.
  • Invitation to an online book club meeting, where I will read some of NINE INNINGS and answer questions about the book and independent publishing. I will use zoom technology, allowing for interactive conversations with attendees. There will be multiple dates and times to choose from. I'll also preview my next project, Hired Guns.
  • A published list of names in a special “Bleacher Section” of supporters and honorees. This page – or pages – will be with the acknowledgments section of the book.
  • A book-themed gift box valued at $100. This box will include all the above as well as other items related to the book. A complimentary copy of my previous four books will also be included.

The Impact

I was blessed to be born into a family of readers. My blue-collar dad was an unofficial speed-reader and read dozens of books each year until he died at age 76. His farming parents were also readers. My mother is a lifelong reader – the daughter of a public educator. One of my earliest memories is learning to read mail-order Dr. Seuss books with my dad. I still have the first book I bought with my own money, a hardback, titled ‘Great Catchers of the Major Leagues.’ As a school-age boy, I often read multiple library books each week and spent many summer afternoons at the local public library. From my love for reading came a love to write my own fictional stories, which led to a newspaper career because I could be paid to write.

Reading is important. Reading strengthens vocabulary, decision-making, storytelling, and education. It is crucial for the advancement of our society. We all know that books help fuel reading. I believe my books entertain people and present authenticity around issues like faith, family, friendships, and community.

I have successfully published four books. All four books are available on amazon.com, through my website, and at select retail gift shops.

  • Brookwood Road (2014) has more than 50 strong reviews on amazon.com. It was a finalist in the Readers’ Favorite Book Award Contest and a finalist in the National Indie Excellence Awards.
  • Elm Street (2016) was a finalist in both the National Indie Excellence Awards and Book Excellence Awards contests, as well as a four-star finalist in the Indie Reader Discovery Awards contest.
  • Hickory Trail (2018) was a finalist in the National Indie Excellence Awards contest.
  • The Beauty Queen & The Reporter (2019) (a novella) won a second-place award in the Readers’ Favorite Book Award Contest.

Risks & Challenges

The greatest challenge to independent publishing is financing the project's publication. I have self-funded four projects, and the cost of publication often provides very little additional funding for advertising, promotion, contests, and inventory. Involving more people in this journey will provide a better book launch.

The greatest risk to this project is my death or serious illness. My son William, a creative artist and writer in his own right, is a silent critic and supporter of my independent publishing work. In my death or serious illness, William will assume the publisher role and ensure the book is published and marketed appropriately.

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond funding assistance, there are ways that people can help this effort.

  • Like my Facebook page and follow me on Instagram. Help by liking, commenting, and sharing posts about the book. With sharing, add your own two-sentence endorsement.
  • Read the book and write a short review or endorsement on the book’s amazon.com page. Reviews help circulation.
  • Invite me to visit with your book club – even through a virtual online meeting using a platform like zoom or Skype.

I still write love letters to my wife of 34 years.I am a native of metro Atlanta (Cumming, GA), and a 1981 graduate of the University of Georgia. My family relocated to Lexington, SC (near Columbia) in 1991. Our four sons were raised in Lexington. Learn more about me at scottdvaughan.com.I love baseball.Here's the thing. I only played for three years, between the ages of 8-10. I was terrible. Despite being a terrible player, I loved the game. My first newspaper job, while in high school, was as a sports writer. I eventually moved into news reporting, but always kept a hand in sports writing.I was the last person Terry Thompson should have asked to be a volunteer baseball coach back in 1982.  I will forever be thankful that he did. Over the next 30 years, coaching in three communities, my teams won 70 percent of the time. Looking back, I do wonder, "How in the world did that happen? To me?" My new book, NINE INNINGS, was actually the first book I started writing. The idea came out of my love for baseball, the fun I had while coaching boys ages 9-12, and the lessons I learned about life. I paused NINE INNINGS, in 2014, to write what became Brookwood Road, and then three other books followed. In 2020, it became time to reach back and finish NINE INNINGS. Here's a summary.A Summary of Nine InningsThere’s a melancholy that’s settled on Frank Wilcox as he enters the Empty Nest chapter of his life. His four sons are grown and gone, and with them went a 30-year span of coaching boy’s baseball in three different communities across the South. Life is suddenly quiet, and the quiet is maddening. As baseball season begins, Frank has an idea – he will travel to Turner Field in Atlanta and attend a Braves game all by himself. It’s during that game that Frank is reminded of the memories: a miraculous comeback, an answered prayer, a friendly mortician, a fox in the outfield, a search for new catcher’s equipment, four-piece chicken baskets, and draft strategy. Frank remembers hundreds of players with nicknames like Spongebob, Big G, Killer, E-Mar, Jet, Snooky, Hoss, Ace, Big A, Sugarman, and Vegas. The Braves game becomes a time of healing for Frank, and his return to Concord launches a new chapter in this life. This IndieGogo campaign is to raise $5,000 to fund NINE INNINGS' publication. Funds will pay for professional services, including cover design, editing and proofreading, interior formatting for print and Kindle editions, and advertising availability of the book. My desire in publishing is to present high-quality, bookstore-quality books that are well-written, well-edited and thoughtfully marketed. Though independently published, I like to envision my books in bookstores maintaining the same quality as corporately published books. I personally funded my first four books, and this campaign allows for partnerships in publishing the fifth book.I believe my novels can be read for pure enjoyment and fun. Still, I also believe there’s a greater message within them, whether it’s the importance of faith, family, friends, the mystery of romance, or the value of service and community. I hope readers have fun with my stories but are also moved in some measurable way to appreciate the past and present and look toward the future. Contributors to this campaign will help achieve this goal.What I Need & What You GetThe book is written.To offset publishing costs, I am looking to raise $5,000 to pay for the following professional services.Cover Design ($300.00)I contract with Graham Publishing Company, of Denver, CO, to help with cover design. This includes front, back, and spinal design and adjusting the cover to fit around the final book size before publishing. My goal is to have a cover that is bookstore-quality. Utilizing a publishing company ensures great graphic design and graphic design that is on point with publishing. I do not have a personal relationship with Graham Publishing Company, its partners, or employees, ensuring arms-length service not clouded by relationship.Formal Edit & Proofreading ($2,000.00)I contract with Stacey Lenn of Birmingham, AL as my formal editor and proofreader. The formal edit is a line-by-line edit for grammar, spelling, factual consistency, and clarity. I am provided with the ability to accept, reject, or rewrite around each editing suggestion. Just before publishing, Stacey provides a final proofread. I do not have a personal relationship with Stacey Lenn, her associates, or employees, ensuring arms-length service not clouded by relationship.Formatting ($1,200.00)I contract with Graham Publishing Company, of Denver, CO, for the formatting of my books. Formatting includes the pre-press setup for the print edition as well as the Kindle edition. This service also includes uploading both editions to the appropriate amazon.com servers. I do not have a personal relationship with Graham Publishing Company, its partners, or employees, ensuring arms-length service not clouded by relationship.Advertising ($1,500.00)I contract with Ben Sauls Productions to produce a book trailer that can be used in promotion. Funds will also be used for social media advertising to help with circulation.At varying levels, contributors to my campaign will have access to the following perks:
Books at my cost. Shipping is included.
Autographed books with personalization to individuals. Shipping is included.
Invitation to an online book club meeting, where I will read some of NINE INNINGS and answer questions about the book and independent publishing. I will use zoom technology, allowing for interactive conversations with attendees. There will be multiple dates and times to choose from. I'll also preview my next project, Hired Guns.
A published list of names in a special “Bleacher Section” of supporters and honorees. This page – or pages – will be with the acknowledgments section of the book.
A book-themed gift box valued at $100. This box will include all the above as well as other items related to the book. A complimentary copy of my previous four books will also be included.
The ImpactI was blessed to be born into a family of readers. My blue-collar dad was an unofficial speed-reader and read dozens of books each year until he died at age 76. His farming parents were also readers. My mother is a lifelong reader – the daughter of a public educator. One of my earliest memories is learning to read mail-order Dr. Seuss books with my dad. I still have the first book I bought with my own money, a hardback, titled ‘Great Catchers of the Major Leagues.’ As a school-age boy, I often read multiple library books each week and spent many summer afternoons at the local public library. From my love for reading came a love to write my own fictional stories, which led to a newspaper career because I could be paid to write.Reading is important. Reading strengthens vocabulary, decision-making, storytelling, and education. It is crucial for the advancement of our society. We all know that books help fuel reading. I believe my books entertain people and present authenticity around issues like faith, family, friendships, and community.I have successfully published four books. All four books are available on amazon.com, through my website, and at select retail gift shops.

Brookwood Road (2014) has more than 50 strong reviews on amazon.com. It was a finalist in the Readers’ Favorite Book Award Contest and a finalist in the National Indie Excellence Awards.

Elm Street (2016) was a finalist in both the National Indie Excellence Awards and Book Excellence Awards contests, as well as a four-star finalist in the Indie Reader Discovery Awards contest.

Hickory Trail (2018) was a finalist in the National Indie Excellence Awards contest.

The Beauty Queen & The Reporter (2019) (a novella) won a second-place award in the Readers’ Favorite Book Award Contest.
Risks & ChallengesThe greatest challenge to independent publishing is financing the project's publication. I have self-funded four projects, and the cost of publication often provides very little additional funding for advertising, promotion, contests, and inventory. Involving more people in this journey will provide a better book launch.The greatest risk to this project is my death or serious illness. My son William, a creative artist and writer in his own right, is a silent critic and supporter of my independent publishing work. In my death or serious illness, William will assume the publisher role and ensure the book is published and marketed appropriately.Other Ways You Can HelpBeyond funding assistance, there are ways that people can help this effort.
Like my Facebook page and follow me on Instagram. Help by liking, commenting, and sharing posts about the book. With sharing, add your own two-sentence endorsement.
Read the book and write a short review or endorsement on the book’s amazon.com page. Reviews help circulation.
Invite me to visit with your book club – even through a virtual online meeting using a platform like zoom or Skype.

story:
"Many Americans jokingly point to 2020 as a fluke year of bad luck and unfortunate circumstances. But 2020 was not a bug in our system — it was a feature. It was the result of turning public services into for-profit businesses, of undervaluing and underpaying workers, of favoring a heavily militarized world over human security and wellbeing. It was the consequence of unfettered private enterprises and the idolization of the CEOs and innovators that run them. And it is what happens when we believe in free markets over fair markets and competition over cooperation. For several decades, a growing fealty to individualism in every aspect of our lives has unleashed social pathologies on the American experience that blind us to our neighbors' equal claims to humanity. And all it took was a virus smaller than a speck of dust to expose this reality and send our country into a tailspin."

– Rugged Republic: American Individualism and the Makings of Our Collective Crisis

 

About the Book

Rugged Republic is a passionate and personal analysis on why America's obsession with individualism threatens our future. Our ability to rise to the occasion in these moments of crisis depends on our ability to cooperate and come together, yet we are divided, isolated, and lonelier than ever. America is atomized and we have rugged individualism to blame.

For several decades, our policies and politics have broken down our social bonds and connections and emphasized a need to focus on our own self-interest, making it impossible for us to come together in times we need it most. Though "rugged individualism" is often cited as integral to the American mindset and psyche, it in fact hinders effective policymaking and justifies our nation's lack of empathy and disregard for the welfare of our fellow Americans. And from state capitol protests to grocery store fights over masks, COVID-19 put this on full display.

My name is Lucas Rivers and I am the author of Rugged Republic: American Individualism and the Makings of Our Collective Crisis, a book that began in the early weeks of the COVID-19 lockdown as we tried to make sense of the tragedies unfolding around us. In reading this book, I hope to shed light on why American individualism is responsible for our failed response to the coronavirus pandemic and why, unless we act, we will fail the collective challenges that await us in the 21st century – the climate emergency, economic inequality, and social injustice. I hope that, in reading this book, readers will recognize that the hyper-individualism that has taken over our society threatens our country’s future, but that not all hope is lost if we act now.

 

What I Need

Unless you're famous or rich (or both), publishing a book is costly. My publisher has set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing this book. Pre-sale dollars raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in September 2021
  • The cover design of my book (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder, promise!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats)
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this fall

With your help today:

  • 120 pre-sales = A paperback and ebook
  • 150 pre-sales = A hardcover edition
  • 200 pre-sales = An audiobook


What You'll Get

I am offering some exclusive rewards and perks for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book
  • You will have the opportunity to become a beta reader and provide early feedback to help refine and shape the final product
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title (what you see are placeholders!)
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process

And much more!

 

About the Author

Lucas Rivers is an environmental, social, and governance (ESG) professional at a Fortune 500, where he works to ensure that private sector actions are aligned with the change needed for a more sustainable and just future. He is currently an advisor to several nonprofit organizations focused on education, social justice, and climate change. He received his Master of Public Administration in Social Policy from Columbia University and is a former Fulbright recipient.

Lucas now lives in New York City with his husband but grew up in a small, post-industrial town along the Erie Canal in Upstate New York. Witnessing the mass exodus of jobs and opportunities, he saw firsthand the urgent need for a strong social safety net. 

He is a self-described futurist working to tackle the many challenges brought on by the changing technological, economic, political, and environmental tides. For more information, you can connect with him at riversl0425@gmail.com and on Twitter at @lucas_rivers.

 

A Sneak Peek into Rugged Republic

Part 1: In a Time of Monsters explores our cultural history of “rugged individualism” — from the frontier spirit of the pioneers to the entrepreneurial tenacity of Silicon Valley. And it shows how changes in our economic policies and political philosophies in the late 20th century ushered in a new era of free-market thinking that not only radicalized our individualist tendencies but thrived on our pursuit of self-interest and the breakdown of the common good. When combined with the new tools and technologies of the digital world, we find ourselves face-to-face with the monsters that have torn apart American society.

Part 2: The Atomized American offers a series of portraits around the roles we all inhabit as individuals in the American project — citizen, neighbor, consumer, and worker — and how a new and exaggerated form of American individualism has introduced itself in every aspect of our lives. In each of these roles, the reader will see authentic examples and lived experiences of how this hyper-radicalized sense of individualism has chipped away at the social bonds, public interest, and common good needed to stave off disaster in the 21st century.

Part 3: Towards a Solidarity State shows how we must embrace the task of developing an alternative vision for America’s future that builds upon cooperation, collaboration, and a renewed sense of the public interest. We must abandon the rugged republic and pursue the full realization of what I call the solidarity state — a new vision of the American project with policies and practices that foster social connections, distributes resources and power, renews active citizenship, rebalances our public and private sectors, and rebuilds a sense of security and safety for all Americans.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each preorder tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  1. Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #RuggedRepublic and tag me on Twitter @lucas_rivers and on Instagram @lrivers93. You can also tag my publisher, @NewDegreePress, so that they can help amplify your efforts.
  2. You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  3. Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or coworkers who you think would enjoy it via text or DM on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support! It means the world.

Lucas

story:
Overview

His eyes growing accustomed to the light, he examines each of us in turn. When he takes in the .32, and me holding it, his nose twitches....

"Who are you?" The prosecutor speaks in a hoarse whisper.

"We are the people's court, bringing you and your kind to justice." A line Phyl must have been waiting a long time to use.

"Would you like a glass of water or something?" asks Norbert with genuine concern.

In 1982 the police in a western Canadian city receive a communiqué from the "Berkman Brigade". The communiqué demands freedom for Brigade member Louis Del Grande, along with payment of one million dollars, in return for the release of a missing Crown Prosecutor. A search is immediately launched for the hostage and his abductors. Weeks later the authorities stumble onto the group’s location. Deaths occur and arrests are made. Sandra Jennings, the least political member of the Brigade, receives the heaviest sentence: life imprisonment.

As the author I have witnessed Vancouver—the city where I was born—undergo huge transformations during my lifetime. Through Thorns is my first novel, and yes, it is a work of fiction. However, the story reflects upon some extremist fringes of 1960s to '80s counterculture as well as subsequent lived experiences of the boomer generation.

Parts of this novel were written back in the early '80s, with the original intent being a dark comedy. But the project was shelved when I was hired for a temporary job—a job that turned into a 30 year career. The story taken up again upon retirement became more serious in tone.

I am very excited to see this book at last on the way to being published. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Iguana Books (http://iguanabooks.ca/ ) is a hybrid publisher. For the books it selects for publication the author pays upfront costs of of copy editing, cover design, print and ebook formatting, and distribution. Any contributions I receive above the target amount will go toward promotion and marketing once the book is released.

In addition to covering publication costs this campaign  will, in effect, pre-test the market for Through Thorns and hopefully generate some advance sales. The perks I offer are editions in various formats: ebook, paperback and hardback. In addition, major contributors will be named in an acknowledgement section of the book.

 

The Impact

Memoirs and fictional accounts of 1960s and beyond counterculture have emerged almost as a subgenre in contemporary literature. Through Thorns fits in that category and will appeal to those who were involved in or exposed to alternative lifestyles 'back in the day.'

I am hopeful that the release of this book will coincide with the lifting of all or most of the current pandemic restrictions on public gatherings and other activities. That being the case I would invite all those who helped out to a launch party celebration.

I strongly believe that you will find Through Thorns to be an entertaining read.

 

Risks & Challenges

 I am committed to publishing Through Thorns whether or not this crowdfunding initiative is fully successful.  Any shortfall would mainly affect the degree to which promotion/marketing could be done. The risk, which I am prepared to bear, is that book sales fall short of a break even point.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not in a position to donate, I hope you will read Through Thorns when it becomes available. If you like the book please recommend it on any social media platforms to which you are connected. I am grateful for your interest and support.

story:
The Story of Back to Me

Have you ever looked in the mirror and not recognized the person staring back at you? If so, this book is a breadcrumb meant to lead you back to the real you.

My name is Chandra Kennett and I’m the author of Back To Me, a memoir in which I share a lifetime of lessons, both learned and unlearned, on the journey back to myself. This book explores how unresolved childhood trauma can lead to a midlife “crisis,” and eventually, a renaissance. A reawakening to your true self. The realization of who you are and what you want.

In Back to Me, I share personal stories, along with the lessons that became clear in retrospect. A lifetime of hiding and people-pleasing led me into some precarious situations, but through years of healing work and personal growth, I’m now able to share my stories from a different perspective. Although hard at times to write, I promise to show you how I persevered and eventually, made my way back to me.

My hope is that Back to Me becomes a permission slip for you to figure out what you really want and to remember who you really are. I also hope it helps you understand that your past does not dictate your present, or your future. You are in control of your happiness.

This book is for you if you’ve ever felt stuck, lost, or fed-up. If you’ve ever felt like the passenger, rather than the captain of your own life. If you’ve ever felt like you weren’t worthy of dreaming big, or of being truly happy. Because, spoiler alert, you are worthy of all that and more. You are worthy simply because you are you.

 

About Chandra

Chandra Kennett is a recovering people pleaser and recovering cubicle dweller. She is the proud owner of Moonshine Communications, an agency specializing in social media management. She is also a certified life and career coach, proud mom of two super cool kids, and a self-proclaimed pop culture nerd.

Chandra always wanted to be an author and took advantage of the slowed pace of a global pandemic to put her dream into motion. She is fascinated by the human condition and how healing one’s past can positively impact one’s future. Personal development and self actualization are her jam.

When she’s not reading or writing, Chandra feels most like herself in a yoga class or on a hike in the mountains of her adopted home state, New Hampshire. Travel, deep conversations, and music light her soul on fire, and Mexican food is her love language.

 

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover artwork.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Standard Tiers:
Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we'll get an audiobook edition


International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form https://forms.gle/1jfg2QqMJwWwMgPa6 to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.
 


Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days).

Here's how:

  • At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)
  • Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  • When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

 

Please use hashtag #backtomebook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Instagram: @moonshinecoach / @newdegreepress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!!
Chandra
story_txt:
The Story of Back to Me
Have you ever looked in the mirror and not recognized the person staring back at you? If so, this book is a breadcrumb meant to lead you back to the real you.My name is Chandra Kennett and I’m the author of Back To Me, a memoir in which I share a lifetime of lessons, both learned and unlearned, on the journey back to myself. This book explores how unresolved childhood trauma can lead to a midlife “crisis,” and eventually, a renaissance. A reawakening to your true self. The realization of who you are and what you want.In Back to Me, I share personal stories, along with the lessons that became clear in retrospect. A lifetime of hiding and people-pleasing led me into some precarious situations, but through years of healing work and personal growth, I’m now able to share my stories from a different perspective. Although hard at times to write, I promise to show you how I persevered and eventually, made my way back to me.My hope is that Back to Me becomes a permission slip for you to figure out what you really want and to remember who you really are. I also hope it helps you understand that your past does not dictate your present, or your future. You are in control of your happiness.This book is for you if you’ve ever felt stuck, lost, or fed-up. If you’ve ever felt like the passenger, rather than the captain of your own life. If you’ve ever felt like you weren’t worthy of dreaming big, or of being truly happy. Because, spoiler alert, you are worthy of all that and more. You are worthy simply because you are you.
 
About Chandra
Chandra Kennett is a recovering people pleaser and recovering cubicle dweller. She is the proud owner of Moonshine Communications, an agency specializing in social media management. She is also a certified life and career coach, proud mom of two super cool kids, and a self-proclaimed pop culture nerd.Chandra always wanted to be an author and took advantage of the slowed pace of a global pandemic to put her dream into motion. She is fascinated by the human condition and how healing one’s past can positively impact one’s future. Personal development and self actualization are her jam.When she’s not reading or writing, Chandra feels most like herself in a yoga class or on a hike in the mountains of her adopted home state, New Hampshire. Travel, deep conversations, and music light her soul on fire, and Mexican food is her love language.
